TEXT.English: Prepare to be added to the long list of tribes who wouldn't leave us alone, and paid the price for it.
TEXT.French: Préparez vous à être ajoutés à la longue liste de ceux qui ne nous ont pas laissés seuls, et à en payer le prix.
TEXT.German: Bereitet Euch darauf vor, Euch in die lange Liste der Stämme einzureihen, die uns nicht in Ruhe ließen und den Preis dafür zahlen mussten.
TEXT.Italian: Prepare to be added to the long list of tribes who wouldn't leave us alone, and paid the price for it.
TEXT.Spanish: Preparaos para ser añadidos a la larga lista de tribus que no quisieron dejarnos en paz, y pagaron el precio por ello.

TEXT.English: We are students of the arcane, not warlords. We will be good neighbors as long as you realize that mana nodes belong to us.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes des étudiants des arcanes, point des guerriers. Nous serons bons voisins tant que vous accepterez que les nœuds de mana nous appartiennent.
TEXT.German: Wir sind dem Studium der Magie verpflichtet, nicht dem Krieg. Wir werden sicher gute Nachbarn sein, wenn Ihr einseht, dass alle Manaquellen unser sind.
TEXT.Italian: We are students of the arcane, not warlords. We will be good neighbors as long as you realize that mana nodes belong to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Somos estudiantes de lo arcano, no guerreros. Seremos buenos vecinos siempre y cuando sepáis que los nodos de maná nos pertenecen.

TEXT.English: Why do you keep coming here? It is suspicious... I'd rather not see you for awhile.
TEXT.French: Pourquoi persistez-vous à venir ici ? C'est suspect... Je préfèrerais ne pas vous voir un bon moment.
TEXT.German: Weshalb kommt Ihr immer wieder her? Das ist verdächtig... Ich würde Euch lieber für eine Weile nicht mehr sehen.
TEXT.Italian: Why do you keep coming here? It is suspicious... I'd rather not see you for awhile.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Por qué seguís viniendo aquí? Es sospechoso... Preferiría no volver a veros por un tiempo.

TEXT.English: Good, without warfare we can continue our studies. I trust you can find your own way out?
TEXT.French: Bien, sans ces préoccupations militaires, nous pouvons poursuivre nos études. Je crois que vous pourrez trouver vous-même la sortie ?
TEXT.German: Gut, ohne die Belastungen der Kriegsführung können wir nun mit unseren Forschungen fortfahren. Ich nehme an, Ihr findet allein hinaus?
TEXT.Italian: Good, without warfare we can continue our studies. I trust you can find your own way out?
TEXT.Spanish: Bien, sin un conflicto podemos continuar con nuestros estudios. Creo que vos mismo podréis encontrar una salida, ¿no?

TEXT.English: You have awakened the blood of heroes coursing through our veins. It is too late for you to call this off!
TEXT.French: Vous avez réveillé le sang des héros courant dans nos veines. Il est trop tard pour le juguler !
TEXT.German: Ihr habt das Blut der Helden, das durch unsere Adern jagt, erweckt. Ihr könnt es jetzt nicht mehr besänftigen!
TEXT.Italian: You have awakened the blood of heroes coursing through our veins. It is too late for you to call this off!
TEXT.Spanish: Habéis despertado la sangre de héroes que corre por nuestras venas. ¡Ya es demasiado tarde para paralo!

TEXT.English: Well met, [CT_NAME]. Let us share our secrets, hmmm?
TEXT.French: Très bien, [CT_NAME]. Partageons nos secrets, hmmm ?
TEXT.German: Hoch erfreut, [CT_NAME]. Lasst uns unsere Geheimnisse teilen, hmmm?
TEXT.Italian: Well met, [CT_NAME]. Let us share our secrets, hmmm?
TEXT.Spanish: Bienhallado, [CT_NAME]. Dejadnos compartir nuestros secretos, ¿hmmm?

TEXT.English: I guess I could spare a moment to listen to you... but you had better be more civil than before.
TEXT.French: Je pense que je peux gaspiller un instant pour vous écouter... Mais vous feriez bien d'être plus courtois que précédemment.
TEXT.German: Einen Moment habe ich sicherlich für Euch... doch verhaltet Euch zivilisierter als letztes Mal.
TEXT.Italian: I guess I could spare a moment to listen to you... but you had better be more civil than before.
TEXT.Spanish: Supongo que puedo dedicar un momento para escucharos... pero mejor tendréis que ser más cortés que la última vez.

TEXT.English: You see us as weak. Many do, all fools who can see only outward signs of power. We have brought the demise of stronger than you.
TEXT.French: Vous nous considérez faibles. Beaucoup le font, tous les fous qui voient que les signes apparents du pouvoir. Nous avons apporté la mort à de plus puissants que vous.
TEXT.German: Wir scheinen Euch schwach. Das tun viele, Narren allesamt, die nur die sichtbaren Zeichen der Macht erkennen. Wir haben schon stärkeren Völkern als Eurem den Untergang gebracht.
TEXT.Italian: You see us as weak. Many do, all fools who can see only outward signs of power. We have brought the demise of stronger than you.
TEXT.Spanish: Vos nos veis débiles. Muchos lo hacen, todos unos idiotas que sólo ven los signos de poder aparentes. Hemos traído la muerte de otros más fuertes que vos.

TEXT.English: We prefer to investigate the mysteries of creation, [CT_NAME], but to get what we need, we are more than willing to use the arcane forces at our disposal.
TEXT.French: Nous préférons étudier les mystères de la création, [CT_NAME], mais pour obtenir ce dont nous avons besoin, nous sommes bien décidés à utiliser les forces des arcanes à notre disposition.
TEXT.German: Wir ziehen es vor, die Mysterien der Schöpfung zu erforschen, [CT_NAME]. Um jedoch unseren Willen durchzusetzen, sind wir mehr als bereit, auch von unseren magischen Kräften Gebrauch zu machen.
TEXT.Italian: We prefer to investigate the mysteries of creation, [CT_NAME], but to get what we need, we are more than willing to use the arcane forces at our disposal.
TEXT.Spanish: Nosotros preferimos investigar los misterios de la creación, [CT_NAME], pero para conseguir lo que necesitamos, estamos más que preparados para utilizar las fuerzas arcanas a nuestra disposición.

TEXT.English: "It seems the mysteries of creation are to be forever shrouded from man. May your glories turn to ruin for this betrayal."
TEXT.French: "Il semble que les mystères de la création seront toujours dissimulés à l'homme. Puisse votre gloire tomber en ruines pour cette traîtrise."
TEXT.German: "Es scheint, als sollten die Geheimnisse der Schöpfung für immer vor den Menschen verschleiert bleiben. Für diesen Verrat möge sich Euer Ruhm, zu Eurem Niedergang wandeln."
TEXT.Italian: "It seems the mysteries of creation are to be forever shrouded from man. May your glories turn to ruin for this betrayal."
TEXT.Spanish: "It seems the mysteries of creation are to be forever shrouded from man. May your glories turn to ruin for this betrayal."

TEXT.English: "I was destined for greater than this world. I will leave you to your petty squabbles."
TEXT.French: "I was destined for greater than this world. I will leave you to your petty squabbles."
TEXT.German: "Mir wurde es bestimmt, über diese Welt hinauszuwachsen. Ich überlasse Euch nun Eurem belanglosem Geplänkel."
TEXT.Italian: "I was destined for greater than this world. I will leave you to your petty squabbles."
TEXT.Spanish: "I was destined for greater than this world. I will leave you to your petty squabbles."

TEXT.English: Mother says you've got to die, so you've got to die.
TEXT.French: La Mère dit que vous devez mourir. Vous devez donc mourir.
TEXT.German: Mutter sagt, Ihr habt zu sterben - und so werdet Ihr nun sterben.
TEXT.Italian: Mother says you've got to die, so you've got to die.
TEXT.Spanish: Mother says you've got to die, so you've got to die.

TEXT.English: You have not heard of us before? That is because Mother did not wish you to hear.
TEXT.French: Vous n'avez pas entendu parler de nous avant? C'est parce que la Mère ne voulait pas que vous l'entendiez.
TEXT.German: Warum Ihr zuvor noch nichts von uns gehört habt? Weil Mutter das nicht wünschte.
TEXT.Italian: You have not heard of us before? That is because Mother did not wish you to hear.
TEXT.Spanish: You have not heard of us before? That is because Mother did not wish you to hear.

TEXT.English: Begone, or I'll feed you to the spiders.
TEXT.French: Partez, ou je vous donnerai à manger aux Araignées.
TEXT.German: Verschwindet, oder ich verfüttere Euch an die Spinnen.
TEXT.Italian: Begone, or I'll feed you to the spiders.
TEXT.Spanish: Begone, or I'll feed you to the spiders.

TEXT.English: Mother is satisfied. For now.
TEXT.French: La Mère est satisfaite. Pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: Mutter ist zufriedengestellt. Für den Moment.
TEXT.Italian: Mother is satisfied. For now.
TEXT.Spanish: Mother is satisfied. For now.

TEXT.English: Fool. Mother still hungers for the flesh of your people.
TEXT.French: Pauvre fou, la Mère a toujours faim de la chair de votre peuple.
TEXT.German: Narr. Mutter giert noch immer nach dem Fleisch Eurer Leute.
TEXT.Italian: Fool. Mother still hungers for the flesh of your people.
TEXT.Spanish: Fool. Mother still hungers for the flesh of your people.

TEXT.English: Come, [CT_NAME], soon you will see. Soon she shall reward those who have been good friends to her favoured servants.
TEXT.French: Venez, [CT_NAME], vous verrez bientôt. Bientôt elle récompensera ceux qui ont été de bons amis avec ses serviteurs favoris.
TEXT.German: Kommt, [CT_NAME], bald werdet Ihr sehen. Bald wird SIE diejenigen belohnen, die freundlich waren zu ihren Lieblingssklaven.
TEXT.Italian: Come, [CT_NAME], soon you will see. Soon she shall reward those who have been good friends to her favoured servants.
TEXT.Spanish: Come, [CT_NAME], soon you will see. Soon she shall reward those who have been good friends to her favoured servants.

TEXT.English: I keep a list of those who anger me, [CT_NAME]. You're on it. What do you have to offer?
TEXT.French: Je tiens une liste de ceux qui m'ont déçu, [CT_NAME], et vous êtes dessus. Qu'avez vous à offrir ?
TEXT.German: Ich führe eine Liste mit diejenigen, die mich verärgern, [CT_NAME]. Eür Name steht auch darauf. Was habt Ihr anzubieten?
TEXT.Italian: I keep a list of those who anger me, [CT_NAME]. You're on it. What do you have to offer?
TEXT.Spanish: I keep a list of those who anger me, [CT_NAME]. You're on it. What do you have to offer?

TEXT.English: That suits us. You got anything else?
TEXT.French: Cela nous convient. Vous voulez autre chose ?
TEXT.German: Das gefällt uns. Habt Ihr noch etwas?
TEXT.Italian: That suits us. You got anything else?
TEXT.Spanish: That suits us. You got anything else?

TEXT.English: Mother says no.
TEXT.French: La Mère refuse.
TEXT.German: Mutter sagt nein.
TEXT.Italian: Mother says no.
TEXT.Spanish: Mother says no.

TEXT.English: We're done now. Run home, okay?
TEXT.French: Nous en avons fini. Retournez chez vous, d'accord?
TEXT.German: Wir sind jetzt fertig. Lauft heim, ja?
TEXT.Italian: We're done now. Run home, okay?
TEXT.Spanish: We're done now. Run home, okay?

TEXT.English: The offer is pleasing.
TEXT.French: Cette offre est intéressante.
TEXT.German: Das Angebot ist angemessen.
TEXT.Italian: The offer is pleasing.
TEXT.Spanish: The offer is pleasing.

TEXT.English: It is unwise to deny us, [CT_NAME]. The time will come when we shall not bother to ask.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas très sage de refuser, [CT_NAME]. Le temps viendra où nous ne prendrons plus la peine de demander.
TEXT.German: Es ist unklug, uns etwas abzuschlagen, [CT_NAME]. Es wird eine Zeit kommen, da werden wir uns nicht mehr damit aufhalten, zu fragen.
TEXT.Italian: It is unwise to deny us, [CT_NAME]. The time will come when we shall not bother to ask.
TEXT.Spanish: It is unwise to deny us, [CT_NAME]. The time will come when we shall not bother to ask.

TEXT.English: A setback. We can wait. She can wait. We will return. She will destroy you.
TEXT.French: Un contretemps. Nous pouvons attendre. Elle peut attendre. Nous reviendrons. Elle vous détruira.
TEXT.German: Ein Rückschlag. Wir können warten. SIE kann warten. Wir kommen wieder. SIE wird Euch vernichten.
TEXT.Italian: A setback. We can wait. She can wait. We will return. She will destroy you.
TEXT.Spanish: A setback. We can wait. She can wait. We will return. She will destroy you.

TEXT.English: Mother desires war with your people. There will be war.
TEXT.French: Mother desires war with your people. There will be war.
TEXT.German: Mother desires war with your people. There will be war.
TEXT.Italian: Mother desires war with your people. There will be war.
TEXT.Spanish: Mother desires war with your people. There will be war.

TEXT.English: Listen, [CT_NAME], I hereby renounce your pathetic protection.
TEXT.French: Listen, [CT_NAME], I hereby renounce your pathetic protection.
TEXT.German: Listen, [CT_NAME], I hereby renounce your pathetic protection.
TEXT.Italian: Listen, [CT_NAME], I hereby renounce your pathetic protection.
TEXT.Spanish: Listen, [CT_NAME], I hereby renounce your pathetic protection.

TEXT.English: The Archosian have been sieged. We are weak, in need of assisstance. It shames me, but will you assist us?
TEXT.French: The Archosian have been sieged. We are weak, in need of assisstance. It shames me, but will you assist us?
TEXT.German: The Archosian have been sieged. We are weak, in need of assisstance. It shames me, but will you assist us?
TEXT.Italian: The Archosian have been sieged. We are weak, in need of assisstance. It shames me, but will you assist us?
TEXT.Spanish: The Archosian have been sieged. We are weak, in need of assisstance. It shames me, but will you assist us?

TEXT.English: Ah, what's this? A new nation? Yes, they will be fun for the spiders...
TEXT.French: Ah, what's this? A new nation? Yes, they will be fun for the spiders...
TEXT.German: Ah, what's this? A new nation? Yes, they will be fun for the spiders...
TEXT.Italian: Ah, what's this? A new nation? Yes, they will be fun for the spiders...
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, what's this? A new nation? Yes, they will be fun for the spiders....

TEXT.English: Unless you wish to feed the next generation of spiders, I suggest you leave.
TEXT.French: Unless you wish to feed the next generation of spiders, I suggest you leave.
TEXT.German: Unless you wish to feed the next generation of spiders, I suggest you leave.
TEXT.Italian: Unless you wish to feed the next generation of spiders, I suggest you leave.
TEXT.Spanish: Unless you wish to feed the next generation of spiders, I suggest you leave.

TEXT.English: Sometimes peace is necessary, if only to rebuild your army for another war.
TEXT.French: Sometimes peace is necessary, if only to rebuild your army for another war.
TEXT.German: Sometimes peace is necessary, if only to rebuild your army for another war.
TEXT.Italian: Sometimes peace is necessary, if only to rebuild your army for another war.
TEXT.Spanish: Sometimes peace is necessary, if only to rebuild your army for another war.

TEXT.English: Ha! You still believe you can defeat us in war? Wait until the spiders swarm upon your cities.
TEXT.French: Ha! You still believe you can defeat us in war? Wait until the spiders swarm upon your cities.
TEXT.German: Ha! You still believe you can defeat us in war? Wait until the spiders swarm upon your cities.
TEXT.Italian: Ha! You still believe you can defeat us in war? Wait until the spiders swarm upon your cities.
TEXT.Spanish: Ha! You still believe you can defeat us in war? Wait until the spiders swarm upon your cities.

TEXT.English: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! Have you tried the Spiderwine?
TEXT.French: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! Have you tried the Spiderwine?
TEXT.German: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! Have you tried the Spiderwine?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! Have you tried the Spiderwine?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, [CT_NAME]! Have you tried the Spiderwine?

TEXT.English: Go, [CT_NAME], speak up! Tell me your plans.
TEXT.French: Go, [CT_NAME], speak up! Tell me your plans.
TEXT.German: Go, [CT_NAME], speak up! Tell me your plans.
TEXT.Italian: Go, [CT_NAME], speak up! Tell me your plans.
TEXT.Spanish: Go, [CT_NAME], speak up! Tell me your plans.

TEXT.English: Speak up, [CT_NAME]! I have things to kill.
TEXT.French: Speak up, [CT_NAME]! I have things to kill.
TEXT.German: Speak up, [CT_NAME]! I have things to kill.
TEXT.Italian: Speak up, [CT_NAME]! I have things to kill.
TEXT.Spanish: Speak up, [CT_NAME]! I have things to kill.

TEXT.English: Speak up, [CT_NAME]. The spiders are hungry and are seeking a meal.
TEXT.French: Speak up, [CT_NAME]. The spiders are hungry and are seeking a meal.
TEXT.German: Speak up, [CT_NAME]. The spiders are hungry and are seeking a meal.
TEXT.Italian: Speak up, [CT_NAME]. The spiders are hungry and are seeking a meal.
TEXT.Spanish: Speak up, [CT_NAME]. The spiders are hungry and are seeking a meal.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], welcome. We were just wondering what to feed the spiders.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], welcome. We were just wondering what to feed the spiders.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], welcome. We were just wondering what to feed the spiders.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], welcome. We were just wondering what to feed the spiders.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], welcome. We were just wondering what to feed the spiders.

TEXT.English: Yes, this is a good idea. You had a good head on your shoulders.
TEXT.French: Yes, this is a good idea. You had a good head on your shoulders.
TEXT.German: Yes, this is a good idea. You had a good head on your shoulders.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, this is a good idea. You had a good head on your shoulders.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, this is a good idea. You had a good head on your shoulders.

TEXT.English: If Mother smiled upon us, you'd be dead right now. But we must accept.
TEXT.French: If Mother smiled upon us, you'd be dead right now. But we must accept.
TEXT.German: If Mother smiled upon us, you'd be dead right now. But we must accept.
TEXT.Italian: If Mother smiled upon us, you'd be dead right now. But we must accept.
TEXT.Spanish: If Mother smiled upon us, you'd be dead right now. But we must accept.

TEXT.English: Sorry, friend. That just won't do.
TEXT.French: Sorry, friend. That just won't do.
TEXT.German: Sorry, friend. That just won't do.
TEXT.Italian: Sorry, friend. That just won't do.
TEXT.Spanish: Sorry, friend. That just won't do.

TEXT.English: Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know when I'm being deceived. Give me a better deal or I'll throw you to the spiders!
TEXT.French: Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know when I'm being deceived. Give me a better deal or I'll throw you to the spiders!
TEXT.German: Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know when I'm being deceived. Give me a better deal or I'll throw you to the spiders!
TEXT.Italian: Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know when I'm being deceived. Give me a better deal or I'll throw you to the spiders!
TEXT.Spanish: Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know when I'm being deceived. Give me a better deal or I'll throw you to the spiders!

TEXT.English: I'm sure this will benefit us. Both of us.
TEXT.French: I'm sure this will benefit us. Both of us.
TEXT.German: I'm sure this will benefit us. Both of us.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sure this will benefit us. Both of us.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sure this will benefit us. Both of us.

TEXT.English: I suppose we could do that.
TEXT.French: I suppose we could do that.
TEXT.German: I suppose we could do that.
TEXT.Italian: I suppose we could do that.
TEXT.Spanish: I suppose we could do that.

TEXT.English: Ha! Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know a good deal. I accept.
TEXT.French: Ha! Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know a good deal. I accept.
TEXT.German: Ha! Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know a good deal. I accept.
TEXT.Italian: Ha! Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know a good deal. I accept.
TEXT.Spanish: Ha! Just because I keep the company of spiders does not mean I don't know a good deal. I accept.

TEXT.English: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.French: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.German: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.Italian: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.Spanish: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.

TEXT.English: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.French: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.German: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.Italian: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.
TEXT.Spanish: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We have other matters to attend to.

TEXT.English: You expect help from us after the way you've treated us? Get out, you dog, before you become spider food!
TEXT.French: You expect help from us after the way you've treated us? Get out, you dog, before you become spider food!
TEXT.German: You expect help from us after the way you've treated us? Get out, you dog, before you become spider food!
TEXT.Italian: You expect help from us after the way you've treated us? Get out, you dog, before you become spider food!
TEXT.Spanish: You expect help from us after the way you've treated us? Get out, you dog, before you become spider food!

TEXT.English: Here. Give this some thought.
TEXT.French: Here. Give this some thought.
TEXT.German: Here. Give this some thought.
TEXT.Italian: Here. Give this some thought.
TEXT.Spanish: Here. Give this some thought.

TEXT.English: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We don't deal with spider food.
TEXT.French: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We don't deal with spider food.
TEXT.German: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We don't deal with spider food.
TEXT.Italian: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We don't deal with spider food.
TEXT.Spanish: I apologize, [CT_NAME]. We don't deal with spider food.

TEXT.English: We will give you nothing. You will take the venom of our spiders before you get what you want.
TEXT.French: We will give you nothing. You will take the venom of our spiders before you get what you want.
TEXT.German: We will give you nothing. You will take the venom of our spiders before you get what you want.
TEXT.Italian: We will give you nothing. You will take the venom of our spiders before you get what you want.
TEXT.Spanish: We will give you nothing. You will take the venom of our spiders before you get what you want.

TEXT.English: Enough blood has been spilt to please Mother. Sign this and let's be done with it.
TEXT.French: Enough blood has been spilt to please Mother. Sign this and let's be done with it.
TEXT.German: Enough blood has been spilt to please Mother. Sign this and let's be done with it.
TEXT.Italian: Enough blood has been spilt to please Mother. Sign this and let's be done with it.
TEXT.Spanish: Enough blood has been spilt to please Mother. Sign this and let's be done with it.

TEXT.English: Thank you. Care for some Spiderwine?
TEXT.French: Thank you. Care for some Spiderwine?
TEXT.German: Thank you. Care for some Spiderwine?
TEXT.Italian: Thank you. Care for some Spiderwine?
TEXT.Spanish: Thank you. Care for some Spiderwine?

TEXT.English: Listen, [CT_NAME]. I'm a leader of a nation that has integrated with spiders. We could crush you within a moment. Maybe something might deter us...
TEXT.French: Listen, [CT_NAME]. I'm a leader of a nation that has integrated with spiders. We could crush you within a moment. Maybe something might deter us...
TEXT.German: Listen, [CT_NAME]. I'm a leader of a nation that has integrated with spiders. We could crush you within a moment. Maybe something might deter us...
TEXT.Italian: Listen, [CT_NAME]. I'm a leader of a nation that has integrated with spiders. We could crush you within a moment. Maybe something might deter us...
TEXT.Spanish: Listen, [CT_NAME]. I'm a leader of a nation that has integrated with spiders. We could crush you within a moment. Maybe something might deter us...

TEXT.English: Listen, [CT_NAME]. We're in need of something to continue the Archosian race and you have it. What do you say?
TEXT.French: Listen, [CT_NAME]. We're in need of something to continue the Archosian race and you have it. What do you say?
TEXT.German: Listen, [CT_NAME]. We're in need of something to continue the Archosian race and you have it. What do you say?
TEXT.Italian: Listen, [CT_NAME]. We're in need of something to continue the Archosian race and you have it. What do you say?
TEXT.Spanish: Listen, [CT_NAME]. We're in need of something to continue the Archosian race and you have it. What do you say?

TEXT.English: We need some help. Mind helping us out, friend?
TEXT.French: We need some help. Mind helping us out, friend?
TEXT.German: We need some help. Mind helping us out, friend?
TEXT.Italian: We need some help. Mind helping us out, friend?
TEXT.Spanish: We need some help. Mind helping us out, friend?

TEXT.English: You think that we couldn't hunt you down and kill you? We know every crack of your palace, every flaw in your walls, we can kill with you just one order. No, your demand is rejected, peasant.
TEXT.French: You think that we couldn't hunt you down and kill you? We know every crack of your palace, every flaw in your walls, we can kill with you just one order. No, your demand is rejected, peasant.
TEXT.German: You think that we couldn't hunt you down and kill you? We know every crack of your palace, every flaw in your walls, we can kill with you just one order. No, your demand is rejected, peasant.
TEXT.Italian: You think that we couldn't hunt you down and kill you? We know every crack of your palace, every flaw in your walls, we can kill with you just one order. No, your demand is rejected, peasant.
TEXT.Spanish: You think that we couldn't hunt you down and kill you? We know every crack of your palace, every flaw in your walls, we can kill with you just one order. No, your demand is rejected, peasant.

TEXT.English: Oh, yeah. Take what you can while our elder spiders die. We'll have revenge.
TEXT.French: Oh, yeah. Take what you can while our elder spiders die. We'll have revenge.
TEXT.German: Oh, yeah. Take what you can while our elder spiders die. We'll have revenge.
TEXT.Italian: Oh, yeah. Take what you can while our elder spiders die. We'll have revenge.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, yeah. Take what you can while our elder spiders die. We'll have revenge.

TEXT.English: What are you gonna do? Spit on Mother? Have sex with my family? Slaughter my men? You can have it this time, but don't expect reprisal.
TEXT.French: What are you gonna do? Spit on Mother? Have sex with my family? Slaughter my men? You can have it this time, but don't expect reprisal.
TEXT.German: What are you gonna do? Spit on Mother? Have sex with my family? Slaughter my men? You can have it this time, but don't expect reprisal.
TEXT.Italian: What are you gonna do? Spit on Mother? Have sex with my family? Slaughter my men? You can have it this time, but don't expect reprisal.
TEXT.Spanish: What are you gonna do? Spit on Mother? Have sex with my family? Slaughter my men? You can have it this time, but don't expect reprisal.

TEXT.English: We need a little help [CT_NAME]. The %s1:2 has wronged Mother and we need your help to make it right.
TEXT.French: We need a little help [CT_NAME]. The %s1:2 has wronged Mother and we need your help to make it right.
TEXT.German: We need a little help [CT_NAME]. The %s1:2 has wronged Mother and we need your help to make it right.
TEXT.Italian: We need a little help [CT_NAME]. The %s1:2 has wronged Mother and we need your help to make it right.
TEXT.Spanish: We need a little help [CT_NAME]. The %s1:2 has wronged Mother and we need your help to make it right.

TEXT.English: I know you were a coward. If you lived in the Archosian society, you'd be dead.
TEXT.French: I know you were a coward. If you lived in the Archosian society, you'd be dead.
TEXT.German: I know you were a coward. If you lived in the Archosian society, you'd be dead.
TEXT.Italian: I know you were a coward. If you lived in the Archosian society, you'd be dead.
TEXT.Spanish: I know you were a coward. If you lived in the Archosian society, you'd be dead.

TEXT.English: Alas, this is Mother's will. Hopefully, the spiders Mother spawns will seek their way to your throats.
TEXT.French: Alas, this is Mother's will. Hopefully, the spiders Mother spawns will seek their way to your throats.
TEXT.German: Alas, this is Mother's will. Hopefully, the spiders Mother spawns will seek their way to your throats.
TEXT.Italian: Alas, this is Mother's will. Hopefully, the spiders Mother spawns will seek their way to your throats.
TEXT.Spanish: Alas, this is Mother's will. Hopefully, the spiders Mother spawns will seek their way to your throats.

TEXT.English: You're in my way, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: You're in my way, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: You're in my way, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: You're in my way, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: You're in my way, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: I shall leave your roads and wander afar, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: I shall leave your roads and wander afar, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: I shall leave your roads and wander afar, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: I shall leave your roads and wander afar, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: I shall leave your roads and wander afar, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: The lands you dwell on are full of wonders. Will you accept our allegiance?
TEXT.French: The lands you dwell on are full of wonders. Will you accept our allegiance?
TEXT.German: The lands you dwell on are full of wonders. Will you accept our allegiance?
TEXT.Italian: The lands you dwell on are full of wonders. Will you accept our allegiance?
TEXT.Spanish: The lands you dwell on are full of wonders. Will you accept our allegiance?

TEXT.English: I'm Deidra, I wish to visit the lands you dwell on. Let me wander under the stars and i'll leave your stones alone.
TEXT.French: I'm Deidra, I wish to visit the lands you dwell on. Let me wander under the stars and i'll leave your stones alone.
TEXT.German: I'm Deidra, I wish to visit the lands you dwell on. Let me wander under the stars and i'll leave your stones alone.
TEXT.Italian: I'm Deidra, I wish to visit the lands you dwell on. Let me wander under the stars and i'll leave your stones alone.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm Deidra, I wish to visit the lands you dwell on. Let me wander under the stars and i'll leave your stones alone.

TEXT.English: So many lands yet to see, I can't waste time on you.
TEXT.French: So many lands yet to see, I can't waste time on you.
TEXT.German: So many lands yet to see, I can't waste time on you.
TEXT.Italian: So many lands yet to see, I can't waste time on you.
TEXT.Spanish: So many lands yet to see, I can't waste time on you.

TEXT.English: Finally, I can roam your streets without having to escape your guards.
TEXT.French: Finally, I can roam your streets without having to escape your guards.
TEXT.German: Finally, I can roam your streets without having to escape your guards.
TEXT.Italian: Finally, I can roam your streets without having to escape your guards.
TEXT.Spanish: Finally, I can roam your streets without having to escape your guards.

TEXT.English: No. I still need to make the roads safe from you.
TEXT.French: No. I still need to make the roads safe from you.
TEXT.German: No. I still need to make the roads safe from you.
TEXT.Italian: No. I still need to make the roads safe from you.
TEXT.Spanish: No. I still need to make the roads safe from you.

TEXT.English: Greetings, friend. The sights from your roof are beautiful.
TEXT.French: Greetings, friend. The sights from your roof are beautiful.
TEXT.German: Greetings, friend. The sights from your roof are beautiful.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, friend. The sights from your roof are beautiful.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, friend. The sights from your roof are beautiful.

TEXT.English: Welcome to my campfire, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Welcome to my campfire, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Welcome to my campfire, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to my campfire, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome to my campfire, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Greetings. What do you want from me?
TEXT.French: Greetings. What do you want from me?
TEXT.German: Greetings. What do you want from me?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings. What do you want from me?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings. What do you want from me?

TEXT.English: The wastes are more hospitable than you. Why are you here, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: The wastes are more hospitable than you. Why are you here, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: The wastes are more hospitable than you. Why are you here, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: The wastes are more hospitable than you. Why are you here, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: The wastes are more hospitable than you. Why are you here, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: These endless lands aren't apparently large enough for you to leave me alone.
TEXT.French: These endless lands aren't apparently large enough for you to leave me alone.
TEXT.German: These endless lands aren't apparently large enough for you to leave me alone.
TEXT.Italian: These endless lands aren't apparently large enough for you to leave me alone.
TEXT.Spanish: These endless lands aren't apparently large enough for you to leave me alone.

TEXT.English: So what are we bartering for today?
TEXT.French: So what are we bartering for today?
TEXT.German: So what are we bartering for today?
TEXT.Italian: So what are we bartering for today?
TEXT.Spanish: So what are we bartering for today?

TEXT.English: That seems agreeable.
TEXT.French: That seems agreeable.
TEXT.German: That seems agreeable.
TEXT.Italian: That seems agreeable.
TEXT.Spanish: That seems agreeable.

TEXT.English: While I enjoy wandering in your cities, I will not pay this much for it.
TEXT.French: While I enjoy wandering in your cities, I will not pay this much for it.
TEXT.German: While I enjoy wandering in your cities, I will not pay this much for it.
TEXT.Italian: While I enjoy wandering in your cities, I will not pay this much for it.
TEXT.Spanish: While I enjoy wandering in your cities, I will not pay this much for it.

TEXT.English: Losing my coat in the wastes would be more profitable than what you're offering me.
TEXT.French: Losing my coat in the wastes would be more profitable than what you're offering me.
TEXT.German: Losing my coat in the wastes would be more profitable than what you're offering me.
TEXT.Italian: Losing my coat in the wastes would be more profitable than what you're offering me.
TEXT.Spanish: Losing my coat in the wastes would be more profitable than what you're offering me.

TEXT.English: Glad to see you can listen to the sound advice of winds and stars, occasionally at least.
TEXT.French: Glad to see you can listen to the sound advice of winds and stars, occasionally at least.
TEXT.German: Glad to see you can listen to the sound advice of winds and stars, occasionally at least.
TEXT.Italian: Glad to see you can listen to the sound advice of winds and stars, occasionally at least.
TEXT.Spanish: Glad to see you can listen to the sound advice of winds and stars, occasionally at least.

TEXT.English: Good, now I can leave your boring town.
TEXT.French: Good, now I can leave your boring town.
TEXT.German: Good, now I can leave your boring town.
TEXT.Italian: Good, now I can leave your boring town.
TEXT.Spanish: Good, now I can leave your boring town.

TEXT.English: Oh, I will bring back more from the wilds next time.
TEXT.French: Oh, I will bring back more from the wilds next time.
TEXT.German: Oh, I will bring back more from the wilds next time.
TEXT.Italian: Oh, I will bring back more from the wilds next time.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, I will bring back more from the wilds next time.

TEXT.English: Well. I am sure I will meet someone down the roads that will find this more interesting than you do
TEXT.French: Well. I am sure I will meet someone down the roads that will find this more interesting than you do
TEXT.German: Well. I am sure I will meet someone down the roads that will find this more interesting than you do
TEXT.Italian: Well. I am sure I will meet someone down the roads that will find this more interesting than you do
TEXT.Spanish: Well. I am sure I will meet someone down the roads that will find this more interesting than you do

TEXT.English: Here is what the winds bring today.
TEXT.French: Here is what the winds bring today.
TEXT.German: Here is what the winds bring today.
TEXT.Italian: Here is what the winds bring today.
TEXT.Spanish: Here is what the winds bring today.

TEXT.English: I'm afraid the wind has told me what to do with your deal. Time to blow it off.
TEXT.French: I'm afraid the wind has told me what to do with your deal. Time to blow it off.
TEXT.German: I'm afraid the wind has told me what to do with your deal. Time to blow it off.
TEXT.Italian: I'm afraid the wind has told me what to do with your deal. Time to blow it off.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm afraid the wind has told me what to do with your deal. Time to blow it off.

TEXT.English: I am more likely to settle in one of your starless houses than to accept this.
TEXT.French: I am more likely to settle in one of your starless houses than to accept this.
TEXT.German: I am more likely to settle in one of your starless houses than to accept this.
TEXT.Italian: I am more likely to settle in one of your starless houses than to accept this.
TEXT.Spanish: I am more likely to settle in one of your starless houses than to accept this.

TEXT.English: I long to go back to the roads, can we stop fighting?
TEXT.French: I long to go back to the roads, can we stop fighting?
TEXT.German: I long to go back to the roads, can we stop fighting?
TEXT.Italian: I long to go back to the roads, can we stop fighting?
TEXT.Spanish: I long to go back to the roads, can we stop fighting?

TEXT.English: This city is of no use to me. I prefer the vast wilderness.
TEXT.French: This city is of no use to me. I prefer the vast wilderness.
TEXT.German: This city is of no use to me. I prefer the vast wilderness.
TEXT.Italian: This city is of no use to me. I prefer the vast wilderness.
TEXT.Spanish: This city is of no use to me. I prefer the vast wilderness.

TEXT.English: I've come through the wilderness to bring you this myself. Are you interested in it, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: J'ai traversé les terres sauvages afin de vous apporter ceci en personne. Cela vous intéresse-t-il, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: I've come through the wilderness to bring you this myself. Are you interested in it, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: I've come through the wilderness to bring you this myself. Are you interested in it, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: I've come through the wilderness to bring you this myself. Are you interested in it, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: Here is a deal. Take it or don't. I'm leaving as far from here as I can anyway.
TEXT.French: Here is a deal. Take it or don't. I'm leaving as far from here as I can anyway.
TEXT.German: Here is a deal. Take it or don't. I'm leaving as far from here as I can anyway.
TEXT.Italian: Here is a deal. Take it or don't. I'm leaving as far from here as I can anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Here is a deal. Take it or don't. I'm leaving as far from here as I can anyway.

TEXT.English: Every road ends somewhere, as this deal does here and now.
TEXT.French: Every road ends somewhere, as this deal does here and now.
TEXT.German: Every road ends somewhere, as this deal does here and now.
TEXT.Italian: Every road ends somewhere, as this deal does here and now.
TEXT.Spanish: Every road ends somewhere, as this deal does here and now.

TEXT.English: This deal with you is like shackles, right now is the best time to break out of it.
TEXT.French: This deal with you is like shackles, right now is the best time to break out of it.
TEXT.German: This deal with you is like shackles, right now is the best time to break out of it.
TEXT.Italian: This deal with you is like shackles, right now is the best time to break out of it.
TEXT.Spanish: This deal with you is like shackles, right now is the best time to break out of it.

TEXT.English: Thank you. Now I can go wander some more.
TEXT.French: Thank you. Now I can go wander some more.
TEXT.German: Thank you. Now I can go wander some more.
TEXT.Italian: Thank you. Now I can go wander some more.
TEXT.Spanish: Thank you. Now I can go wander some more.

TEXT.English: This is what we agreed on.
TEXT.French: This is what we agreed on.
TEXT.German: This is what we agreed on.
TEXT.Italian: This is what we agreed on.
TEXT.Spanish: This is what we agreed on.

TEXT.English: Why not. I was just passing through your palace anyway.
TEXT.French: Why not. I was just passing through your palace anyway.
TEXT.German: Why not. I was just passing through your palace anyway.
TEXT.Italian: Why not. I was just passing through your palace anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Why not. I was just passing through your palace anyway.

TEXT.English: Not possible, I have anywhere else to be.
TEXT.French: Not possible, I have anywhere else to be.
TEXT.German: Not possible, I have anywhere else to be.
TEXT.Italian: Not possible, I have anywhere else to be.
TEXT.Spanish: Not possible, I have anywhere else to be.

TEXT.English: I feel like I am without boots on a tough road. I have no choice but to accept your terms.
TEXT.French: I feel like I am without boots on a tough road. I have no choice but to accept your terms.
TEXT.German: I feel like I am without boots on a tough road. I have no choice but to accept your terms.
TEXT.Italian: I feel like I am without boots on a tough road. I have no choice but to accept your terms.
TEXT.Spanish: I feel like I am without boots on a tough road. I have no choice but to accept your terms.

TEXT.English: You cornered me atop a cliff, but I can still jump. No deal.
TEXT.French: You cornered me atop a cliff, but I can still jump. No deal.
TEXT.German: You cornered me atop a cliff, but I can still jump. No deal.
TEXT.Italian: You cornered me atop a cliff, but I can still jump. No deal.
TEXT.Spanish: You cornered me atop a cliff, but I can still jump. No deal.

TEXT.English: I found this in the wastes. It's for you.
TEXT.French: I found this in the wastes. It's for you.
TEXT.German: I found this in the wastes. It's for you.
TEXT.Italian: I found this in the wastes. It's for you.
TEXT.Spanish: I found this in the wastes. It's for you.

TEXT.English: I ran into trouble roaming in the wastes on my own. Could you help me, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: I ran into trouble roaming in the wastes on my own. Could you help me, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: I ran into trouble roaming in the wastes on my own. Could you help me, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: I ran into trouble roaming in the wastes on my own. Could you help me, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: I ran into trouble roaming in the wastes on my own. Could you help me, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: A tempest is brewing. Be more careful next time or you may be caught in it.
TEXT.French: A tempest is brewing. Be more careful next time or you may be caught in it.
TEXT.German: A tempest is brewing. Be more careful next time or you may be caught in it.
TEXT.Italian: A tempest is brewing. Be more careful next time or you may be caught in it.
TEXT.Spanish: A tempest is brewing. Be more careful next time or you may be caught in it.

TEXT.English: Too bad! I might have to visit your vaults then.
TEXT.French: Too bad! I might have to visit your vaults then.
TEXT.German: Too bad! I might have to visit your vaults then.
TEXT.Italian: Too bad! I might have to visit your vaults then.
TEXT.Spanish: Too bad! I might have to visit your vaults then.

TEXT.English: Oh! I'll continue on my way then.
TEXT.French: Oh! I'll continue on my way then.
TEXT.German: Oh! I'll continue on my way then.
TEXT.Italian: Oh! I'll continue on my way then.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh! I'll continue on my way then.

TEXT.English: I'd rather not have to ridicule your guards today. Give me this and your vaults will stay windless.
TEXT.French: I'd rather not have to ridicule your guards today. Give me this and your vaults will stay windless.
TEXT.German: I'd rather not have to ridicule your guards today. Give me this and your vaults will stay windless.
TEXT.Italian: I'd rather not have to ridicule your guards today. Give me this and your vaults will stay windless.
TEXT.Spanish: I'd rather not have to ridicule your guards today. Give me this and your vaults will stay windless.

TEXT.English: I'm offering you stars and fair winds. Will you give this to me in return ?
TEXT.French: I'm offering you stars and fair winds. Will you give this to me in return ?
TEXT.German: I'm offering you stars and fair winds. Will you give this to me in return ?
TEXT.Italian: I'm offering you stars and fair winds. Will you give this to me in return ?
TEXT.Spanish: I'm offering you stars and fair winds. Will you give this to me in return ?

TEXT.English: I need that before leaving for the wilderness. Would you mind giving it to me, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.French: I need that before leaving for the wilderness. Would you mind giving it to me, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.German: I need that before leaving for the wilderness. Would you mind giving it to me, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.Italian: I need that before leaving for the wilderness. Would you mind giving it to me, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.Spanish: I need that before leaving for the wilderness. Would you mind giving it to me, [CT_NAME] ?

TEXT.English: I asked to be nice. Next time I will take.
TEXT.French: I asked to be nice. Next time I will take.
TEXT.German: I asked to be nice. Next time I will take.
TEXT.Italian: I asked to be nice. Next time I will take.
TEXT.Spanish: I asked to be nice. Next time I will take.

TEXT.English: As I feared, you cannot see the worth of the stars. One, day you might be robbed of them.
TEXT.French: As I feared, you cannot see the worth of the stars. One, day you might be robbed of them.
TEXT.German: As I feared, you cannot see the worth of the stars. One, day you might be robbed of them.
TEXT.Italian: As I feared, you cannot see the worth of the stars. One, day you might be robbed of them.
TEXT.Spanish: As I feared, you cannot see the worth of the stars. One, day you might be robbed of them.

TEXT.English: Time for me to leave, then.
TEXT.French: Time for me to leave, then.
TEXT.German: Time for me to leave, then.
TEXT.Italian: Time for me to leave, then.
TEXT.Spanish: Time for me to leave, then.

TEXT.English: The roads of the %s1:2 are quite unsafe. Could you help me clean them up ?
TEXT.French: The roads of the %s1:2 are quite unsafe. Could you help me clean them up ?
TEXT.German: The roads of the %s1:2 are quite unsafe. Could you help me clean them up ?
TEXT.Italian: The roads of the %s1:2 are quite unsafe. Could you help me clean them up ?
TEXT.Spanish: The roads of the %s1:2 are quite unsafe. Could you help me clean them up ?

TEXT.English: "You cannot defeat a storm, merely survive it. We may not survive this storm, but keep your eye to the sky- for the next may claim your own lands"
TEXT.French: "Vous ne pouvez vaincre une tempête, à peine y survivre. Il se peut que nous succombions à cette tempête, mais gardez vos yeux rivés au ciel, ou un autre pourrait s'approprier vos terres."
TEXT.German: "Ihr könnt einen Sturm nicht bezwingen, ihn schwerlich nur überleben. Wir scheinen diesen Sturm nicht zu überstehen, aber behaltet den Himmel im Auge - der nächste könnte EUCH Eür Land kosten."
TEXT.Italian: "You cannot defeat a storm, merely survive it. We may not survive this storm, but keep your eye to the sky- for the next may claim your own lands"
TEXT.Spanish: "You cannot defeat a storm, merely survive it. We may not survive this storm, but keep your eye to the sky- for the next may claim your own lands"

TEXT.English: Toy soldiers are no fun without battles to fight with them.
TEXT.French: Les jouets que sont nos soldats ne sont pas drôles sans batailles pour les utiliser.
TEXT.German: Spielzeugsoldaten machen keinen Spaß, wenn man keine Schlachten hat, in denen man sie einsetzen kann.
TEXT.Italian: Toy soldiers are no fun without battles to fight with them.
TEXT.Spanish: Toy soldiers are no fun without battles to fight with them.

TEXT.English: The game has only begun. Imagine what delights lie in store for us.
TEXT.French: Le jeu vient à peine de commencer. Imaginez quelles merveilles se cachent pour nous dans le magasin.
TEXT.German: Das Spiel hat gerade erst begonnen. Stellt Euch vor, welche Vergnügen noch vor uns liegen.
TEXT.Italian: The game has only begun. Imagine what delights lie in store for us.
TEXT.Spanish: The game has only begun. Imagine what delights lie in store for us.

TEXT.English: Oh, I was hoping it was someone else.
TEXT.French: Oh, j'espérais voir quelqu'un d'autre.
TEXT.German: Oh, I was hoping it was someone else.
TEXT.Italian: Oh, I was hoping it was someone else.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, I was hoping it was someone else.

TEXT.English: You're my new best friend. I broke my last one.
TEXT.French: Tu es mon nouveau meilleur ami, j'ai cassé l'ancien.
TEXT.German: You're my new best friend. I broke my last one.
TEXT.Italian: You're my new best friend. I broke my last one.
TEXT.Spanish: You're my new best friend. I broke my last one.

TEXT.English: But we are having so much fun.
TEXT.French: Mais nous nous amusons tellement !
TEXT.German: Aber wir haben doch so viel spass.
TEXT.Italian: But we are having so much fun.
TEXT.Spanish: But we are having so much fun.

TEXT.English: Do you have time for a game of Somnium?
TEXT.French: Avez-vous le temps pour une partie de Somnium ?
TEXT.German: Hast du Zeit für eine Partie Somnium?
TEXT.Italian: Do you have time for a game of Somnium?
TEXT.Spanish: Do you have time for a game of Somnium?

TEXT.English: I bet you've come to beg for more favors.
TEXT.French: Je parie que vous êtes venus quémander une autre faveur.
TEXT.German: Ich wette, Ihr seid gekommen, um noch mehr Gefälligkeiten zu erbetteln.
TEXT.Italian: I bet you've come to beg for more favors.
TEXT.Spanish: I bet you've come to beg for more favors.

TEXT.English: Thank you, I won't vote for you in the tribal council.
TEXT.French: Merci. Je ne voterai pas pour vous au conseil tribal.
TEXT.German: Danke, ich werde im Stammesrat nicht für Euch stimmen.
TEXT.Italian: Thank you, I won't vote for you in the tribal council.
TEXT.Spanish: Thank you, I won't vote for you in the tribal council.

TEXT.English: That hardly seems fair.
TEXT.French: Ça semble vraiment difficilement équitable.
TEXT.German: That hardly seems fair.
TEXT.Italian: That hardly seems fair.
TEXT.Spanish: That hardly seems fair.

TEXT.English: Well... I would but you see I already promised to help someone else.
TEXT.French: Hé bien... J'aimerais, mais voyez-vous, j'ai déjà promis mon aide à quelqu'un d'autre.
TEXT.German: Nun... ich würde ja, aber ich habe leider schon versprochen, jemand anderem zu helfen.
TEXT.Italian: Well... I would but you see I already promised to help someone else.
TEXT.Spanish: Well... I would but you see I already promised to help someone else.

TEXT.English: Let's play another game instead.
TEXT.French: Jouons plutôt à un autre jeu.
TEXT.German: Lass uns stattdessen ein anderes Spiel spielen
TEXT.Italian: Let's play another game instead.
TEXT.Spanish: Let's play another game instead.

TEXT.English: You're the best!
TEXT.French: Vous êtes le meileur !
TEXT.German: Ihr seid der Beste
TEXT.Italian: You're the best!
TEXT.Spanish: You're the best!

TEXT.English: Share your toys, or we will take them from you.
TEXT.French: Partagez vos jouets, ou nous vous les prendrons.
TEXT.German: Teilt Eure Spielsachen mit uns, oder wir nehmen sie Euch.
TEXT.Italian: Share your toys, or we will take them from you.
TEXT.Spanish: Share your toys, or we will take them from you.

TEXT.English: What better way to enjoy friends than to share our toys with them.
TEXT.French: Quel meilleur moyen de s'amuser avec ses amis que de partager nos jouets?
TEXT.German: What better way to enjoy friends than to share our toys with them.
TEXT.Italian: What better way to enjoy friends than to share our toys with them.
TEXT.Spanish: What better way to enjoy friends than to share our toys with them.

TEXT.English: You have so many toys, surely you won't mind sharing them with us.
TEXT.French: Vous avez tellement de jouets, ça ne vous gênera sûrement pas de les partager avec moi.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt so viele Spielsachen, da könnt ihr uns doch sicher welche abgeben.
TEXT.Italian: You have so many toys, surely you won't mind sharing them with us.
TEXT.Spanish: You have so many toys, surely you won't mind sharing them with us.

TEXT.English: Not sharing makes you a bad playmate.
TEXT.French: Ne pas partager fait de vous un piètre compagnon de jeu.
TEXT.German: Not sharing makes you a bad playmate.
TEXT.Italian: Not sharing makes you a bad playmate.
TEXT.Spanish: Not sharing makes you a bad playmate.

TEXT.English: "Without props how am I to pretend?[NEWLINE]Without actors this glorious play must end.[NEWLINE]Without me this war has no sense of humor.[NEWLINE]Without the Balseraphs this game will be over sooner."
TEXT.French: [TAB]"Sans accessoires comment jouer ?[PARAGRAPH:1]Sans acteurs cette glorieuse pièce doit se terminer.[PARAGRAPH:1]Sans moi cette guerre n'a aucun humour,[PARAGRAPH:1]Sans les Balseraphs ce jeu sera bien plus court."
TEXT.German: "Wie komm' ich ohne Requisiten nun ans Ziel?[PARAGRAPH:1]Und ohne Schausteller muss enden nun dies Spiel.[PARAGRAPH:1]Auch liegt Humor nicht mehr im Kriege ohne mich.[PARAGRAPH:1]Jetzt ohne Balseraph - das Spiel verkürzet sich."
TEXT.Italian: "Without props how am I to pretend?[NEWLINE]Without actors this glorious play must end.[NEWLINE]Without me this war has no sense of humor.[NEWLINE]Without the Balseraphs this game will be over sooner."
TEXT.Spanish: "Without props how am I to pretend?[NEWLINE]Without actors this glorious play must end.[NEWLINE]Without me this war has no sense of humor.[NEWLINE]Without the Balseraphs this game will be over sooner."

TEXT.English: Ohhh, you've made me mad! Time for my armies to get you... Someone summon us an army! Now!
TEXT.French: Ohhh, vous me rendez folle! Il est temps que mes armées vous attrappent... Que quelqu'un m'invoque une armée! Maintenant!
TEXT.German: Ohhh, Ihr macht mich wahnsinnig! Es wird Zeit, dass meine Armeen Euch erwischen... Jemand soll uns eine Armee beschwören! Sofort!
TEXT.Italian: Ohhh, you've made me mad! Time for my armies to get you... Someone summon us an army! Now!
TEXT.Spanish: Ohhh, me habéis vuelto loca! Es hora de que mis ejercitos os alcancen... ¡Que alguien nos convoque un ejército! ¡Ahora!

TEXT.English: Oh, welcome to our festive land! Won't you stay and chat with me? Puppets, make them stay! Forever!
TEXT.French: Oh, bienvenue sur nos terres festives ! Ne voulez-vous pasrester et discuter avec moi? Marionnettes, faites les rester! Pour toujours!
TEXT.German: Oh, hereinspaziert in unser fröhliches Land! Wollt Ihr nicht noch ein bisschen bleiben und mit mir plaudern? Püppchen, sorgt dafür, dass sie bleiben! Auf ewig!
TEXT.Italian: Oh, welcome to our festive land! Won't you stay and chat with me? Puppets, make them stay! Forever!
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, bienvenido a nuestra tierra festiva! ¿No queréis quedaros y charlar conmigo? ¡Títeres, haced que se queden! ¡Para siempre!

TEXT.English: Talk to the imp!
TEXT.French: Parlez aux diablotins !
TEXT.German: Erzählt das dem Kobold!
TEXT.Italian: Talk to the imp!
TEXT.Spanish: Habladle al diablillo!

TEXT.English: Visit again, but remember to bring a present.
TEXT.French: Revenez me voir, mais pensez à me ramener un cadeau.
TEXT.German: Kommt wieder, aber vergesst nicht, ein Geschenk mitzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: Visit again, but remember to bring a present.
TEXT.Spanish: Volved a visitarme, pero recordad traer un regalo.

TEXT.English: But your men look so funny when they flee my puppets! I think we'll see a bit more of it!
TEXT.French: Mais vos hommes sont si amusant lorsqu'ils fuient devant mes marionnettes ! Je crois que nous allons encore profiter du spectacle !
TEXT.German: Aber Eure Männer sehen so lustig aus, wenn sie vor meinen Püppchen fliehen! Lasst uns noch etwas mehr davon erleben!
TEXT.Italian: But your men look so funny when they flee my puppets! I think we'll see a bit more of it!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Pero vuestros hombres son tan graciosos cuando huyen de mis títeres!¡Creo que los veremos un poquito más!

TEXT.English: You've come back to see me, how delightful! Shall we watch the skeletons dance?
TEXT.French: Vous êtes revenu me voir, quel délice ! Regarderons-nous les squelettes danser ?
TEXT.German: Ihr kommt schon wieder, mich zu besuchen, wie schön! Wollen wir den Skeletten beim Tanz zuschauen?
TEXT.Italian: You've come back to see me, how delightful! Shall we watch the skeletons dance?
TEXT.Spanish: Habéis vuelto para verme, ¡qué delicia! ¿Vemos la danza de esqueletos?

TEXT.English: My friends think that you don't like me... Hurry up and tell me what you want this time.
TEXT.French: Mes amis pensent que vous ne m'aimez pas... Dépêchez-vous de me dire ce que vous voulez cette fois.
TEXT.German: Meine Freunde munkeln, Ihr wärt mir nicht sehr gewogen... Also sprecht rasch und fasst Euch kurz.
TEXT.Italian: My friends think that you don't like me... Hurry up and tell me what you want this time.
TEXT.Spanish: Mis amigos creen que yo no os caigo bien... Daos prisa y decidme que queréis esta vez.

TEXT.English: Oh, presents for me? How kind of you.
TEXT.French: Oh, des cadeaux pour moi? Quelle charmante attention.
TEXT.German: Geschenke... für mich? Wie aufmerksam von Euch.
TEXT.Italian: Oh, presents for me? How kind of you.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, ¿regalos para mí? Que amable por vuestra parte.

TEXT.English: You can't do that. You don't know my Word of Command, and I'm not telling!
TEXT.French: Vous ne pouvez pas faire ça. Vous ne connaissez pas mon Mot de Commandement, et je ne vous le dirai pas!
TEXT.German: Das könnt Ihr nicht tun. Ihr kennt meine Befehle nicht, und das ist kein Spaß!
TEXT.Italian: You can't do that. You don't know my Word of Command, and I'm not telling!
TEXT.Spanish: No podéis hacer eso. No conocéis mi Palabra de Mando, ¡y no os la voy a decir!

TEXT.English: Not EVERYTHING comes from ether, dear. I just can't give that up!
TEXT.French: Absolument TOUT ne vient pas de l'Ether, mon cher. Je ne peux juste pas vous accorder cela!
TEXT.German: Nicht ALLES stammt aus dem Äther, mein Lieber. Ich kann das nicht entbehren!
TEXT.Italian: Not EVERYTHING comes from ether, dear. I just can't give that up!
TEXT.Spanish: No TODO viene por el éter, querido. ¡Simplemente no puedo acordar eso!

TEXT.English: You no longer amuse me. Puppets, show them out!
TEXT.French: Vous ne m'amusez plus. Marionnettes, sortez-le d'ici !
TEXT.German: Ihr seid nicht länger unterhaltsam. Püppchen, schmeißt sie raus!
TEXT.Italian: You no longer amuse me. Puppets, show them out!
TEXT.Spanish: Ya no me divertís. ¡Títeres, hechadlos fuera!

TEXT.English: My beasties are up for more... but daddy might be back any day now, so let's stop, okay?
TEXT.French: Mes bestioles peuvent continuer... mais papa peut revenir d'un jour à l'autre, alors arrêtons nous, d'accord ?
TEXT.German: Meine Tierchen sind bereit für mehr... aber Vater könnte jeden Moment zurück kommen, also lasst uns aufhören, okay?
TEXT.Italian: My beasties are up for more... but daddy might be back any day now, so let's stop, okay?
TEXT.Spanish: Mis pequeñas bestias quieren más... pero papá podría volver cualquier día de estos, así que mejor paramos, ¿vale?

TEXT.English: Thank you! This calls for a party, I'd better start conjuring the guests!
TEXT.French: Merci ! Cela réclame fête, je ferais mieux d'en invoquer les invités.
TEXT.German: Danke! Das schreit direkt nach einem Fest. Lasst mich gleich die Gäste beschwören!
TEXT.Italian: Thank you! This calls for a party, I'd better start conjuring the guests!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Gracias! Esto hay que celebrarlo, ¡mejor empiezo a conjurar invitados!

TEXT.English: I want this. Gimme some or feel our fangs.
TEXT.French: Je veux ça. Donnez le ou sentez nos crocs.
TEXT.German: Ich will das. Her damit, oder spürt unsere Klauen.
TEXT.Italian: I want this. Gimme some or feel our fangs.
TEXT.Spanish: Quiero esto. Dame un poco o siente nuestros colmillos.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], we've run out of this. Please don't make me ask my daddy, I'd rather leave him out of this.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], nous manquons de ceci. S'il vous plaît, ne me forcez pas à demander à mon père, je préfère le laisser en dehors de tout ça.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], das ist uns ausgegangen. Bitte lasst mich deswegen nicht meinen Vater fragen müssen. Ich würde das wirklich nur ungern tun.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], we've run out of this. Please don't make me ask my daddy, I'd rather leave him out of this.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], nos hemos quedado sin esto. Por favor, no me hagáis pedírselo a mi padre, prefiero dejarlo fuera de esto.

TEXT.English: The show must go on, and I would so appreciate your help, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Le spectacle doit se poursuivre, et j'apprécierai vraiment votre aide, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Das Leben muss weitergehen, und wir würden Eure Hilfe sehr begrüßen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: The show must go on, and I would so appreciate your help, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: El espectáculo debe continuar, y apreciaría tanto vuestra ayuda, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Would it help if I asked nicely? No? How about if my friends asks? They probably won't ask nicely, though.
TEXT.French: Aurait-ce été mieux si j'avais demandé gentiment? Non? Et si mes amis avaient demandé? Remarquez, ils n'auraient probablement pas demandé gentiment, je crois.
TEXT.German: Hätte es geholfen, wenn ich freundlich gefragt hätte? Nein? Wie wäre es, wenn meine Freunde fragen? Allerdings werden sie es wohl nicht besonders freundlich tun.
TEXT.Italian: Would it help if I asked nicely? No? How about if my friends asks? They probably won't ask nicely, though.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Habría ayudado si os lo hubiera pedido amablemente? ¿No? ¿Y si mis amigos os lo pidieran? Probablemente no os lo pedirán tan amablemente, creo.

TEXT.English: "Oh! Is it time for me to be unsummoned too?"
TEXT.French: "Oh ! Est-ce l'heure où je dois également être révoquée ?"
TEXT.German: "Oh! Ist es jetzt Zeit, dass auch meine Beschwörung endet?"
TEXT.Italian: "Oh! Is it time for me to be unsummoned too?"
TEXT.Spanish: "Oh! Is it time for me to be unsummoned too?"

TEXT.English: As the moon takes the sky in its blood-drawn embrace[NEWLINE]As our cages will fill up with men of each race[NEWLINE]As the dancers and singers take blades to the show[NEWLINE]As apocalypse greets us with its fiery glow[NEWLINE]It's now time for you to be out of the game[NEWLINE]But don't die too quickly, that would be a shame[NEWLINE]Step into the darkness, in there you will stay[NEWLINE]For your death is at hand and your doom is today!
TEXT.French: Alors que la lune dans sa sanglante étreinte le ciel embrasse[NEWLINE]Alors que nos cages se remplissent d'hommes de toutes races[NEWLINE]Alors que danseurs et chanteurs au spectacle sont les tueurs[NEWLINE]Alors que l'Apocalypse nous accueille dans sa pourpre lueur[NEWLINE]Il est enfin temps pour vous de quitter la table[NEWLINE]Mais ne mourrez pas trop vite, ce serait pitoyable[NEWLINE]Marchez dans les ténèbres, où toujours vous restez[NEWLINE]Votre mort est proche et votre destin arrêté!
TEXT.German: So des Mondes blutroter Schleier den Himmel umhüllt,[NEWLINE]der schaurige Kerker mit aller Rassen Wesen sich füllt.[NEWLINE]So die Sänger und Spieler die Klingen erheben zu höllischem Tanz,[NEWLINE]die blut'ge Apokalypse grüsst mit feurigem Glanz.[NEWLINE]Zeit ist's für Euch zu beenden dies irdische Spiel,[NEWLINE]doch geht nicht zu schnell, unsre Scham wär zu viel.[NEWLINE]Hinab ins Dunkle und bleibet dort alle Zeit.[NEWLINE]Für Euch heißt's jetzt Tod, zum ew'gen Untergang seid nun bereit!
TEXT.Italian: As the moon takes the sky in its blood-drawn embrace[NEWLINE]As our cages will fill up with men of each race[NEWLINE]As the dancers and singers take blades to the show[NEWLINE]As apocalypse greets us with its fiery glow[NEWLINE]It's now time for you to be out of the game[NEWLINE]But don't die too quickly, that would be a shame[NEWLINE]Step into the darkness, in there you will stay[NEWLINE]For your death is at hand and your doom is today!
TEXT.Spanish: Así como la luna atraviesa el cielo como una sangrienta lanza[NEWLINE]Así como nuestras jaulas se llenarán con hombres de cada raza[NEWLINE]Así como danzantes y cantantes traen filos al espectáculo[NEWLINE]Así como el apocalipsis nos saluda con gran júbilo[NEWLINE]Es ahora el momento en que salís de la partida[NEWLINE]Pero no muráis demasiado pronto, pues sería una rápida despedida[NEWLINE]Adentraos en la oscuridad, ahí os quedaréis[NEWLINE]¡Vuestra muerte está de la mano y vuestra perdición es hoy, ya lo veréis!

TEXT.English: I welcome you to us[NEWLINE]Fresh part of the show[NEWLINE]Perpentach greets you warmly[NEWLINE]your intent we shall know[NEWLINE]So tell us your wish, do not seek to beguile,[NEWLINE]To be prey for amusement[NEWLINE]or to live for a while?
TEXT.French: [TAB]Je vous souhaite la bienvenue[PARAGRAPH:1]Nouveau venu dans notre jeu,[PARAGRAPH:1]Perpentach chaleureusment vous salue[PARAGRAPH:1]Connaître vos desseins je veux[PARAGRAPH:1]Parlez sans détour, quel est votre désir?[PARAGRAPH:1]Ne tentez pas de nous duper[PARAGRAPH:1]Être une proie pour notre plaisir[PARAGRAPH:1]Ou de la vie encore profiter ?
TEXT.German: Willkommen bei uns, so heiße ich Euch.[NEWLINE]Willkommen, Ihr frisches Blut zu neuen Scherzen![NEWLINE]So grüßt Euch Perpentach mit fröhlichem Herzen.[NEWLINE]Eurer Wünsche Wahrheit wollen wir nicht raten,[NEWLINE]drum sucht nicht zu täuschen mit list'gen Taten.[NEWLINE]Sonst seid Ihr Opfer unserer Rinder Regen,[NEWLINE]Ihr hängt doch aber sicherlich an Eurem Leben?
TEXT.Italian: I welcome you to us[NEWLINE]Fresh part of the show[NEWLINE]Perpentach greets you warmly[NEWLINE]your intent we shall know[NEWLINE]So tell us your wish, do not seek to beguile,[NEWLINE]To be prey for amusement[NEWLINE]or to live for a while?
TEXT.Spanish: Os damos la bienvenida hasta nosotros[NEWLINE]Ración fresca para el espectáculo[NEWLINE]Perpentach os saluda cálidamente[NEWLINE]vuestras intenciones conoceremos[NEWLINE]Así que decidnos vuestro deseo, no busquéis el encanto,[NEWLINE]para ser presa del entretenimiento[NEWLINE]¿O vivir por un momento?

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], we have nothing more to discuss[NEWLINE]Why talk when you clearly have no love for us?
TEXT.French: [TAB][CT_NAME], nous n'avons plus rien à nous dire[PARAGRAPH:1]Pourquoi parler, puisque vous semblez nous haïr ?
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], es nichts mehr zu bereden gibt.[NEWLINE]Warum der vielen Worte, wenn Ihr uns doch nicht liebt?
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], we have nothing more to discuss[NEWLINE]Why talk when you clearly have no love for us?
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], lo mejor será que os vayáis[NEWLINE]¿Por qué hablar cuando claramente no nos amáis?

TEXT.English: When at last the cast departs the stage[NEWLINE]To cheering crowds and accolades[NEWLINE]Fear not for fun when lights do fade[NEWLINE]To plays like this encores are made.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Quand finalement de scène s'en vont les acteurs,[PARAGRAPH:1]Saluant la foule par accolades, ils n'ont pas peur[PARAGRAPH:1]Pour le plaisir, lorsque les lumières s'amoindrissent,[PARAGRAPH:1]De rejouer, tandis que les bravos retentissent.
TEXT.German: Wenn schließlich die Sänger die Bühne verlassen haben,[NEWLINE]am verdienten Lob und an der Menge Jubel sich zu laben,[NEWLINE]dann seid nicht traurig, als nun erlöschet das Licht.[NEWLINE]Bei diesem Stück es öfter eine Zugabe gibt als nicht.
TEXT.Italian: When at last the cast departs the stage[NEWLINE]To cheering crowds and accolades[NEWLINE]Fear not for fun when lights do fade[NEWLINE]To plays like this encores are made.
TEXT.Spanish: Cuando al fin los actores salen por el escenario de bruces[NEWLINE]para saludar a la multitud que está derecha[NEWLINE]no temen por la diversión cuando se apagan las luces[NEWLINE]para juegos como este las repeticiones están hechas.

TEXT.English: Why stop here already? We've had so much fun.[NEWLINE]We've seen you do battle, now let's see you run.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Pourquoi nous arrêter déjà ? Nous eûmes tant de joies fortuites.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nous vous vîmes dans la bataille, voyons vous dans la fuite.
TEXT.German: Ihr haltet ein? Welch eine Freud ist's doch, ins Feld zu zieh'n.[NEWLINE]Gern sahen wir Euch fechten, doch lieber noch sehen wir Euch jetzt flieh'n.
TEXT.Italian: Why stop here already? We've had so much fun.[NEWLINE]We've seen you do battle, now let's see you run.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Parar aquí ahora por qué? Aún hay mucho por ver.[NEWLINE]Os hemos visto luchar, ahora os veremos correr

TEXT.English: Take this kiss upon the brow! And, in parting from you now,[NEWLINE]Thus much let me avow-[NEWLINE]You are not wrong who deem[NEWLINE]That my days have been a dream;[NEWLINE]Yet if hope has flown away[NEWLINE]In a night, or in a day, [NEWLINE]In a vision, or in none, [NEWLINE]Is it therefore the less gone?[NEWLINE]All that we see or seem[NEWLINE]Is but a dream within a dream.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Prenez ce baiser sur le front! Et, en vous quittant maintenant,[PARAGRAPH:1]Permettez-moi d'avouer sincèrement[PARAGRAPH:1]Qu'ont raison ceux, malgré vos mensonges,[PARAGRAPH:1]Qui jugent que mes jours furent un songe.[PARAGRAPH:1]Or si l'espoir s'en est allé,[PARAGRAPH:1]Dans une nuit, ou par une journée,[PARAGRAPH:1]Dans une vision, ou avec personne,[PARAGRAPH:1]Est-ce perdre la moindre couronne ?[PARAGRAPH:1]Tout ce que nous voyons ou croyons,[PARAGRAPH:1]Des rêve dans le rêve, ce sont.
TEXT.German: Nun denn, die Stirn reicht mir zum Kuss![NEWLINE]Doch beim Abschied ich bekennen muss,[NEWLINE]recht habt Ihr, wenn es Euch scheint,[NEWLINE]dass die Zeit um meine Träume weint.[NEWLINE]Und wär' die Hoffnung auch gegangen[NEWLINE]von finst'rer, dunk'ler Nacht gefangen,[NEWLINE]in des Sehers Gesicht von Neu'm geboren.[NEWLINE]Ja, wär' denn dann Geringeres verloren?[NEWLINE]Was wir schau'n ist nichts als Schaum:[NEWLINE]Ein Traum ist's in einem and'ren Traum.
TEXT.Italian: Take this kiss upon the brow! And, in parting from you now,[NEWLINE]Thus much let me avow-[NEWLINE]You are not wrong who deem[NEWLINE]That my days have been a dream;[NEWLINE]Yet if hope has flown away[NEWLINE]In a night, or in a day, [NEWLINE]In a vision, or in none, [NEWLINE]Is it therefore the less gone?[NEWLINE]All that we see or seem[NEWLINE]Is but a dream within a dream.
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Tomad este beso sobre vuestra frente! Y, ahora en cuanto a vos,[NEWLINE]Así podré confesar...[NEWLINE]No estáis equivocado, quien juzga[NEWLINE]Que mis días han sido un sueño;[NEWLINE]Aún si la esperanza ha huido[NEWLINE]En una noche, o en un día, [NEWLINE]En una visión, o en la nada, [NEWLINE]¿Es, por lo tanto, el que menos se ha ido?[NEWLINE]Todo lo que vemos o parecemos[NEWLINE]No es más que un sueño dentro de un sueño.

TEXT.English: That is not dead which can eternal lie,[NEWLINE]And with strange aeons, even death may die.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Jamais ne peut mourir celui qui sait mentir,[PARAGRAPH:1]Et en ces temps étranges, même la mort peut mourir.
TEXT.German: Tot kanns nicht sein, was da ewig nur blanke Lüge bot.[NEWLINE]Es mag sein, dass vergeht nach ew'gen Zeiten sogar der Tod.
TEXT.Italian: That is not dead which can eternal lie,[NEWLINE]And with strange aeons, even death may die.
TEXT.Spanish: Lo que no está muerto puede ser una mentira eterna,[NEWLINE]Y con estos extraños eones, incluso la muerte puede morir.

TEXT.English: Such is life that leads a man to his desire.[NEWLINE]Such is art that fuels this raging fire.[NEWLINE]Such is compassion that another can fill this need.[NEWLINE]Such is my joy to see this deal agreed.
TEXT.French: Ainsi va la vie qui guide un homme vers ce qu'il peut désirer.[NEWLINE]Ainsi va l'art qui alimente ce feu déchaîné.[NEWLINE]Ainsi va la compassion envers celui qui peut combler ses besoins.[NEWLINE]Ainsi va ma joie de voir nos points de vue joints.
TEXT.German: So leitet das Leben den Menschen zum Höchstbegehrten.[NEWLINE]So ist die Kunst, dem Wind gleich schürt sie manch Feuerfährten.[NEWLINE]So ist das Mitgefühl, das des Nächsten Not rührt.[NEWLINE]So ist meine Freud', zu der dieser Vertrag mich führt.
TEXT.Italian: Such is life that leads a man to his desire.[NEWLINE]Such is art that fuels this raging fire.[NEWLINE]Such is compassion that another can fill this need.[NEWLINE]Such is my joy to see this deal agreed.
TEXT.Spanish: Tal es la vida que lleva al hombre hacia su querencia.[NEWLINE]Tal es el arte que alimenta este fuego desatado.[NEWLINE]Tal es la compasión que otro puede saciar esta necesidad con decencia.[NEWLINE]Tal es mi júbilo al ver este trato conformado.

TEXT.English: Could it be that my infectious mirth,[NEWLINE]After all this time has given birth,[NEWLINE]To a second wit just as grand?[NEWLINE]Or do you mean this arrogant demand?
TEXT.French: [TAB]Se peut-il que ma contagieuse hilarité,[PARAGRAPH:1]Après si longtemps a engendré[PARAGRAPH:1]Un second esprit tout aussi astucieux?[PARAGRAPH:1]Ou bien formulez-vous vraiment ce vœu ?
TEXT.German: Ist's möglich, dass meine heitere Natur[NEWLINE]bei Euch gebar Humor, so rein und pur?[NEWLINE]Ernst ist's Euch am End voll und ganz[NEWLINE]mit Eurem Wunsch, beseelt von Arroganz.
TEXT.Italian: Could it be that my infectious mirth,[NEWLINE]After all this time has given birth,[NEWLINE]To a second wit just as grand?[NEWLINE]Or do you mean this arrogant demand?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Pudiese ser que mi infecciosa virtud,[NEWLINE]después de todo este tiempo haya dado a luz,[NEWLINE]a un segundo ingenio así de grande?[NEWLINE]U os referís a esta demanda arrogante?

TEXT.English: These were your charms, sweet [CT_NAME]; sports like these,[NEWLINE]With sweet succession, taught even toil to please;[NEWLINE]These were your bowers, their cheerful influence shed,[NEWLINE]These were your charms-but all these charms are fled.
TEXT.French: Vous avez usé de votre charme, très cher [CT_NAME]; de telles plaisanteries[NEWLINE]délicatement enchaînées, un bien dur labeur pour faire de moi votre ami,[NEWLINE]Vous avez usé de charmille, votre influence s'est accrue [NEWLINE]Vous avez abusé de votre charme, et ce charme s'est rompu
TEXT.German: Das war Euer Zauber, oh [CT_NAME], ja, er war so fein,[NEWLINE]selbst die allerschlimmsten Plagen konnten nur besänftigt sein.[NEWLINE]Das waren Eure Trümpfe und alle, alle waren gefangen.[NEWLINE]Das waren Eure Reize, doch nun ist ihr Zauber gegangen.
TEXT.Italian: These were your charms, sweet [CT_NAME]; sports like these,[NEWLINE]With sweet succession, taught even toil to please;[NEWLINE]These were your bowers, their cheerful influence shed,[NEWLINE]These were your charms-but all these charms are fled.
TEXT.Spanish: Estos eran tus encantos, dulces [CT_NAME]; deportes como estos,[NEWLINE]Con dulce sucesión, enseñado incluso agotado para complacer;[NEWLINE]Estos eran tus cenadores, su alegre influencia desprendida,[NEWLINE]Estos eran tus encantos... pero todos estos encantos huyeron.

TEXT.English: Bring in the force you thought I would ignore[NEWLINE]Or hold back as you ought have done before.[NEWLINE]What truth does lie on the next embroidered page[NEWLINE]Will you watch the show or walk onto our stage?
TEXT.French: [TAB]Montrez donc cette force que vous me pensiez ignorer[PARAGRAPH:1]Ou restez en arrière comme quand vous y étiez obligé.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le chapitre suivant contient quelle vérité obscène ?[PARAGRAPH:1]Regarderez-vous le spectacle ou entrerez-vous sur scène ?
TEXT.German: Herbei Eure Macht! Ihr glaubtet, ich hätte sie übersehen.[NEWLINE]Oder, was längst schon solltet Ihr getan, bleibt stehen.[NEWLINE]Nun blättert weiter: Welch Wahrheit bringt das schmucke Blatt?[NEWLINE]Bleibt Ihr bei Eurem Stück oder wechselt doch in unsren Akt?
TEXT.Italian: Bring in the force you thought I would ignore[NEWLINE]Or hold back as you ought have done before.[NEWLINE]What truth does lie on the next embroidered page[NEWLINE]Will you watch the show or walk onto our stage?
TEXT.Spanish: Traed la fuerza que pensásteis que podría ignorar[NEWLINE]o retiráos como habéis dicho que hicísteis hace un año.[NEWLINE]¿Qué verdad miente en la siguiente página a pasar?[NEWLINE]¿observaréis el espectáculo u os iréis al baño?

TEXT.English: He that is your friend indeed,[NEWLINE]He will help you in your need:[NEWLINE]If you sorrow, he will weep; [NEWLINE]If you wake, he cannot sleep:[NEWLINE]Thus of every grief in heart[NEWLINE]He with you does bear a part.[NEWLINE]These are certain signs to know[NEWLINE]Faithful friend from flattering foe.
TEXT.French: [TAB]Il est votre ami et de loin,[PARAGRAPH:1]Il vous aidera dans le besoin :[PARAGRAPH:1]Si vous vous lamentez, il pleurera;[PARAGRAPH:1]Si vous vous réveillez, il veillera :[PARAGRAPH:1]A chaque grief dans votre cœur[PARAGRAPH:1]Il porte sa part avec faveur.[PARAGRAPH:1]Ce sont les signes par lesquels reconnaître[PARAGRAPH:1]L'ami véritable de l'enjôleur traître
TEXT.German: Der echte Freund, getreu bis in den Tod,[NEWLINE]gibt Hilfe dir in kleiner wie in großer Not.[NEWLINE]Bist du traurig, wird er mit dir weinen,[NEWLINE]bist du wach, kann Schlaf er finden keinen.[NEWLINE]Bei jedem Leid, jedem Kummer deines Herzen[NEWLINE]wird gerne teilen er mit dir die Schmerzen.[NEWLINE]Leicht kannst du scheiden, ich geb dir jeden Eid,[NEWLINE]den getreuen Freund von des Schmeichlers Neid.
TEXT.Italian: He that is your friend indeed,[NEWLINE]He will help you in your need:[NEWLINE]If you sorrow, he will weep; [NEWLINE]If you wake, he cannot sleep:[NEWLINE]Thus of every grief in heart[NEWLINE]He with you does bear a part.[NEWLINE]These are certain signs to know[NEWLINE]Faithful friend from flattering foe.
TEXT.Spanish: Aquel que sin duda vuestro amigo será,[NEWLINE]Os ayudará y os necesitará:[NEWLINE]Si estáis triste, el llorará; [NEWLINE]Si os despertáis, no dormirá:[NEWLINE]Así cada vez que el corazón os duela[NEWLINE]Él parte del dolor comparte y se lleva.[NEWLINE]Estas son certezas que conocer[NEWLINE]Del enemigo adulador, amigo fiel

TEXT.English: So even does the slightest flute[NEWLINE]Contribute to the choral bliss[NEWLINE]So will you pay me from your loot[NEWLINE]My feet I grace your lips to kiss[NEWLINE]Aim well your mark upon my boots[NEWLINE]Or else our sky-hurled cows won't miss
TEXT.French: [TAB]Comme la flûte la plus insignifiante[PARAGRAPH:1]Contribue pour que la chorale enchante[PARAGRAPH:1]Alors de votre trésor vous me paierez[PARAGRAPH:1]Mes pieds honorés par vos lèvres d'un baiser[PARAGRAPH:1]Laissez bien sur mes bottes une trace[PARAGRAPH:1]Ou du ciel viendra la menace
TEXT.German: Der kleinste Beitrag ist nicht nichtig,[NEWLINE]tragt bei zum Lobgesang, denn das ist richtig.[NEWLINE]Vorwärts, gebt mir meinen Teil vom Schatz,[NEWLINE]mein Fuß erwartet Euren küssenden Schmatz.[NEWLINE]Doch zielt gut, trefft meinen Schuh,[NEWLINE]denn sonst erwischt Euch meine fliegende Kuh.
TEXT.Italian: So even does the slightest flute[NEWLINE]Contribute to the choral bliss[NEWLINE]So will you pay me from your loot[NEWLINE]My feet I grace your lips to kiss[NEWLINE]Aim well your mark upon my boots[NEWLINE]Or else our sky-hurled cows won't miss
TEXT.Spanish: Incluso la más insignificante flauta[NEWLINE]contribuye a la dicha del coral[NEWLINE]así que me pagaréis de vuestro botín[NEWLINE]a mis pies les doy a vuestros labios la gracia de besar[NEWLINE]apuntad bien la marca sobre mis botas[NEWLINE]o si no nuestro cielo no se perderá las vacas lanzadas con violencia

TEXT.English: In Jubilee no show comes free[NEWLINE]Pay the Merryman for your delight.[NEWLINE]For amusement joined set loose your coin[NEWLINE]And dance with us into the night.
