TEXT.French: [TAB]À Jubilée aucune distraction ne se passe de paiement,[PARAGRAPH:1]Payez les Joyeux Drilles pour votre amusement.[PARAGRAPH:1]Pour votre délice, une pièce dans nos poches qui glisse[PARAGRAPH:1]Et toute la nuit, assouvissez vos vices
TEXT.German: In Jubilee, ein jeder weiß, ist nichts umsonst,[NEWLINE]so gebt den Gauklern, zahlt sie für die Narrenkunst.[NEWLINE]Und alle schrei'n: Ein jeder Spaß, der kostet was.[NEWLINE]Drum freut Euch jetzt, denn aufgemacht wird nun ein Fass.
TEXT.Italian: In Jubilee no show comes free[NEWLINE]Pay the Merryman for your delight.[NEWLINE]For amusement joined set loose your coin[NEWLINE]And dance with us into the night.
TEXT.Spanish: En Júbilo ningún espectáculo es gratis[NEWLINE]pagad al Jovial para vuestra diversión.[NEWLINE]Para sumaros al entretenimiento dad por perdida vuestra moneda[NEWLINE]y cantad junto a nosotros en la noche nuestra canción.

TEXT.English: So even does the slightest flute[NEWLINE]Contribute to the choral bliss[NEWLINE]So will you pay me from your loot[NEWLINE]My feet I grace your lips to kiss[NEWLINE]Aim well your mark upon my boots[NEWLINE]Or else our sky-hurled cows won't miss
TEXT.French: [TAB]Comme la flûte la plus insignifiante[PARAGRAPH:1]Contribue pour que la chorale enchante[PARAGRAPH:1]Alors de votre trésor vous me paierez[PARAGRAPH:1]Mes pieds honorés par vos lèvres d'un baiser[PARAGRAPH:1]Laissez bien sur mes bottes une trace[PARAGRAPH:1]Ou du ciel viendra la menace
TEXT.German: Der kleinste Beitrag ist nicht nichtig,[NEWLINE]tragt bei zum Lobgesang, denn das ist richtig.[NEWLINE]Vorwärts, gebt mir meinen Teil vom Schatz,[NEWLINE]mein Fuß erwartet Euren küssenden Schmatz.[NEWLINE]Doch zielt gut, trefft meinen Schuh,[NEWLINE]denn sonst erwischt Euch meine fliegende Kuh.
TEXT.Italian: So even does the slightest flute[NEWLINE]Contribute to the choral bliss[NEWLINE]So will you pay me from your loot[NEWLINE]My feet I grace your lips to kiss[NEWLINE]Aim well your mark upon my boots[NEWLINE]Or else our sky-hurled cows won't miss
TEXT.Spanish: Incluso la más insignificante flauta[NEWLINE]contribuye a la dicha del coral[NEWLINE]así que me pagaréis de vuestro botín[NEWLINE]a mis pies les doy a vuestros labios la gracia de besar[NEWLINE]apuntad bien la marca sobre mis botas[NEWLINE]o si no nuestro cielo no se perderá las vacas lanzadas con violencia

TEXT.English: This was a gift I dearly needed,[NEWLINE]Yet my demand has gone unheeded.[NEWLINE]Is it for arrogance that you're not paying,[NEWLINE]Or are you confused as to what I'm saying?
TEXT.French: C'était un cadeau que j'avais chèrement souhaité,[NEWLINE]Pourtant ma demande fût négligée.[NEWLINE]Est-ce par arrogance que vous ne voulez payer,[NEWLINE]ou êtes-vous confus par ce que j'ai énoncé?
TEXT.German: Ach, so dringend hatte ich Not an dieser Gabe.[NEWLINE]Doch Ihr, Ihr lehntet ab mit verwirrtem Gehabe.[NEWLINE]Ist's Arroganz, dass meinen Wunsch Ihr nicht achtet.[NEWLINE]Oder verkanntet Ihr ignorant, wonach ich so 'schmachtet?
TEXT.Italian: This was a gift I dearly needed,[NEWLINE]Yet my demand has gone unheeded.[NEWLINE]Is it for arrogance that you're not paying,[NEWLINE]Or are you confused as to what I'm saying?
TEXT.Spanish: Este era un regalo que realmente necesitaba, sin embargo mi demanda no ha sido atendida. ¿Es por arrogancia que no realizáis este pago, o estáis confundido en cuanto a lo que estoy diciéndoos?

TEXT.English: You did not heed my warnings [CT_NAME], and now your screams will join the others as you beg for the mercy of death.
TEXT.French: You did not heed my warnings [CT_NAME], and now your screams will join the others as you beg for the mercy of death.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt meine Warnungen in den Wind geschlagen, [CT_NAME]. Nun werden Eure Schreie sich im Wind verlieren mit denen der anderen, die um die Gnade des Todes winseln.
TEXT.Italian: You did not heed my warnings [CT_NAME], and now your screams will join the others as you beg for the mercy of death.
TEXT.Spanish: You did not heed my warnings [CT_NAME], and now your screams will join the others as you beg for the mercy of death.

TEXT.English: Do you know what the Balseraphs do to things that are beautiful, merciful, and kind? We destroy them.
TEXT.French: Do you know what the Balseraphs do to things that are beautiful, merciful, kind? We destroy them.
TEXT.German: Wisst Ihr, was die Balseraph mit Sachen anstellen, die schön, anmutig und nett sind? Wir ... machen sie kaputt!
TEXT.Italian: Do you know what the Balseraphs do to things that are beautiful, merciful, kind? We destroy them.
TEXT.Spanish: Do you know what the Balseraphs do to things that are beautiful, merciful, kind? We destroy them.

TEXT.English: Oh, but this is the part I enjoy the most. No time for words now. Not yet.
TEXT.French: Oh, but this is the part I enjoy the most. No time for words now. Not yet.
TEXT.German: Nein, das ist gerade die Stelle des Stückes, die ich am besten finde. Keine Zeit zu reden. Noch nicht.
TEXT.Italian: Oh, but this is the part I enjoy the most. No time for words now. Not yet.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, but this is the part I enjoy the most. No time for words now. Not yet.

TEXT.English: You're my new best friend! I broke my last one.
TEXT.French: Tu es mon nouveau meilleur ami. Malheureusement, ma dernière a dû être éliminés.
TEXT.German: Du bist mein neuer bester Freund. Leider ist mein letzter irgendwie kaputtgegangen.
TEXT.Italian: Sei il mio nuovo migliore amico. Purtroppo, il mio ultimo dovuto essere smaltiti.
TEXT.Spanish: Eres mi nuevo mejor amigo. Lamentablemente, mi último tuvo que ser eliminados.

TEXT.English: Do not cross me [CT_NAME], or you will find that there are fates worse than death.
TEXT.French: Do not cross me [CT_NAME], or you will find that there are fates worse than death.
TEXT.German: Legt Euch nicht mit mir an [CT_NAME], oder ihr werdet herausfinden, dass es weit schlimmere Schicksale als den bloßen Tod gibt.
TEXT.Italian: Do not cross me [CT_NAME], or you will find that there are fates worse than death.
TEXT.Spanish: Do not cross me [CT_NAME], or you will find that there are fates worse than death.

TEXT.English: Yes, this will do quite nicely
TEXT.French: Yes, this will do quite nicely
TEXT.German: Ja, das passt Uns gut.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, this will do quite nicely
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, this will do quite nicely

TEXT.English: "Your time is up toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been unfunny for too long..."[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, you'll be funny again without your legs !"
TEXT.French: - C'en est fini, jouet ![NEWLINE]- Tu n'as pas été amusant depuis trop longtemps...[NEWLINE]- T'en fais pas, tu seras à nouveau amusant sans tes jambes !
TEXT.German: "Your time is up toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been unfunny for too long..."[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, you'll be funny again without your legs !"
TEXT.Italian: "Your time is up toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been unfunny for too long..."[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, you'll be funny again without your legs !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Your time is up toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been unfunny for too long..."[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, you'll be funny again without your legs !"

TEXT.English: "You've been playing with us for too long, toy..."[NEWLINE]"You're a toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"Now it's time to reverse the roles !"
TEXT.French: - Tu joues avec nous depuis trop longtemps, jouet...[NEWLINE]- C'est toi le jouet, pas nous ![NEWLINE]- Maintenant c'est l'heure d'inverser les rôles !
TEXT.German: "You've been playing with us for too long, toy..."[NEWLINE]"You're a toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"Now it's time to reverse the roles !"
TEXT.Italian: "You've been playing with us for too long, toy..."[NEWLINE]"You're a toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"Now it's time to reverse the roles !"
TEXT.Spanish: "You've been playing with us for too long, toy..."[NEWLINE]"You're a toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"Now it's time to reverse the roles !"

TEXT.English: "There is a shortage of toys..."[NEWLINE]"This is no good..."[NEWLINE]"Care to protect us while we make some more?"
TEXT.French: - Nous sommes en manque de jouets...[NEWLINE]- C'est embêtant...[NEWLINE]- Tu peux nous protéger le temps qu'on en fabrique plus ?
TEXT.German: "There is a shortage of toys..."[NEWLINE]"This is no good..."[NEWLINE]"Care to protect us while we make some more?"
TEXT.Italian: "There is a shortage of toys..."[NEWLINE]"This is no good..."[NEWLINE]"Care to protect us while we make some more?"
TEXT.Spanish: "There is a shortage of toys..."[NEWLINE]"This is no good..."[NEWLINE]"Care to protect us while we make some more?"

TEXT.English: "A new toy? It looks funny !"[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy and we're gonna play fun games !"[NEWLINE]"Be a bad toy and we're gonna play even funnier games..."
TEXT.French: - Un nouveau jouet ? Il a l'air drôle ![NEWLINE]- Sois un bon jouet et on va jouer à des jeux drôles ![NEWLINE]- Sois un mauvais jouet et on va jouer à des jeux encore plus drôles...
TEXT.German: "A new toy? It looks funny !"[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy and we're gonna play fun games !"[NEWLINE]"Be a bad toy and we're gonna play even funnier games..."
TEXT.Italian: "A new toy? It looks funny !"[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy and we're gonna play fun games !"[NEWLINE]"Be a bad toy and we're gonna play even funnier games..."
TEXT.Spanish: "A new toy? It looks funny !"[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy and we're gonna play fun games !"[NEWLINE]"Be a bad toy and we're gonna play even funnier games..."

TEXT.English: "We don't want to talk to bad toys !"[NEWLINE]"Get out now, unless you want me to get my axe !"[NEWLINE]"Please stay, I want to cut that tongue !"
TEXT.French: - On veut pas parler aux mauvais jouets !"[NEWLINE]- Pars d'ici, à moins que tu veuille que j'aille chercher ma hache !"[NEWLINE]- S'il te plaît, reste, je veux couper cette langue !
TEXT.German: "We don't want to talk to bad toys !"[NEWLINE]"Get out now, unless you want me to get my axe !"[NEWLINE]"Please stay, I want to cut that tongue !"
TEXT.Italian: "We don't want to talk to bad toys !"[NEWLINE]"Get out now, unless you want me to get my axe !"[NEWLINE]"Please stay, I want to cut that tongue !"
TEXT.Spanish: "We don't want to talk to bad toys !"[NEWLINE]"Get out now, unless you want me to get my axe !"[NEWLINE]"Please stay, I want to cut that tongue !"

TEXT.English: "Hehe we can be gentle for now."[NEWLINE]"After all it's better to push a toy to its limits before breaking it !"[NEWLINE]"Now, is there any game you want to play?"
TEXT.French: - Héhé on peut rester calmes pour l'instant.[NEWLINE]- Après tout c'est mieux d'utiliser un jouet au maximum avant de le casser ![NEWLINE]- Du coup, y a-t-il un jeu auquel tu veux jouer?
TEXT.German: "Hehe we can be gentle for now."[NEWLINE]"After all it's better to push a toy to its limits before breaking it !"[NEWLINE]"Now, is there any game you want to play?"
TEXT.Italian: "Hehe we can be gentle for now."[NEWLINE]"After all it's better to push a toy to its limits before breaking it !"[NEWLINE]"Now, is there any game you want to play?"
TEXT.Spanish: "Hehe we can be gentle for now."[NEWLINE]"After all it's better to push a toy to its limits before breaking it !"[NEWLINE]"Now, is there any game you want to play?"

TEXT.English: "Come on, you're no fun !"[NEWLINE]"We haven't even cut your fingers yet !"[NEWLINE]"Now come here, I'll start with the pinky !"
TEXT.French: - Voyons, t'es pas drôle ![NEWLINE]- On t'as même pas encore tranché les doigts ![NEWLINE]- Maintenant ramène-toi, je vais commencer par le petit doigt !
TEXT.German: "Come on, you're no fun !"[NEWLINE]"We haven't even cut your fingers yet !"[NEWLINE]"Now come here, I'll start with the pinky !"
TEXT.Italian: "Come on, you're no fun !"[NEWLINE]"We haven't even cut your fingers yet !"[NEWLINE]"Now come here, I'll start with the pinky !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Come on, you're no fun !"[NEWLINE]"We haven't even cut your fingers yet !"[NEWLINE]"Now come here, I'll start with the pinky !"

TEXT.English: "Hey, look who's back !"[NEWLINE]"The bestest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Which game are we gonna play today, bestest of toys?"
TEXT.French: - Hé, regardez qui voilà ![NEWLINE]- Le meilleur des jouets ![NEWLINE]- On va jouer à quoi aujourd'hui, meilleur jouet?
TEXT.German: "Hey, look who's back !"[NEWLINE]"The bestest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Which game are we gonna play today, bestest of toys?"
TEXT.Italian: "Hey, look who's back !"[NEWLINE]"The bestest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Which game are we gonna play today, bestest of toys?"
TEXT.Spanish: "Hey, look who's back !"[NEWLINE]"The bestest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Which game are we gonna play today, bestest of toys?"

TEXT.English: "You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"Maybe we won't saw off your legs..."[NEWLINE]"...Yet."
TEXT.French: - T'as été un bon jouet jusqu'à maintenant.[NEWLINE]- Peut-être qu'on va pas te couper les jambes...[NEWLINE]- ...Pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: "You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"Maybe we won't saw off your legs..."[NEWLINE]"...Yet."
TEXT.Italian: "You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"Maybe we won't saw off your legs..."[NEWLINE]"...Yet."
TEXT.Spanish: "You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"Maybe we won't saw off your legs..."[NEWLINE]"...Yet."

TEXT.English: "So, what are we playing today?"[NEWLINE]"I may have some ideas..."[NEWLINE]"If you have a better one make it quick, the blood on my knife is beginning to dry !"
TEXT.French: - Alors, à quoi on jour aujourd'hui?[NEWLINE]- Je crois que j'ai quelques idées...[NEWLINE]- Si t'en as des meilleures fait vite, le sang sur mon couteau commence à sécher !
TEXT.German: "So, what are we playing today?"[NEWLINE]"I may have some ideas..."[NEWLINE]"If you have a better one make it quick, the blood on my knife is beginning to dry !"
TEXT.Italian: "So, what are we playing today?"[NEWLINE]"I may have some ideas..."[NEWLINE]"If you have a better one make it quick, the blood on my knife is beginning to dry !"
TEXT.Spanish: "So, what are we playing today?"[NEWLINE]"I may have some ideas..."[NEWLINE]"If you have a better one make it quick, the blood on my knife is beginning to dry !"

TEXT.English: "I think you are the worstest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Be funny again ! Or else..."[NEWLINE]"Unfunny toys are only funny when we break them !"
TEXT.French: - Je pense que tu es le pire des jouets ![NEWLINE]- Deviens à nouveau drôle ! Ou sinon...[NEWLINE]- Les jouets pas drôles ne le sont que quand on les casse !"
TEXT.German: "I think you are the worstest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Be funny again ! Or else..."[NEWLINE]"Unfunny toys are only funny when we break them !"
TEXT.Italian: "I think you are the worstest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Be funny again ! Or else..."[NEWLINE]"Unfunny toys are only funny when we break them !"
TEXT.Spanish: "I think you are the worstest of toys !"[NEWLINE]"Be funny again ! Or else..."[NEWLINE]"Unfunny toys are only funny when we break them !"

TEXT.English: "Don't move, I'm getting my saw !"[NEWLINE]"And my axe !"[NEWLINE]"And my knives !"
TEXT.French: - Bouge pas, je vais chercher ma scie ![NEWLINE]- Et ma hache ![NEWLINE]- Et mes couteaux !
TEXT.German: "Don't move, I'm getting my saw !"[NEWLINE]"And my axe !"[NEWLINE]"And my knives !"
TEXT.Italian: "Don't move, I'm getting my saw !"[NEWLINE]"And my axe !"[NEWLINE]"And my knives !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Don't move, I'm getting my saw !"[NEWLINE]"And my axe !"[NEWLINE]"And my knives !"

TEXT.English: "Yes?"[NEWLINE]"What do you want?"[NEWLINE]"Be quick !"
TEXT.French: - Oui?[NEWLINE]- Qu'est-ce que tu veux?[NEWLINE]- Fais vite !
TEXT.German: "Yes?"[NEWLINE]"What do you want?"[NEWLINE]"Be quick !"
TEXT.Italian: "Yes?"[NEWLINE]"What do you want?"[NEWLINE]"Be quick !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Yes?"[NEWLINE]"What do you want?"[NEWLINE]"Be quick !"

TEXT.English: "You think that's good enough?"[NEWLINE]"Yeah, it should !"[NEWLINE]"That's decided, we accept!"
TEXT.French: - Tu crois que ça suffit?[NEWLINE]- Ouais ça devrait ![NEWLINE]- C'est décidé, on accepte!
TEXT.German: "You think that's good enough?"[NEWLINE]"Yeah, it should !"[NEWLINE]"That's decided, we accept!"
TEXT.Italian: "You think that's good enough?"[NEWLINE]"Yeah, it should !"[NEWLINE]"That's decided, we accept!"
TEXT.Spanish: "You think that's good enough?"[NEWLINE]"Yeah, it should !"[NEWLINE]"That's decided, we accept!"

TEXT.English: "You're a funny toy !"[NEWLINE]"We like jokes, as long as they are not repetitive..."[NEWLINE]"Find another one now, before it stops being funny !"
TEXT.French: - T'es un jouet amusant ![NEWLINE]- On aime les blagues, tant qu'elles sont pas répétitives...[NEWLINE]- Trouves autre chose maintenant, avant que ce ne soit plus amusant !
TEXT.German: "You're a funny toy !"[NEWLINE]"We like jokes, as long as they are not repetitive..."[NEWLINE]"Find another one now, before it stops being funny !"
TEXT.Italian: "You're a funny toy !"[NEWLINE]"We like jokes, as long as they are not repetitive..."[NEWLINE]"Find another one now, before it stops being funny !"
TEXT.Spanish: "You're a funny toy !"[NEWLINE]"We like jokes, as long as they are not repetitive..."[NEWLINE]"Find another one now, before it stops being funny !"

TEXT.English: "Are you trying to cheat on us?!"[NEWLINE]"We have... *count on his fingers* three brains, and you only one !"[NEWLINE]"Find something better or the number is gonna get lower !"
TEXT.French: - T'essayes de nous arnaquer?![NEWLINE]- On a... *compte sur ses doigts* trois cerveaux, toi qu'un seul ![NEWLINE]- Trouve mieux ou le compte va baisser !
TEXT.German: "Are you trying to cheat on us?!"[NEWLINE]"We have... *count on his fingers* three brains, and you only one !"[NEWLINE]"Find something better or the number is gonna get lower !"
TEXT.Italian: "Are you trying to cheat on us?!"[NEWLINE]"We have... *count on his fingers* three brains, and you only one !"[NEWLINE]"Find something better or the number is gonna get lower !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Are you trying to cheat on us?!"[NEWLINE]"We have... *count on his fingers* three brains, and you only one !"[NEWLINE]"Find something better or the number is gonna get lower !"

TEXT.English: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thank you."[NEWLINE]"We'll remember that next time we seek a toy to dismember !"
TEXT.French: - Bon jouet ![NEWLINE]- Merci.[NEWLINE]- On gardera ça en tête la prochaine fois qu'on cherchera un jouet à démembrer !
TEXT.German: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thank you."[NEWLINE]"We'll remember that next time we seek a toy to dismember !"
TEXT.Italian: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thank you."[NEWLINE]"We'll remember that next time we seek a toy to dismember !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thank you."[NEWLINE]"We'll remember that next time we seek a toy to dismember !"

TEXT.English: "See ? It's not hard to be a good toy"[NEWLINE]"We may not have to break you..."[NEWLINE]"... Yet."
TEXT.French: - Tu vois? C'est pas dur d'être un bon jouet ![NEWLINE]- Il semblerait qu'on ai pas à te casser...[NEWLINE]- ... Pour l'instant !
TEXT.German: "See ? It's not hard to be a good toy"[NEWLINE]"We may not have to break you..."[NEWLINE]"... Yet."
TEXT.Italian: "See ? It's not hard to be a good toy"[NEWLINE]"We may not have to break you..."[NEWLINE]"... Yet."
TEXT.Spanish: "See ? It's not hard to be a good toy"[NEWLINE]"We may not have to break you..."[NEWLINE]"... Yet."

TEXT.English: "You want something else ?"[NEWLINE]"It's unusual for us to listen to toys !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, now be quick !"
TEXT.French: - Tu veux quelque chose d'autre?[NEWLINE]- C'est pas dans nos habitudes d'écouter un jouet ![NEWLINE]- T'es un jouet chanceux, maintenant fait vite !
TEXT.German: "You want something else ?"[NEWLINE]"It's unusual for us to listen to toys !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, now be quick !"
TEXT.Italian: "You want something else ?"[NEWLINE]"It's unusual for us to listen to toys !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, now be quick !"
TEXT.Spanish: "You want something else ?"[NEWLINE]"It's unusual for us to listen to toys !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, now be quick !"

TEXT.English: "You don't understand your place, toy..."[NEWLINE]"We make the jokes, not you !"[NEWLINE]"Be quick and be clever, or I'll get my knives !"
TEXT.French: - Tu comprends pas ton rôle, jouet...[NEWLINE]- C'est nous qui faisons les blagues, pas toi ![NEWLINE]- Fait vite et intelligemment, ou je vais chercher mes couteaux !
TEXT.German: "You don't understand your place, toy..."[NEWLINE]"We make the jokes, not you !"[NEWLINE]"Be quick and be clever, or I'll get my knives !"
TEXT.Italian: "You don't understand your place, toy..."[NEWLINE]"We make the jokes, not you !"[NEWLINE]"Be quick and be clever, or I'll get my knives !"
TEXT.Spanish: "You don't understand your place, toy..."[NEWLINE]"We make the jokes, not you !"[NEWLINE]"Be quick and be clever, or I'll get my knives !"

TEXT.English: "You're pretty bad at making jokes, toy."[NEWLINE]"We'll teach you how to be funny !"[NEWLINE]"Look, here's a better one..."
TEXT.French: - T'es pas très bon en blagues, jouet.[NEWLINE]- On va t'apprendre à être drôle ![NEWLINE]- Regarde, en voici une meilleure...
TEXT.German: "You're pretty bad at making jokes, toy."[NEWLINE]"We'll teach you how to be funny !"[NEWLINE]"Look, here's a better one..."
TEXT.Italian: "You're pretty bad at making jokes, toy."[NEWLINE]"We'll teach you how to be funny !"[NEWLINE]"Look, here's a better one..."
TEXT.Spanish: "You're pretty bad at making jokes, toy."[NEWLINE]"We'll teach you how to be funny !"[NEWLINE]"Look, here's a better one..."

TEXT.English: "Don't play with us !"[NEWLINE]"This is not gonna cut it..."[NEWLINE]"Unlike our knives !"
TEXT.French: - Ne joues pas avec nous ![NEWLINE]- Cette offre est pas suffisante...[NEWLINE]- Contrairement à nos lames pour le démembrement !
TEXT.German: "Don't play with us !"[NEWLINE]"This is not gonna cut it..."[NEWLINE]"Unlike our knives !"
TEXT.Italian: "Don't play with us !"[NEWLINE]"This is not gonna cut it..."[NEWLINE]"Unlike our knives !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Don't play with us !"[NEWLINE]"This is not gonna cut it..."[NEWLINE]"Unlike our knives !"

TEXT.English: "This is not enough !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can be..."[NEWLINE]"Just add an hour or two of three-on-one playtime in there, and we'll accept !"
TEXT.French: "C'est pas assez ![NEWLINE]- Enfin, ça pourrait le devenir...[NEWLINE]- Ajoutes juste une heure ou deux de jeu en tête à tête, et on acceptera !
TEXT.German: "This is not enough !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can be..."[NEWLINE]"Just add an hour or two of three on one playtime in there, and we'll accept !"
TEXT.Italian: "This is not enough !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can be..."[NEWLINE]"Just add an hour or two of three on one playtime in there, and we'll accept !"
TEXT.Spanish: "This is not enough !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can be..."[NEWLINE]"Just add an hour or two of three on one playtime in there, and we'll accept !"

TEXT.English: "This is getting boring..."[NEWLINE]"War is fun, but for now we want to play another game !"[NEWLINE]"We propose to not break you for now, what do you say, toy?"
TEXT.French: - Ca commence à devenir ennuyeux...[NEWLINE]- La guerre c'est drôle, mais pour l'instant on veut jouer à un autre jeu ![NEWLINE]- On propose de ne pas te casser pour l'instant, qu'est-ce que tu en dis, jouet?
TEXT.German: "This is getting boring..."[NEWLINE]"War is fun, but for now we want to play another game !"[NEWLINE]"We propose to not break you for now, what do you say toy?"
TEXT.Italian: "This is getting boring..."[NEWLINE]"War is fun, but for now we want to play another game !"[NEWLINE]"We propose to not break you for now, what do you say toy?"
TEXT.Spanish: "This is getting boring..."[NEWLINE]"War is fun, but for now we want to play another game !"[NEWLINE]"We propose to not break you for now, what do you say toy?"

TEXT.English: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now, so we let you a chance to have something in return !"[NEWLINE]"Don't be greedy though, greedy toys are bad toys..."
TEXT.French: - On veut quelque chose que tu as, jouet ![NEWLINE]- T'as été un bon jouet jusque-là, donc on te laisse une chance d'avoir quelque chose en échange ![NEWLINE]- Sois pas trop gourmand par contre, les jouets gourmands sont de mauvais jouets...
TEXT.German: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now, so we let you a chance to have something in return !"[NEWLINE]"Don't be greedy though, greedy toys are bad toys..."
TEXT.Italian: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now, so we let you a chance to have something in return !"[NEWLINE]"Don't be greedy though, greedy toys are bad toys..."
TEXT.Spanish: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now, so we let you a chance to have something in return !"[NEWLINE]"Don't be greedy though, greedy toys are bad toys..."

TEXT.English: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, you don't deserve anything else than an axe in the head in exchange !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can still happen if you don't accept..."
TEXT.French: - On veut quelque chose que tu as, jouet ![NEWLINE]- Considère toi chanceux, jouet, tu mériterais rien d'autre qu'une hache dans la tête en échange ![NEWLINE]"Enfin, ça peut toujours s'arranger si t'acceptes pas...
TEXT.German: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, you don't deserve anything else than an axe in the head in exchange !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can still happen if you don't accept..."
TEXT.Italian: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, you don't deserve anything else than an axe in the head in exchange !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can still happen if you don't accept..."
TEXT.Spanish: "We want something you have toy !"[NEWLINE]"Consider yourself a lucky toy, you don't deserve anything else than an axe in the head in exchange !"[NEWLINE]"Well, it can still happen if you don't accept..."

TEXT.English: "You've been a funny toy until now..."[NEWLINE]"... But this deal is not funny anymore."[NEWLINE]"Trust us, we're experts in funny stuff."
TEXT.French: - T'as été un jouet amusant jusque-là...[NEWLINE]- ... Mais cet accord n'est plus aussi amusant qu'avant.[NEWLINE]"Fais nous confiance, on est des experts en amusement.
TEXT.German: "You've been a funny toy until now..."[NEWLINE]"... But this deal is not funny anymore."[NEWLINE]"Trust us, we're experts in funny stuff."
TEXT.Italian: "You've been a funny toy until now..."[NEWLINE]"... But this deal is not funny anymore."[NEWLINE]"Trust us, we're experts in funny stuff."
TEXT.Spanish: "You've been a funny toy until now..."[NEWLINE]"... But this deal is not funny anymore."[NEWLINE]"Trust us, we're experts in funny stuff."

TEXT.English: "This is not funny anymore !"[NEWLINE]"We are breaking this deal !"[NEWLINE]"Maybe your legs are next !"
TEXT.French: - Ce n'est plus amusant ![NEWLINE]- Nous brisons cet accord ![NEWLINE]- Peut-être que ce sera ensuite au tour de tes jambes !
TEXT.German: "This is not funny anymore !"[NEWLINE]"We are breaking this deal !"[NEWLINE]"Maybe your legs are next !"
TEXT.Italian: "This is not funny anymore !"[NEWLINE]"We are breaking this deal !"[NEWLINE]"Maybe your legs are next !"
TEXT.Spanish: "This is not funny anymore !"[NEWLINE]"We are breaking this deal !"[NEWLINE]"Maybe your legs are next !"

TEXT.English: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thanks, we won't break you..."[NEWLINE]"...For now."
TEXT.French: - Bon jouet ![NEWLINE]- Merci, on va pas te casser...[NEWLINE]- ... Pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thanks, we won't break you..."[NEWLINE]"...For now."
TEXT.Italian: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thanks, we won't break you..."[NEWLINE]"...For now."
TEXT.Spanish: "Good toy !"[NEWLINE]"Thanks, we won't break you..."[NEWLINE]"...For now."

TEXT.English: "Here are all the deals we made until now."[NEWLINE]"We can still make more !"[NEWLINE]"For a limb or two, we can teach you how to have fun with mutilation !"
TEXT.French: - Voilà tous les accords que nous avons passé.[NEWLINE]- On peut toujours en passer plus ![NEWLINE]- Contre un membre ou deux, on peut t'apprendre comment mutiler en s'amusant !
TEXT.German: "Here are all the deals we made until now."[NEWLINE]"We can still make more !"[NEWLINE]"For a limb or two, we can teach you how to have fun with mutilation !"
TEXT.Italian: "Here are all the deals we made until now."[NEWLINE]"We can still make more !"[NEWLINE]"For a limb or two, we can teach you how to have fun with mutilation !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Here are all the deals we made until now."[NEWLINE]"We can still make more !"[NEWLINE]"For a limb or two, we can teach you how to have fun with mutilation !"

TEXT.English: "Why not?"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"We think we can spare that, if it means you won't break yet."
TEXT.French: - Pourquoi pas?[NEWLINE]- T'as été un bon jouet jusque-là.[NEWLINE]- On peut se passer de ça, si ça peut t'empêcher de casser pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: "Why not?"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"We think we can spare that, if it means you won't break yet."
TEXT.Italian: "Why not?"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"We think we can spare that, if it means you won't break yet."
TEXT.Spanish: "Why not?"[NEWLINE]"You've been a good toy until now."[NEWLINE]"We think we can spare that, if it means you won't break yet."

TEXT.English: "Nah !"[NEWLINE]"Toys don't get to ask for things !"[NEWLINE]"We are the ones playing with you, not the other way around."
TEXT.French: - Nan ![NEWLINE]- C'est pas aux jouets de réclamer des trucs ![NEWLINE]- C'est nous qui jouons avec toi, pas l'inverse.
TEXT.German: "Nah !"[NEWLINE]"Toys don't get to ask for things !"[NEWLINE]"We are the ones playing with you, not the other way around."
TEXT.Italian: "Nah !"[NEWLINE]"Toys don't get to ask for things !"[NEWLINE]"We are the ones playing with you, not the other way around."
TEXT.Spanish: "Nah !"[NEWLINE]"Toys don't get to ask for things !"[NEWLINE]"We are the ones playing with you, not the other way around."

TEXT.English: "Take it and be gone !"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, toys always give back what they take..."[NEWLINE]"A toy full of regrets is always funnier to break !"
TEXT.French: - Prends ça et pars ![NEWLINE]- T'en fais pas, les jouets finissent toujours par rendre ce qu'ils prennent...[NEWLINE]- Un jouet qui regrette est toujours plus amusant à casser !
TEXT.German: "Take it and be gone !"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, toys always give back what they take..."[NEWLINE]"A regretful toy is always funnier to break !"
TEXT.Italian: "Take it and be gone !"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, toys always give back what they take..."[NEWLINE]"A regretful toy is always funnier to break !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Take it and be gone !"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry, toys always give back what they take..."[NEWLINE]"A regretful toy is always funnier to break !"

TEXT.English: "You are the toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"We take things, you don't !"[NEWLINE]"You're acting like a bad toy, maybe losing a hand will teach you how a good toy should behave."
TEXT.French: - C'est toi le jouet, pas nous ![NEWLINE]- On prends des trucs, pas toi ![NEWLINE]- Tu agis comme un mauvais jouet, peut-être que perdre une main t'apprendrais à te comporter en bon jouet.
TEXT.German: "You are the toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"We take things, you don't !"[NEWLINE]"You're acting like a bad toy, maybe losing a hand will teach you how a toy should behave."
TEXT.Italian: "You are the toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"We take things, you don't !"[NEWLINE]"You're acting like a bad toy, maybe losing a hand will teach you how a toy should behave."
TEXT.Spanish: "You are the toy, not us !"[NEWLINE]"We take things, you don't !"[NEWLINE]"You're acting like a bad toy, maybe losing a hand will teach you how a toy should behave."

TEXT.English: "You've been a very good toy !"[NEWLINE]"You can have this !"[NEWLINE]"A treat to help you continue being so funny !"
TEXT.French: - T'as été un très bon jouet ![NEWLINE]- Tiens ![NEWLINE]- Une récompense pour t'aider à continuer à être aussi amusant !
TEXT.German: "You've been a very good toy !"[NEWLINE]"You can have this !"[NEWLINE]"A treat to help you continue being so funny !"
TEXT.Italian: "You've been a very good toy !"[NEWLINE]"You can have this !"[NEWLINE]"A treat to help you continue being so funny !"
TEXT.Spanish: "You've been a very good toy !"[NEWLINE]"You can have this !"[NEWLINE]"A treat to help you continue being so funny !"

TEXT.English: "We may or may not be in a pickle, toy."[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy now, and we promise we won't break you anything."[NEWLINE]"Not even a finger !"
TEXT.French: - Notre situation est peut-être un peu compliquée, jouet.[NEWLINE]- Sois un bon jouet, et on promet qu'on te cassera rien.[NEWLINE]- Même pas un doigt !
TEXT.German: "We may or may not be in a pickle, toy."[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy now, and we promise we won't break you anything."[NEWLINE]"Not even a finger !"
TEXT.Italian: "We may or may not be in a pickle, toy."[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy now, and we promise we won't break you anything."[NEWLINE]"Not even a finger !"
TEXT.Spanish: "We may or may not be in a pickle, toy."[NEWLINE]"Be a good toy now, and we promise we won't break you anything."[NEWLINE]"Not even a finger !"

TEXT.English: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"Forget about the finger thing, this is your whole arm we're gonna have fun with !"[NEWLINE]"Then the rest of the body !"
TEXT.French: - Vilain jouet ![NEWLINE]- Oublie les doigts, c'est avec tout ton bras qu'on va s'amuser ![NEWLINE]- Et ensuite le reste du corps !
TEXT.German: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"Forget about the finger thing, this is your whole arm we're gonna have fun with !"[NEWLINE]"Then the rest of the body !"
TEXT.Italian: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"Forget about the finger thing, this is your whole arm we're gonna have fun with !"[NEWLINE]"Then the rest of the body !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"Forget about the finger thing, this is your whole arm we're gonna have fun with !"[NEWLINE]"Then the rest of the body !"

TEXT.English: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"This is not funny, toy !"[NEWLINE]"We'll have our fun either way, but you may not like the position you're in when it will happen !"
TEXT.French: - Vilain jouet ![NEWLINE]- Ce n'est pas drôle, jouet ![NEWLINE]- On finira par s'amuser quoi qu'il arrive, mais tu risques de pas aimer la place que tu aura quand ça arrivera !
TEXT.German: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"This is not funny, toy !"[NEWLINE]"We'll have our fun either way, but you may not like the position you're in when it will happen !"
TEXT.Italian: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"This is not funny, toy !"[NEWLINE]"We'll have our fun either way, but you may not like the position you're in when it will happen !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Bad toy !"[NEWLINE]"This is not funny, toy !"[NEWLINE]"We'll have our fun either way, but you may not like the position you're in when it will happen !"

TEXT.English: "Don't worry, it was a joke !"[NEWLINE]"Pretty funny, eh?"[NEWLINE]"Here's another one : we won't hurt you ever !"
TEXT.French: - T'en fais pas, c'était une blague ![NEWLINE]- Plutôt drôle, hein?[NEWLINE]- En voici une autre : on te fera jamais le moindre mal !
TEXT.German: "Don't worry, it was a joke !"[NEWLINE]"Pretty funny, eh?"[NEWLINE]"Here's another one : we won't hurt you ever !"
TEXT.Italian: "Don't worry, it was a joke !"[NEWLINE]"Pretty funny, eh?"[NEWLINE]"Here's another one : we won't hurt you ever !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Don't worry, it was a joke !"[NEWLINE]"Pretty funny, eh?"[NEWLINE]"Here's another one : we won't hurt you ever !"

TEXT.English: WE WANT THIS RIGHT HERE RIGHT NOW !
TEXT.French: ON VEUT CECI MAINTENANT TOUT DE SUITE !
TEXT.German: WE WANT THIS RIGHT HERE RIGHT NOW !
TEXT.Italian: WE WANT THIS RIGHT HERE RIGHT NOW !
TEXT.Spanish: WE WANT THIS RIGHT HERE RIGHT NOW !

TEXT.English: "Here's a riddle !"[NEWLINE]"What do people value more, this or their limbs?"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry toy, there's no wrong answer for us !"
TEXT.French: - On a une devinette ![NEWLINE]- Qu'est-ce qui a le plus de valeur pour les gens, ceci ou leurs membres?[NEWLINE]- T'en fais pas, jouet, pour nous il n'y a pas de mauvaise réponse !
TEXT.German: "Here's a riddle !"[NEWLINE]"What do you value more, this thing or your limbs?"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry toy, there's no wrong answer for us !"
TEXT.Italian: "Here's a riddle !"[NEWLINE]"What do you value more, this thing or your limbs?"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry toy, there's no wrong answer for us !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Here's a riddle !"[NEWLINE]"What do you value more, this thing or your limbs?"[NEWLINE]"Don't worry toy, there's no wrong answer for us !"

TEXT.English: "You've been a good toy until now !"[NEWLINE]"Surely you want it to stay this way?"[NEWLINE]"We'll just need this thing !"
TEXT.French: - T'as été un bon jouet jusqu'à maintenant ![NEWLINE]- T'as envie que ça continue comme ça, pas vrai?[NEWLINE]- On a juste besoin de ceci !
TEXT.German: "You've been a good toy until now !"[NEWLINE]"Surely you want it to stay this way?"[NEWLINE]"We'll just need this thing !"
TEXT.Italian: "You've been a good toy until now !"[NEWLINE]"Surely you want it to stay this way?"[NEWLINE]"We'll just need this thing !"
TEXT.Spanish: "You've been a good toy until now !"[NEWLINE]"Surely you want it to stay this way?"[NEWLINE]"We'll just need this thing !"

TEXT.English: "Stupid toy, you don't understand your place !"[NEWLINE]"We get our fun, one way or the other !"[NEWLINE]"And you're currently in range of the funniest of our tools !"
TEXT.French: - T'es un jouet stupide, tu comprends pas la situation dans laquelle tu es ![NEWLINE]- On finit toujours par s'amuser, d'une façon ou d'une autre ![NEWLINE]- Et tu es actuellement à portée de nos outils les plus amusants !
TEXT.German: "Stupid toy, you don't understand your place !"[NEWLINE]" We get our fun, one way or the other !"[NEWLINE]"And you're currently in range of the funniest of our tools !"
TEXT.Italian: "Stupid toy, you don't understand your place !"[NEWLINE]" We get our fun, one way or the other !"[NEWLINE]"And you're currently in range of the funniest of our tools !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Stupid toy, you don't understand your place !"[NEWLINE]" We get our fun, one way or the other !"[NEWLINE]"And you're currently in range of the funniest of our tools !"

TEXT.English: "You're starting to get unfunny !"[NEWLINE]"Dibs on their legs !"[NEWLINE]"Change your mind quickly, or we'll have to start having fun together..."
TEXT.French: - Tu commences à cesser d'être drôle ![NEWLINE]- Je réserve les jambes ![NEWLINE]- Change vite d'avis, ou on va devoir bien s'amuser ensemble...
TEXT.German: "You're starting to get unfunny !"[NEWLINE]"Dibs on their legs !"[NEWLINE]"Change your mind quickly, or we'll have to start having fun together..."
TEXT.Italian: "You're starting to get unfunny !"[NEWLINE]"Dibs on their legs !"[NEWLINE]"Change your mind quickly, or we'll have to start having fun together..."
TEXT.Spanish: "You're starting to get unfunny !"[NEWLINE]"Dibs on their legs !"[NEWLINE]"Change your mind quickly, or we'll have to start having fun together..."

TEXT.English: "Don't worry toy, you're only delaying our fun !"[NEWLINE]"We can wait for now."[NEWLINE]"Especially if it means more screams in the end !"
TEXT.French: - T'en fais pas, jouet, tu ne fais que retarder notre amusement ![NEWLINE]- On peut attendre pour l'instant.[NEWLINE]- Surtout si ça veut dire encore plus de cris quand ça arrivera !
TEXT.German: "Don't worry toy, you're only delaying our fun !"[NEWLINE]"We can wait for now."[NEWLINE]"Especially if it means more screams in the end !"
TEXT.Italian: "Don't worry toy, you're only delaying our fun !"[NEWLINE]"We can wait for now."[NEWLINE]"Especially if it means more screams in the end !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Don't worry toy, you're only delaying our fun !"[NEWLINE]"We can wait for now."[NEWLINE]"Especially if it means more screams in the end !"

TEXT.English: "The %s1:3 are no fun !"[NEWLINE]"Come help us make them more funny !"[NEWLINE]"We're gonna leave you some legs and a head or two, promise !"
TEXT.French: - Les %s1:3 ne sont pas drôles ![NEWLINE]- Viens nous aider à les rendre plus amusants ![NEWLINE]- Promis, on te laissera des jambes, et une tête ou deux !
TEXT.German: "The %s1:3 are no fun !"[NEWLINE]"Come help us make them more funny !"[NEWLINE]"We're gonna leave you some legs and a head or two, promise !"
TEXT.Italian: "The %s1:3 are no fun !"[NEWLINE]"Come help us make them more funny !"[NEWLINE]"We're gonna leave you some legs and a head or two, promise !"
TEXT.Spanish: "The %s1:3 are no fun !"[NEWLINE]"Come help us make them more funny !"[NEWLINE]"We're gonna leave you some legs and a head or two, promise !"

TEXT.English: "Noooooo ! All our toys are broken !"[NEWLINE]"Why did you do this?! You don't understand !"[NEWLINE]"This is funny when WE do it, WE are the ones who should be having fun !"
TEXT.French: - Noooooon ! Tous nos jouets sont cassés ![NEWLINE]- Pourquoi vous avez fait ça?! Vous comprenez pas ![NEWLINE]- C'est drôle quand c'est NOUS qui le faisons, c'est NOUS qui devrions nous amuser !
TEXT.German: "Noooooo ! All our toys are broken !"[NEWLINE]"Why did you do this?! You don't understand !"[NEWLINE]"This is funny when WE do it, WE are the ones who should be having fun !"
TEXT.Italian: "Noooooo ! All our toys are broken !"[NEWLINE]"Why did you do this?! You don't understand !"[NEWLINE]"This is funny when WE do it, WE are the ones who should be having fun !"
TEXT.Spanish: "Noooooo ! All our toys are broken !"[NEWLINE]"Why did you do this?! You don't understand !"[NEWLINE]"This is funny when WE do it, WE are the ones who should be having fun !"

TEXT.English: Someone new! How delightful! Which sort of plaything will you be? One that dances and sings? Or one that carries on with cries of sorrow. Oh how I do hate those...
TEXT.French: Une nouvelle rencontre ! Comme c'est charmant ! Quelle sorte de jouet allez-vous être ? Un qui danse et chante ? Ou un qui se lamente continuellement ? Oh, comme je les déteste ceux-là...
TEXT.German: Oh, jemand neues! Wie köstlich! Was für ein Zeitvertreib werdet Ihr werden? Einer, der singt und tanzt? Oder einer, der sich auf Gejammer und tiefe Trauer verlegt? Wisst Ihr ... die hasse ich ja ...
TEXT.Italian: Qualcuno nuovo! Come delizioso! Il mio creazioni sono sempre stati quelli che ballano e si divertono. Eppure ci sono quelli il cui grido fare diventare abbastanza fastidioso. Quale tipo di giocattolo vi sarà?
TEXT.Spanish: Alguien nuevo! ¿Cómo encantadora! Mis favoritos siempre han sido creaciones de los que la danza y divertirse. Sin embargo, son los gritos que se vuelven muy molestos. ¿Qué tipo de juguete se va a?

TEXT.English: You're my new best friend! Regrettably, I broke my last one.
TEXT.French: Tu es mon nouveau meilleur ami ! Malheureusement, j'ai cassé mon dernier.
TEXT.German: Du bist mein neuer bester Freund. Meinen letzten hab ich leider kaputt gemacht.
TEXT.Italian: Sei il mio nuovo migliore amico. Purtroppo, il mio ultimo dovuto essere smaltiti.
TEXT.Spanish: Eres mi nuevo mejor amigo. Lamentablemente, mi último tuvo que ser eliminados.

TEXT.English: Ah, hello! I was just looking for a subject for my latest painting. Yes, I think you'll do quite nicely. What can I do for you?
TEXT.French: Ah, bonjour! J'étais à la recherche d'un sujet pour ma dernière peinture. Oui, je pense que vous ferez très bien l'affaire. Que puis-je faire pour vous?
TEXT.German: Ach, hallo! Ich war noch auf der Suche nach einem Thema für mein neuestes Gemälde. Ja .. Ich glaube, Ihr werdet Euch gut in Öl machen. Was kann ich für Euch tun?
TEXT.Italian: Ah, ciao! Ero solo alla ricerca di un oggetto per la mia ultima pittura. Sì .. penso che faremo molto bene. Che cosa posso fare per te?
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, hola! Estaba buscando un tema para mi última pintura. Sí. .. creo que va a hacer muy bien. ¿Qué puedo hacer por usted?

TEXT.English: Can't you see I have better things to do than carry on with the likes of you?
TEXT.French: Ne pouvez-vous pas voir que j'ai des chose plus importantes à faire que m'occuper de celles de votre genre ?
TEXT.German: Seht Ihr nicht, dass ich besseres zu tun habe, als mich mit Gestalten wie Euch abzugeben?
TEXT.Italian: Non potete vedere mi occupo?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿No ves que estoy ocupado?

TEXT.English: War does not determine who is right-only who is left.
TEXT.French: La guerre ne désigne pas celui qui a raison, seulement celui qui reste.
TEXT.German: Krieg bestimmt nicht den, der Recht hat. Nur den, der übrig bleibt.
TEXT.Italian: War does not determine who is right-only who is left.
TEXT.Spanish: La guerra no determina quién está en lo cierto... sino quién es el que queda.

TEXT.English: You will find our cities gracious and well maintained, and our friendship unwavering, as long as you remain equally loyal.
TEXT.French: Vous verrez que nos cités sont gracieuses et bien entretenues, et notre amitié constante, tant que vous resterez également fidèle.
TEXT.German: Ihr werdet unsere Städte als freundlich und bestens gepflegt empfinden, und unsere Freundschaft als beständig, solange Ihr uns gegenüber ebenfalls loyal bleibt.
TEXT.Italian: You will find our cities gracious and well maintained, and our friendship unwavering, as long as you remain equally loyal.
TEXT.Spanish: Encontraréis que nuestras ciudades son bondadosas y bien mantenidas, y nuestra amistad segura, siempre y cuando os mantengáis igualmente leales.

TEXT.English: Civilized men know talk is preferable to warfare. But treating with you is getting us nowhere.
TEXT.French: Les hommes civilisés savent que la discussion est préférable à la guerre. Mais traiter avec vous ne nous conduit nulle part.
TEXT.German: Zivilisierte Völker wissen, dass Verhandlungen der Kriegsführung vorzuziehen sind. Aber mit Euch zu verhandeln, bringt uns nichts.
TEXT.Italian: Civilized men know talk is preferable to warfare. But treating with you is getting us nowhere.
TEXT.Spanish: Los hombres civilizados saben que hablar es preferible a la guerra. Pero tratar con vos no nos lleva a ninguna parte.

TEXT.English: The noble halls of the Bannor lands will ever be open to those who love justice and goodness.
TEXT.French: Les grandes portes des Terres Bannor seront toujours ouvertes à ceux qui aiment la justice et la bonté.
TEXT.German: Die edlen Hallen des Reichs der Bannor werden stets für jene geöffnet sein, die Gerechtigkeit und Güte lieben.
TEXT.Italian: The noble halls of the Bannor lands will ever be open to those who love justice and goodness.
TEXT.Spanish: Las nobles salas de las tierras de Bannor siempre estarán abiertas a aquellos que amen la justicia y la bondad.

TEXT.English: The Crusade has been launched. Every man has taken to his sword. The legions are at march to eradicate your evil. There shall be no peace until you are broken.
TEXT.French: La Croisade a été lancée. Chaque homme a pris son épée. Les légions sont en marche pour éradiquer votre mal. Il n'y aura pas de paix jusqu'à ce que vous soyez broyé.
TEXT.German: Der Kreuzzug hat begonnen. Jeder Mann greift zu den Waffen. Unsere Heere marschieren, um das von Euch ausgehende Böse auzurotten. Es wird keinen Frieden geben, bis Eure Herrschaft beendet ist.
TEXT.Italian: The Crusade has been launched. Every man has taken to his sword. The legions are at march to eradicate your evil. There shall be no peace until you are broken.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cruzada ha empezado. Todo hombre a cogido su espada. Las legiones están en marcha, para erradicar vuestro mal. No habrá paz hasta que seáis derrotado.

TEXT.English: Come, [CT_NAME], make your case, but be quick. Evil's reach grows by the year, and we must all prepare for the end.
TEXT.French: Venez, [CT_NAME], expliquez-vous, mais soyez bref. Le Mal croît chaque année, et nous devons tous nous préparer pour la fin.
TEXT.German: Nun, [CT_NAME], sprecht für Euch, aber schnell. Das Böse wächst übers Jahr, und wir alle müssen auf das Ende vorbereitet sein.
TEXT.Italian: Come, [CT_NAME], make your case, but be quick. Evil's reach grows by the year, and we must all prepare for the end.
TEXT.Spanish: Venid, [CT_NAME], exponed vuestro caso, pero sed rápido. El alcance del Mal crece con cada año que pasa, y todos nosotros debemos prepararnos para el final.

TEXT.English: There could have been nobility to your people, [CT_NAME]. But it appears you take the easy path to power, the sure road to corruption.
TEXT.French: Il pourrait y avoir de la noblesse dans votre peuple, [CT_NAME]. Mais il apparaît que vous empruntez la voie facile vers le pouvoir, assurément la route vers la corruption.
TEXT.German: Ihr hättet Eurem Volk ein Vorbild an Edelmut sein können, [CT_NAME]. Aber anscheinend nehmt Ihr lieber den einfachen Weg zur Macht, den sicheren Weg ins Verderben.
TEXT.Italian: There could have been nobility to your people, [CT_NAME]. But it appears you take the easy path to power, the sure road to corruption.
TEXT.Spanish: Podría haber habido nobleza en vuestro pueblo, [CT_NAME]. Pero parece que habéis tomado el camino fácil hacia el poder, el camino seguro hacia la corrupción.

TEXT.English: A just and equitable deal for us both, I think.
TEXT.French: Je pense que c'est un marché juste et équitable.
TEXT.German: Ein ausgewogener und gewinnbringender Handel für jeden von uns, wie ich finde.
TEXT.Italian: A just and equitable deal for us both, I think.
TEXT.Spanish: Un trato justo y equitativo para ambos, creo.

TEXT.English: A just ruler provides for the needs of his people. But not like this. Slink away, thief.
TEXT.French: Un dirigeant juste pourvoit aux besoins de son peuple. Mais pas ainsi. Filez, voleur.
TEXT.German: Ein gerechter Herrscher erfüllt die Bedürfnisse seines Volkes. Aber so nicht. Hinfort mit Euch, Dieb.
TEXT.Italian: A just ruler provides for the needs of his people. But not like this. Slink away, thief.
TEXT.Spanish: Un dirigente justo satisface las necesidades de su pueblo. Pero no de esta forma. Largáos, ladrón.

TEXT.English: I'm tired of old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in.
TEXT.French: Je suis fatigué des vieillards rêvant de guerres dans lesquelles de jeunes gens périssent.
TEXT.German: Ich bin alter Männer überdrüssig, die Kriege aushecken, in denen dann die jungen umkommen.
TEXT.Italian: I'm tired of old men dreaming up wars for young men to die in.
TEXT.Spanish: Estoy cansado de que los viejos sueñen con guerras en las que los jóvenes mueren.

TEXT.English: It was simply a request, [CT_NAME]. You have every right to refuse. It simply saddens me to note your increasingly scornful attitude.
TEXT.French: C'était seulement une requête, [CT_NAME]. Vous avez tout à fait le droit de refuser. Cela me chagrine seulement de relever votre mépris croissant.
TEXT.German: Es war nur eine einfach Anfrage, [CT_NAME]. Ihr habt jedes Recht abzulehnen. Es macht mich traurig zu sehen, dass Eure verächtliche Haltung mit jedem Tag wächst.
TEXT.Italian: It was simply a request, [CT_NAME]. You have every right to refuse. It simply saddens me to note your increasingly scornful attitude.
TEXT.Spanish: Era una simple petición, [CT_NAME]. Tenéis todo el derecho a rechazarla. Simplemente me entristece comprobar vuestra actitud desdeñosa.

TEXT.English: "We do not regret our battle to the death, however vain it was. I served the good, and your vile reign shall be ended... Somehow..."
TEXT.French: "Nous ne regrettons pas notre combat à mort, aussi vain fut-il. J'ai servi le bien, et votre abominable règne sera brisé... D'une manière ou d'une autre..."
TEXT.German: "Wir bedauern unsern Kampf bis zum Tode nicht, und wenn er noch so vergebens war. Ich diente dem Guten, und Eure abscheuliche Herrschaft wird beendet werden... Irgendwie..."
TEXT.Italian: "We do not regret our battle to the death, however vain it was. I served the good, and your vile reign shall be ended... Somehow..."
TEXT.Spanish: "We do not regret our battle to the death, however vain it was. I served the good, and your vile reign shall be ended... Somehow..."

TEXT.English: Profane or pious, they act no differently on the battlefield.
TEXT.French: Profanes ou pieux, ils agissent tous de la même manière sur le champ de bataille.
TEXT.German: Ob gottlos oder fromm, auf dem Schlachtfeld verhalten sich alle gleich.
TEXT.Italian: Profane or pious, they act no differently on the battlefield.
TEXT.Spanish: Profane or pious, they act no differently on the battlefield.

TEXT.English: Thrones sit easily beneath me. If you remain loyal I will allow you to keep yours.
TEXT.French: Les trônes se placent facilement sous moi. Si vous me restez loyal, je vous permettrai de garder le vôtre.
TEXT.German: Unter meinem Thron ist immer Platz. Falls Ihr loyal bleibt, werde ich Euch erlauben, Euren Platz zu behalten.
TEXT.Italian: Thrones sit easily beneath me. If you remain loyal I will allow you to keep yours.
TEXT.Spanish: Thrones sit easily beneath me. If you remain loyal I will allow you to keep yours.

TEXT.English: I am experienced enough to recognize when diplomacy is only a pretense for actions you have already committed to.
TEXT.French: Je suis suffisamment expérimenté pour savoir quand la diplomatie ne sert que de prétexte à vos forfaits.
TEXT.German: Ich bin erfahren genug, um zu erkennen, wann Diplomatie nur ein Vorwand für Aktionen ist, die Ihr bereits beschlossen habt.
TEXT.Italian: I am experienced enough to recognize when diplomacy is only a pretense for actions you have already committed to.
TEXT.Spanish: I am experienced enough to recognize when diplomacy is only a pretense for actions you have already committed to.

TEXT.English: I have spent too many summers on the battlefield, this break will do our people well.
TEXT.French: J'ai vécu trop d'étés sur le champ de bataille. Cette pause nous fera du bien.
TEXT.German: Ich habe zu viele Sommer auf dem Schlachtfeld verbracht. Diese Pause wird unseren beiden Völkern gut tun.
TEXT.Italian: I have spent too many summers on the battlefield, this break will do our people well.
TEXT.Spanish: I have spent too many summers on the battlefield, this break will do our people well.

TEXT.English: You are unfit for your throne, and I mean to remove you from it.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes indigne de votre trône, et je compte bien vous l'enlever.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid Eures Throns nicht würdig und ich werde Euch von ihm entfernen.
TEXT.Italian: You are unfit for your throne, and I mean to remove you from it.
TEXT.Spanish: You are unfit for your throne, and I mean to remove you from it.

TEXT.English: In my history of betrayal and lost friends you remain steadfast. I pray that it will remain so.
TEXT.French: Dans mon passé de trahisons et d'amis perdus, vous restez constant. Je prie pour que cela dure.
TEXT.German: Ich habe schon häufig Verrat erlebt und Freunde verloren, doch Ihr bleibt mir treu. Ich bete, dass es auch so bleibt.
TEXT.Italian: In my history of betrayal and lost friends you remain steadfast. I pray that it will remain so.
TEXT.Spanish: In my history of betrayal and lost friends you remain steadfast. I pray that it will remain so.

TEXT.English: You are nothing but another in a long line of pampered bureaucrats trading your nation's resources for your own petty desires.
TEXT.French: Vous n'êtes rien de plus qu'un bureaucrate pomponné parmis d'autres, vendant les ressources de votre nation pour vos propres désirs futiles.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid nur ein weiterer in einer langen Reihe von verhätschelten Bürokraten, die die Ressourcen ihrer Reiche für die Befriedigung ihrer eigenen belanglosen Gelüste eintauschen.
TEXT.Italian: You are nothing but another in a long line of pampered bureaucrats trading your nation's resources for your own petty desires.
TEXT.Spanish: You are nothing but another in a long line of pampered bureaucrats trading your nation's resources for your own petty desires.

TEXT.English: I believe that deal benefited both sides.
TEXT.French: Je crois que cet accord nous sera mutuellement profitable.
TEXT.German: Ich denke, von dieser Vereinbarung profitieren beide Seiten.
TEXT.Italian: I believe that deal benefited both sides.
TEXT.Spanish: I believe that deal benefited both sides.

TEXT.English: You will have to do better.
TEXT.French: Vous devrez faire mieux.
TEXT.German: Ihr werdet mir ein besseres Angebot machen müssen.
TEXT.Italian: You will have to do better.
TEXT.Spanish: You will have to do better.

TEXT.English: Long have we labored in opposition, let us turn our strength to other tasks instead.
TEXT.French: Longtemps nousa vons travaillé en opposition, utilisons maintenant nos ressources à d'autres tâches.
TEXT.German: Lange Zeit haben wir gegeneinander gearbeitet. Lasst uns unsere Stärken vereinen und andere Aufgaben angehen.
TEXT.Italian: Long have we labored in opposition, let us turn our strength to other tasks instead.
TEXT.Spanish: Long have we labored in opposition, let us turn our strength to other tasks instead.

TEXT.English: A man who stands on principle will often find the world turned against him.
TEXT.French: Un homme qui campe sur ses principes trouvera souvent le monde dressé contre lui.
TEXT.German: Ein Mann mit Prinzipien wird oft die gesamte Welt gegen sich haben.
TEXT.Italian: A man who stands on principle will often find the world turned against him.
TEXT.Spanish: A man who stands on principle will often find the world turned against him.

TEXT.English: "I have risen once from exile to king. I will do so again."
TEXT.French: "Je suis devenu roi après avoir été exilé. Je le referai."
TEXT.German: "Ich habe schon einmal aus dem Exil den Thron erobert. Und genau das werde ich erneut versuchen."
TEXT.Italian: "I have risen once from exile to king. I will do so again."
TEXT.Spanish: "I have risen once from exile to king. I will do so again."

TEXT.English: Who would have guessed that Sabathiel's great sacrifice would end this way? Farewell, Erebus. We would have saved you. Pray instead that another morning star will arise. Even now, I cannot believe that the dark powers will truly triumph.
TEXT.French: Qui aurait cru que le grand sacrifice de Sabathiel se terminerait de cette manière ? Adieu, Erebus. Nous vous aurions sauvés. Priez à la place qu'une autre étoile du matin s'élève. Même maintenant je ne peux pas croire que les forces obscures triompheront vraiment.
TEXT.German: Wer hätte gedacht, dass Sabathiels großes Opfer auf diese Weise enden wÃÂ¼rde? Lebe wohl, Erebus. Wir hätten dich gerettet. Bete stattdessen darum, dass ein weiterer Morgenstern aufgehen wird. Selbst jetzt kann ich nicht glauben, dass die dunklen Mächte wirklich siegen sollen.
TEXT.Italian: Who would have guessed that Sabathiel's great sacrifice would end this way? Farewell, Erebus. We would have saved you. Pray instead that another morning star will arise. Even now, I cannot believe that the dark powers will truly triumph.
TEXT.Spanish: Who would have guessed that Sabathiel's great sacrifice would end this way? Farewell, Erebus. We would have saved you. Pray instead that another morning star will arise. Even now, I cannot believe that the dark powers will truly triumph.

TEXT.English: I have seen many people walk through the palace doors... What is your reason?
TEXT.French: I have seen many people walk through the palace doors... What is your reason?
TEXT.German: Es kommen viele Leute durch die Tore meines Palastes, um mit mir zu reden ... Was ist bei Euch der Grund?
TEXT.Italian: I have seen many people walk through the palace doors... What is your reason?
TEXT.Spanish: I have seen many people walk through the palace doors... What is your reason?

TEXT.English: Leave my sight before I make you see things that would shatter your perceptions.
TEXT.French: Leave my sight before I make you see things that would shatter your perceptions.
TEXT.German: Geht mir aus den Augen.
TEXT.Italian: Leave my sight before I make you see things that would shatter your perceptions.
TEXT.Spanish: Leave my sight before I make you see things that would shatter your perceptions.

TEXT.English: Welcome once more, friend. Have you experienced few hardships since we last met?
TEXT.French: Welcome once more, friend. Have you experienced few hardships since we last met?
TEXT.German: Willkommen zurück, Freund. Ich hoffe, es ist Euch in der Zwischenzeit gut ergangen?
TEXT.Italian: Welcome once more, friend. Have you experienced few hardships since we last met?
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome once more, friend. Have you experienced few hardships since we last met?

TEXT.English: I see you have returned. What brings you back into my view?
TEXT.French: I see you have returned. What brings you back into my view?
TEXT.German: Ich sehe, Ihr seid zurück. Was verschafft mir die Ehre?
TEXT.Italian: I see you have returned. What brings you back into my view?
TEXT.Spanish: I see you have returned. What brings you back into my view?

TEXT.English: I do not wish to see you. Be quick so that I need not gaze upon the face of one such as you.
TEXT.French: I do not wish to see you. Be quick so that I need not gaze upon the face of one such as you.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte Euch eigentlich nicht sehen. Also macht schnell, damit ich den Anblick von jemandem wie Euch nicht allzu lang ertragen muss.
TEXT.Italian: I do not wish to see you. Be quick so that I need not gaze upon the face of one such as you.
TEXT.Spanish: I do not wish to see you. Be quick so that I need not gaze upon the face of one such as you.

TEXT.English: Have you no remorse in your heart, sending me back into the Hells from which I escaped?
TEXT.French: Have you no remorse in your heart, sending me back into the Hells from which I escaped?
TEXT.German: Habt Ihr kein schlechtes Gewissen, mich in die Hölle zurückzuschicken, aus der ich entflohen war?
TEXT.Italian: Have you no remorse in your heart, sending me back into the Hells from which I escaped?
TEXT.Spanish: Have you no remorse in your heart, sending me back into the Hells from which I escaped?

TEXT.English: My people are getting hungry, and I envision your empire as a ripe red apple, the juices of which will surely serve to still their thirst. Bloodthirsty warriors, in their most literal incarnations, will be claiming your lands shortly. Resistance will of course be useless, except perhaps to provide me with some brief amusement before I can finally get a taste of your jugular.
TEXT.French: Mon peuple a faim, et je vois votre empire comme une pomme rouge bien mûre dont le jus servira à apaiser sa soif. Mes guerriers assoiffés de sang, dans le sens le plus littéral du terme, revendiqueront vos terres sous peu. Résister sera bien entendu inutile, sauf peut être pour m'offrir une brève distraction avant que je décide finalement de venir goûter à votre jugulaire.
TEXT.German: Mein Volk wird hungrig und ich sehe Euer Reich wie einen reifen roten Apfel, dessen Saft sicherlich reichen wird, um unseren Durst zu stillen. Blutdurstige Krieger, im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes, werden in Kürze Euer Land in Besitz nehmen. Widerstand wird selbstverständlich zwecklos sein, außer vielleicht um mich zu unterhalten, bevor ich schlussendlich von Eurer Halsschlagader kosten werde.
TEXT.Italian: My people are getting hungry, and I envision your empire as a ripe red apple, the juices of which will surely serve to still their thirst. Bloodthirsty warriors, in their most literal incarnations, will be claiming your lands shortly. Resistance will of course be useless, except perhaps to provide me with some brief amusement before I can finally get a taste of your jugular.
TEXT.Spanish: Mi gente empieza a tener hambre, y concibo vuestro imperio como una manzana roja y madura, cuyos jugos seguramente servirán para calmar su sed. Guerreros sedientos de sangre, en sus encarnaciones más literales, pronto reclamarán vuestras tierras. Resistirse será, por su puesto, inútil, excepto quizás para proveerme de un breve entretenimiento antes de finalmente poder saborear vuestras propias venas yugulares.

TEXT.English: Welcome to the lands of the Calabim. I trust you will recognize our nations as joyful places, where all men and women are allowed to fulfill their potential and purpose in life - as well as in death. Here, no people go hungry, and we have the most tasteful remedies against overpopulation.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue sur les terres des Calabims. Je sais que vous verrez nos cités comme des lieux joyeux, où tous les hommes et toutes les femmes peuvent révéler leurs potentiels et accomplir leurs buts dans la vie, comme dans la mort. Ici, nul ventre affamé, et nous avons le plus savoureux des remèdes à la surpopulation.
TEXT.German: Willkommen im Land der Calabim. Einem Land der Freude, wie Ihr sicher erkennt. Einem Land, in dem jeder seiner Bestimmung folgen und sich frei entfalten kann - im Leben wie im Tod. Hier hungert niemand, denn wir haben das geschmackvollste aller Heilmittel gegen Überbevölkerung.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to the lands of the Calabim. I trust you will recognize our nations as joyful places, where all men and women are allowed to fulfill their potential and purpose in life - as well as in death. Here, no people go hungry, and we have the most tasteful remedies against overpopulation.
TEXT.Spanish: Bienvenido a las tierras de los Calabim. Confío en que reconoceréis que nuestras naciones son lugares alegres, donde a todos los hombres y mujeres se les permite alcanzar su máximo potencial y su propósito en la vida... así como en la muerte. Aquí ningún pueblo pasa hambre, y tenemos los remedios más sabrosos contra la superpoblación.

TEXT.English: Bad blood runs between us. We have nothing to discuss.
TEXT.French: Du sang vicié circule entre nous. Nous n'avons rien à nous dire
TEXT.German: Böses Blut fließt zwischen uns. Wir haben nichts zu besprechen.
TEXT.Italian: Bad blood runs between us. We have nothing to discuss.
TEXT.Spanish: Mala sangre corre entre nosotros. No tenemos nada de que hablar.

TEXT.English: I suppose we can delay the inevitable massacre a little, if only to give your people time to grow healthy and numerous.
TEXT.French: Je pense que nous pouvons retarder un peu l'inévitable massacre, afin de laisser le temps à votre peuple de croître sainement.
TEXT.German: Sicher können wir das unvermeidliche Massaker aufschieben, wenn auch nur, um Eurem Volk die Zeit zu geben, an Reichtum und Zahl zu wachsen.
TEXT.Italian: I suppose we can delay the inevitable massacre a little, if only to give your people time to grow healthy and numerous.
TEXT.Spanish: Supongo que podemos retrasar un poco la inevitable masacre, sólo para darle a vuestro pueblo tiempo para crecer saludable y numeroso.

TEXT.English: Well, well, well... You want it to end, you say? I'm afraid that is not an option. The Calabim thirst for blood, and our own cities are all but sucked dry.
TEXT.French: Bien, bien, bien... Vous voulez stopper tout ça, vous dites ? J'ai bien peur que ça ne soit pas une option. Les Calabims ont soif de sang, et nos villes sont tout sauf rassasiées.
TEXT.German: So, so, so... Ihr wünscht es also zu beenden? Das ist leider nicht möglich. Die Calabim dürsten nach Blut, und unsere eigenen Städte sind schon restlos ausgesaugt.
TEXT.Italian: Well, well, well... You want it to end, you say? I'm afraid that is not an option. The Calabim thirst for blood, and our own cities are all but sucked dry.
TEXT.Spanish: Bueno, bueno, bueno... ¿Decís que queréis que termine? Me temo que esa no es una opción. Calabim está sedienta de sangre, y nuestras ciudades están prácticamente secas.

TEXT.English: Greetings, mortal. Can I offer you a drink?
TEXT.French: Salutations, mortel. Je vous offre à boire ?
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüsst, Sterblicher. Wünscht Ihr eine Erfrischung?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, mortal. Can I offer you a drink?
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos, mortal. ¿Puedo ofreceros una bebida?

TEXT.English: You! I do not wish to see you here, mortal. I hope you have something serious to discuss, otherwise your usefulness as a bargaining partner will soon be surpassed by the merits of your bodily nectar.
TEXT.French: Vous ! Je ne souhaite pas vous voir ici, mortel. J'espère que vous avez une raison sérieuse, sans quoi votre utilité comme partenaire commercial sera vite surpassée par l'intérêt de votre nectar corporel.
TEXT.German: Ihr... Ich wünsche nicht, Euch hier zu sehen, Sterblicher. Hoffentlich habt Ihr etwas von Substanz zu besprechen, sonst wird Eure Nützlichkeit als Handelspartner für mich bald vom Geschmack Eures Blutes übertroffen.
TEXT.Italian: You I do not wish to see you here, mortal. I hope you have something serious to discuss, otherwise your usefulness as a bargaining partner will soon be surpassed by the merits of your bodily nectar.
TEXT.Spanish: Tú...no deseo veros aquí, mortal. Espero que tengáis algo serio sobre lo que discutir, en otro caso vuestra utilidad como compañero de negocios será eclipsada por los méritos de vuestro néctar corporal.

TEXT.English: Very well.
TEXT.French: Très bien.
TEXT.German: Sehr gut.
TEXT.Italian: Very well.
TEXT.Spanish: Muy bien.

TEXT.English: We're quite afraid that we cannot accede to this... request. But you came all this way, do stick around for a bite.
TEXT.French: Nous craignons de ne pouvoir accepter cette... requête. Mais vous avez fait tout ce chemin, restez donc pour boire un peu...
TEXT.German: Es tut uns leid, dass es uns nicht möglich ist, Eurer... Bitte zu entsprechen. Aber Ihr hattet eine weite Anreise, also bleibt noch auf einen Bissen.
TEXT.Italian: We're quite afraid that we cannot accede to this... request. But you came all this way, do stick around for a bite.
TEXT.Spanish: Muy a nuestro pesar debo deciros que no podemos acceder a esta... petición. Pero habéis recorrido todo ese camino, por favor daos una vuelta por aquí para un mordisquito.

TEXT.English: I am afraid that is not an option, mortal.
TEXT.French: J'ai bien peur que ce ne soit pas envisageable, mortel.
TEXT.German: Ich fürchte, das wird so nicht gehen, Sterblicher.
TEXT.Italian: I am afraid that is not an option, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: Me temo que esa no es una opción, mortal.

TEXT.English: Do you want to be feed for my fellow vampires? Then why do you keep pestering me with unreasonable demands?
TEXT.French: Voulez-vous être de la nourriture pour mes petits vampires ? Alors pourquoi continuez-vous à me harceler avec des demandes déraisonnables ?
TEXT.German: Wollt Ihr an meine Vampire verfüttert werden? Oder weshalb belästigt Ihr mich mit unverschämten Forderungen?
TEXT.Italian: Do you want to be feed for my fellow vampires? Then why do you keep pestering me with unreasonable demands?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Queréis servir de alimento a mis compañeros vampiros? Entonces, ¿por qué seguís importunándome con demandas irracionales?

TEXT.English: I believe the time where war could be of benefit to us is past. For now, I would strongly advise you to cease hostilities, and perhaps we will even be inclined to do the same.
TEXT.French: Je pense que le temps où la guerre pouvait nous être profitable est révolu. Je vous encourage fortement à cesser les hostilités pour le moment, et peut-être serons-nous enclins à faire de même.
TEXT.German: Ich denke, dass die Zeit, in der Krieg für uns von Nutzen war, vorüber ist. Fürs erste würde ich Euch dringend raten, die Kampfhandlungen einzustellen, und vielleicht werden wir sogar geneigt sein, dasselbe zu tun.
TEXT.Italian: I believe the time where war could be of benefit to us is past. For now, I would strongly advise you to cease hostilities, and perhaps we will even be inclined to do the same.
TEXT.Spanish: Creo que el tiempo en el que cuando la guerra podía redundar en nuestro beneficio ya ha pasado. Por ahora, os recomendaría fervientemente el cese de las hostilidades, y quizás incluso nosotros nos inclinaremos a hacer lo mismo.

TEXT.English: I am most grateful.
TEXT.French: Je vous en suis très reconnaissant.
TEXT.German: Ich bin außerordentlich dankbar.
TEXT.Italian: I am most grateful.
TEXT.Spanish: Muy agradecido.

TEXT.English: My vampires are hungry. You wish to continue living. A conflict of interests indeed, but thankfully there is a satisfying solution for both of us if you comply.
TEXT.French: Mes vampires ont faim. Vous aimeriez continuer à vivre. Un conflit d'intérêts assurément, mais heureusement il existe une solution mutuellement satisfaisante si vous cédez.
TEXT.German: Meine Vampire sind hungrig. Ihr wollt weiterleben. Sicherlich ein Interessenkonflikt, aber glücklicherweise gibt es eine zufrieden stellende Lösung für jeden von uns, falls Ihr nachgebt.
TEXT.Italian: My vampires are hungry. You wish to continue living. A conflict of interests indeed, but thankfully there is a satisfying solution for both of us if you comply.
TEXT.Spanish: Mis vampiros están hambrientos. Vos deseáis seguir con vida. Un conflicto de intereses sin duda, pero afortunadamente existe una solución satisfactoria para ambos si la acatáis.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], I have a proposal for you. Consider it carefully, until you reach the inevitable conclusion of accepting.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], j'ai une proposition pour vous. Réfléchissez-y attentivement, avant de conclure inévitablement que vous devez accepter.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], hier ist unser Vorschlag. Bedenkt ihn in Ruhe, und Ihr werdet unausweichlich zu dem Schluss kommen, dass Ihr annehmen müsst.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], I have a proposal for you. Consider it carefully, until you reach the inevitable conclusion of accepting.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], tengo una propuesta para vos. Consideradla cuidadosamente, hasta que lleguéis a la inevitable conclusión de aceptarla.

TEXT.English: We seek aid, friend of the Calabim. I hope you can spare this trifle.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin d'aide, ami des Calabims. J'espère que vous pouvez nous offrir cette peccadille.
TEXT.German: Wir suchen Hilfe, Freund der Calabim. Ich hoffe, Ihr könnt das Bisschen entbehren.
TEXT.Italian: We seek aid, friend of the Calabim. I hope you can spare this trifle.
TEXT.Spanish: Buscamos ayuda, amigo de los Calabim. Espero que podáis prestarnos esta nadería.

TEXT.English: You wish to make this a test of wills? I have not lasted through the ages by backing down.
TEXT.French: Vous souhaitez en faire un test de volonté ? Je n'ai pas tenu bon à travers les ages en me dérobant.
TEXT.German: Das soll wohl ein Witz sein? Ich habe nicht ganze Zeitalter überlebt, um jetzt vor Euch zu buckeln.
TEXT.Italian: You wish to make this a test of wills? I have not lasted through the ages by backing down.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Deseáis convertir esto en una prueba de voluntades? No he permanecido al paso del tiempo para retroceder ahora.

TEXT.English: "The hunter's fate is to be tracked down and destroyed? NO! I've lived too long to be done in by you!"
TEXT.French: "Le destin du chasseur est-il d'être traqué et détruit ? NON ! J'ai vécu trop longtemps pour que vous me tuiez !"
TEXT.German: "Das Schicksal des Jägers ist es, aufgespürt und zerstört zu werden? NEIN! Ich habe zu lange gelebt, um nun von Euch erlegt zu werden!"
TEXT.Italian: "The hunter's fate is to be tracked down and destroyed? NO! I've lived too long to be done in by you!"
TEXT.Spanish: "The hunter's fate is to be tracked down and destroyed? NO! I've lived too long to be done in by you!"

TEXT.English: We have lost much. Now we take it back.
TEXT.French: Nous avons beaucoup perdu. Maintenant nous réclamons notre dû.
TEXT.German: Wir haben viel verloren. Jetzt holen wir es uns zurück.
TEXT.Italian: We have lost much. Now we take it back.
TEXT.Spanish: We have lost much. Now we take it back.

TEXT.English: If you come with peace, we welcome you. If you come with malice, we will destroy you.
TEXT.French: Si vos intentions sont pacifiques, nous vous accueillons. Si vos intentions sont malveillantes, nous vous détruirons.
TEXT.German: Wenn Ihr in Frieden kommt, heißen wir Euch willkommen. Kommt Ihr aber mit bösen Absichten, werden wir Euch vernichten.
TEXT.Italian: If you come with peace, we welcome you. If you come with malice, we will destroy you.
TEXT.Spanish: If you come with peace, we welcome you. If you come with malice, we will destroy you.

TEXT.English: Only a fool would approach the Chislev while the wardrums still beat. I have no time for fools.
TEXT.French: Seul un idiot approcherait les Chislevites tant que les tambours de guerre résonnent. Je n'ai pas de temps à perdre avec les idiots.
TEXT.German: Nur ein Narr würde sich den Chislev nähern, während ihe Kriegstrommeln noch klingen. Ich habe keine Zeit für Narren.
TEXT.Italian: Only a fool would approach the Chislev while the wardrums still beat. I have no time for fools.
TEXT.Spanish: Only a fool would approach the Chislev while the wardrums still beat. I have no time for fools.

TEXT.English: Your friendship is welcome for so long as you remain a good friend.
TEXT.French: Votre amitié est la bienvenue tant que vos restez un bon ami.
TEXT.German: Eure Freundschaft ist genau so lange willkommen, wie Ihr Euch als guter Freund zeigt.
TEXT.Italian: Your friendship is welcome for so long as you remain a good friend.
TEXT.Spanish: Your friendship is welcome for so long as you remain a good friend.

TEXT.English: No. We shall have our vengeance.
TEXT.French: Non. Nous aurons notre vengeance.
TEXT.German: Nein. Wir wollen Vergeltung.
TEXT.Italian: No. We shall have our vengeance.
TEXT.Spanish: No. We shall have our vengeance.

TEXT.English: Greetings, friend of the Chislev.
TEXT.French: Greetings, friend of the Chislev.
TEXT.German: Greetings, friend of the Chislev.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, friend of the Chislev.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, friend of the Chislev.

TEXT.English: The world has been cruel to us. You have not.
TEXT.French: The world has been cruel to us. You have not.
TEXT.German: The world has been cruel to us. You have not.
TEXT.Italian: The world has been cruel to us. You have not.
TEXT.Spanish: The world has been cruel to us. You have not.

TEXT.English: What brings you before the tribe?
TEXT.French: What brings you before the tribe?
TEXT.German: What brings you before the tribe?
TEXT.Italian: What brings you before the tribe?
TEXT.Spanish: What brings you before the tribe?

TEXT.English: And you come to add insult to injury.
TEXT.French: And you come to add insult to injury.
TEXT.German: And you come to add insult to injury.
TEXT.Italian: And you come to add insult to injury.
TEXT.Spanish: And you come to add insult to injury.

TEXT.English: Your presence is an insult to the tribe.
TEXT.French: Your presence is an insult to the tribe.
TEXT.German: Your presence is an insult to the tribe.
TEXT.Italian: Your presence is an insult to the tribe.
TEXT.Spanish: Your presence is an insult to the tribe.

TEXT.English: If your offer is fair we will accept.
TEXT.French: If your offer is fair we will accept.
TEXT.German: If your offer is fair we will accept.
TEXT.Italian: If your offer is fair we will accept.
TEXT.Spanish: If your offer is fair we will accept.

TEXT.English: This will help us. We accept.
TEXT.French: This will help us. We accept.
TEXT.German: This will help us. We accept.
TEXT.Italian: This will help us. We accept.
TEXT.Spanish: This will help us. We accept.

TEXT.English: That does not serve our tribe.
TEXT.French: That does not serve our tribe.
TEXT.German: That does not serve our tribe.
TEXT.Italian: That does not serve our tribe.
TEXT.Spanish: That does not serve our tribe.

TEXT.English: Do you take me for a fool [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Do you take me for a fool [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.German: Do you take me for a fool [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: Do you take me for a fool [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: Do you take me for a fool [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: I am pleased to hear that.
TEXT.French: I am pleased to hear that.
TEXT.German: I am pleased to hear that.
TEXT.Italian: I am pleased to hear that.
TEXT.Spanish: I am pleased to hear that.

TEXT.English: If you do not wish to sit by the fire with us, then go away.
