TEXT.French: If you do not wish to sit by the fire with us, then go away.
TEXT.German: If you do not wish to sit by the fire with us, then go away.
TEXT.Italian: If you do not wish to sit by the fire with us, then go away.
TEXT.Spanish: If you do not wish to sit by the fire with us, then go away.

TEXT.English: The war costs us both dearly. Is there yet time for peace?
TEXT.French: La guerre nous a tous deux beaucoup coûté. Est-il temps de faire la paix?
TEXT.German: Der Krieg kommt uns beide teuer zu stehen. Wäre nun nicht Zeit für einen Frieden?
TEXT.Italian: The war costs us both dearly. Is there yet time for peace?
TEXT.Spanish: The war costs us both dearly. Is there yet time for peace?

TEXT.English: Our tribe offers you the following deal in good faith. Will you accept?
TEXT.French: Our tribe offers you the following deal in good faith. Will you accept?
TEXT.German: Our tribe offers you the following deal in good faith. Will you accept?
TEXT.Italian: Our tribe offers you the following deal in good faith. Will you accept?
TEXT.Spanish: Our tribe offers you the following deal in good faith. Will you accept?

TEXT.English: I offer you this trade on behalf of my daughter. She is more forgiving than I.
TEXT.French: I offer you this trade on behalf of my daughter. She is more forgiving than I.
TEXT.German: I offer you this trade on behalf of my daughter. She is more forgiving than I.
TEXT.Italian: I offer you this trade on behalf of my daughter. She is more forgiving than I.
TEXT.Spanish: I offer you this trade on behalf of my daughter. She is more forgiving than I.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry, [CT_NAME], but I must call off this deal.
TEXT.French: I'm sorry, [CT_NAME], but I must call off this deal.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry, [CT_NAME], but I must call off this deal.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry, [CT_NAME], but I must call off this deal.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry, [CT_NAME], but I must call off this deal.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME]; this deal is no more.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME]; this deal is no more.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME]; this deal is no more.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME]; this deal is no more.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME]; this deal is no more.

TEXT.English: The Chislev are glad of your words.
TEXT.French: Les Chislevites sont heureux de l'entendre.
TEXT.German: Die Chislev sind froh über Eure Worte.
TEXT.Italian: The Chislev are glad of your words.
TEXT.Spanish: The Chislev are glad of your words.

TEXT.English: You and the orcs think you can bully us into submission. You will have your reckoning.
TEXT.French: You and the orcs think you can bully us into submission. You will have your reckoning.
TEXT.German: You and the orcs think you can bully us into submission. You will have your reckoning.
TEXT.Italian: You and the orcs think you can bully us into submission. You will have your reckoning.
TEXT.Spanish: You and the orcs think you can bully us into submission. You will have your reckoning.

TEXT.English: We have suffered near-annihilation, and you think you can threaten us like this?
TEXT.French: We have suffered near-annihilation, and you think you can threaten us like this?
TEXT.German: We have suffered near-annihilation, and you think you can threaten us like this?
TEXT.Italian: We have suffered near-annihilation, and you think you can threaten us like this?
TEXT.Spanish: We have suffered near-annihilation, and you think you can threaten us like this?

TEXT.English: The tribe needs your help [CT_NAME]. Will you aid us?
TEXT.French: The tribe needs your help [CT_NAME]. Will you aid us?
TEXT.German: The tribe needs your help [CT_NAME]. Will you aid us?
TEXT.Italian: The tribe needs your help [CT_NAME]. Will you aid us?
TEXT.Spanish: The tribe needs your help [CT_NAME]. Will you aid us?

TEXT.English: I wish you had chosen more wisely.
TEXT.French: I wish you had chosen more wisely.
TEXT.German: I wish you had chosen more wisely.
TEXT.Italian: I wish you had chosen more wisely.
TEXT.Spanish: I wish you had chosen more wisely.

TEXT.English: Very well.
TEXT.French: Very well.
TEXT.German: Very well.
TEXT.Italian: Very well.
TEXT.Spanish: Very well.

TEXT.English: It is all gone. The spirits of our tribe shall never rest easy. You have cursed this land.
TEXT.French: Tout est parti. Les Esprits de notre tribu ne se calmeront jamais. Vos avez maudit cette terre.
TEXT.German: Alles ist vorüber. Die Geister unseres Stammes werden nun niemals ihren Frieden finden. Ihr habt dieses Land verflucht.
TEXT.Italian: It is all gone. The spirits of our tribe shall never rest easy. You have cursed this land.
TEXT.Spanish: It is all gone. The spirits of our tribe shall never rest easy. You have cursed this land.

TEXT.English: You have something I want. Now I'm coming for it. And I'm going to kill your pathetic soldiers while I'm at it.
TEXT.French: Vous avez quelque chose que je veux. Maintenant je viens le chercher. Et tant que j'y suis je vais exterminer vos pathétiques soldats.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt etwas, das ich will. Nun werde ich es mir holen, und bei der Gelegenheit die Leben Eurer bemitleidenswerten Soldaten gleich mit.
TEXT.Italian: You have something I want. Now I'm coming for it. And I'm going to kill your pathetic soldiers while I'm at it.
TEXT.Spanish: Tienes algo que quiero. Ahora voy a por él. Y voy a matar a tus patéticos soldados mientras lo hago.

TEXT.English: Do not confuse us with our wild brothers. We are both more civilized - and more deadly.
TEXT.French: Ne nous confondez pas avec nos cousins sauvages. Nous sommes à la fois plus civilisés et bien plus mortels.
TEXT.German: Wir bitten Euch, uns nicht mit unseren wilden Brüdern zu verwechseln. Wir sind wesentlich zivilisierter - und gefährlicher.
TEXT.Italian: Do not confuse us with our wild brothers. We are both more civilized - and more deadly.
TEXT.Spanish: No nos confundas con nuestros hermanos salvajes. Nosotros somos más civilizados... y más mortíferos.

TEXT.English: Get lost, vermin!
TEXT.French: Dégagez, vermine !
TEXT.German: Verschwindet, Abschaum!
TEXT.Italian: Get lost, vermin!
TEXT.Spanish: Piérdete, sabandija!

TEXT.English: Ok, so you want to run away from this fight? Lucky for you, I've more important things to concentrate on.
TEXT.French: D'accord, ainsi vous voulez fuir le combat ? Heureusement pour vous, je dois m'occuper de choses plus importantes.
TEXT.German: Schön, Ihr wollt Euch also diesem Kampf entziehen? Es ist Euer Glück, dass ich wichtigere Dinge zu erledigen habe.
TEXT.Italian: Ok, so you want to run away from this fight? Lucky for you, I've more important things to concentrate on.
TEXT.Spanish: Vale, ¿así que queréis huir de esta pelea? Tienes suerte, tengo cosas más importantes en las que concentrarme.

TEXT.English: HAH! Forget it! Don't make the mistake of thinking I won't finish this. When I finally catch you, your head will hang on my spear.
TEXT.French: HAH ! Oubliez ça ! Ne faites pas l'erreur de croire que je ne vais pas mettre fin à ça. Quand je vous attraperai, votre tête finira au bout d'une pique !
TEXT.German: HAH! Vergesst es! Begeht nicht den Fehler, zu denken, ich würde es nicht zu Ende führen. Wenn ich Euch endlich zu fassen bekomme, wird Euer Kopf meinen Speer krönen.
TEXT.Italian: HAH! Forget it! Don't make the mistake of thinking I won't finish this. When I finally catch you, your head will hang on my spear.
TEXT.Spanish: JAH! ¡Olvídalo! No cometas el error de creer que no voy a terminar esto. Cuando finalmente te atrape, clavaré tu cabeza en mi lanza.

TEXT.English: If you have something useful to say, say it now. I'm feeling friendly.
TEXT.French: Si vous avez quelque chose d'utile à dire, dites le maintenant. Je suis d'humeur amicale.
TEXT.German: Habt Ihr nützliches mitzuteilen, dann sprecht jetzt. Ich bin gerade in freundlicher Stimmung.
TEXT.Italian: If you have something useful to say, say it now. I'm feeling friendly.
TEXT.Spanish: Si tienes algo útil que decir, dilo ahora. Me siento amigable.

TEXT.English: This had better be very, very good, or your envoy's life is worth very, very little.
TEXT.French: Ça a intérêt à être très, très intéressant, ou la vie de votre émissaire vaudra très, très peu.
TEXT.German: Das sollte besser sehr, sehr wichtig sein, sonst wird uns das Leben Eures Gesandten sehr, sehr wenig wert sein.
TEXT.Italian: This had better be very, very good, or your envoy's life is worth very, very little.
TEXT.Spanish: Será mejor que esto sea muy muy bueno, o la vida de tu mensajero será valorada muy muy poco.

TEXT.English: This will do for now.
TEXT.French: Cela ira pour le moment.
TEXT.German: Es ist getan.
TEXT.Italian: This will do for now.
TEXT.Spanish: Esto bastará por ahora.

TEXT.English: Your people have always looked down on us. Expected that we would be content with the scraps left for us. That will not continue, [CT_NAME]
TEXT.French: Votre peuple nous a toujours méprisés. S'attendant à ce que nous nous contentions des miettes. Cela ne continuera pas, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Euer Volk hat immer auf uns herabgeblickt und erwartet, dass wir uns mit den Krümmeln zufrieden geben, die ihr übrig lasst. Das wird nicht mehr geschehen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Your people have always looked down on us. Expected that we would be content with the scraps left for us. That will not continue, [CT_NAME]
TEXT.Spanish: Tu pueblo siempre nos ha mirado con desprecio. Esperabais que nos conformaramos con los restos que nos íbais dejando. Pues eso no va a continuar, [CT_NAME]

TEXT.English: Not interested.
TEXT.French: Pas intéressé.
TEXT.German: Kein Interesse.
TEXT.Italian: Not interested.
TEXT.Spanish: No me interesa.

TEXT.English: You think I'm dumb? Even I can count well enough to see that that is a bad deal!
TEXT.French: Vous me prenez pour un idiot ? Je sais suffisamment bien compter pour voir que c'est un mauvais marché !
TEXT.German: Haltet Ihr mich etwa für blöde? Sogar ich kann an meinen Fingern abzählen, was für ein schlechter Handel das ist!
TEXT.Italian: You think I'm dumb? Even I can count well enough to see that that is a bad deal!
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Me tomas por idiota? ¡Incluso yo se contar lo suficientemente bien para ver que ese no es un trato justo!

TEXT.English: Let's call this one a draw.
TEXT.French: Appelons cela un match nul.
TEXT.German: Einigen wir uns auf Unentschieden.
TEXT.Italian: Let's call this one a draw.
TEXT.Spanish: Dejemos ésta como un empate.

TEXT.English: I'm glad you can see reason.
TEXT.French: Je suis heureux que vous soyez raisonnable.
TEXT.German: Ich freue mich über Eure Einsicht.
TEXT.Italian: I'm glad you can see reason.
TEXT.Spanish: Me alegra que veas la razón.

TEXT.English: Hand it over. Don't make me come and take it from you.
TEXT.French: Donnez moi ça. Ne m'obligez pas à venir le prendre moi-même.
TEXT.German: Reicht das rüber. Bringt mich nicht dazu, es zu holen.
TEXT.Italian: Hand it over. Don't make me come and take it from you.
TEXT.Spanish: Suéltalo. No me hagas ir y arrebatártelo.

TEXT.English: I tolerate you. Wouldn't it be a shame if we had a falling out over something small like this?
TEXT.French: Je vous tolère. Ne serait-ce point une honte si nous entrions en désaccord pour une chose aussi insignifiante?
TEXT.German: Ich kann Euch leiden. Wäre es nicht eine Schande, das wegen dieser Kleinigkeit zu verspielen?
TEXT.Italian: I tolerate you. Wouldn't it be a shame if we had a falling out over something small like this?
TEXT.Spanish: Te tolero. ¿No sería una lástima si tuviéramos una desaveniencia por algo tan pequeño como esto?

TEXT.English: Do you want to give us this, or not?
TEXT.French: Voulez-vous nous donner ça, ou pas ?
TEXT.German: Wollt Ihr uns unterstützen, oder nicht?
TEXT.Italian: Do you want to give us this, or not?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Quieres darnos esto, o no?

TEXT.English: I didn't have to ask. Next time I won't.
TEXT.French: Je n'étais pas obligé de demander. La prochaine fois je ne le ferai pas.
TEXT.German: Ich hätte Euch nicht bitten müssen. Nächstes Mal jedenfalls nicht.
TEXT.Italian: I didn't have to ask. Next time I won't.
TEXT.Spanish: No debí preguntar. La próxima vez no lo haré.

TEXT.English: "Grrrr. I would crush your skull if not for all those swords and spells. Curse you and your civilization."
TEXT.French: "Grrrr. J'aurais écrasé votre crâne sans toutes ces épées et ces sortilèges. Soyez maudits, vous et votre civilisation."
TEXT.German: "Grrrr. Ich würde Euren Schädel zermalmen, hättet ihr nicht all diese Schwerter und Zauber auf Eurer Seite. Verflucht seid Ihr und Eure Zivilisation."
TEXT.Italian: "Grrrr. I would crush your skull if not for all those swords and spells. Curse you and your civilization."
TEXT.Spanish: "Grrrr. I would crush your skull if not for all those swords and spells. Curse you and your civilization."

TEXT.English: The killing has already begun. Your people will be offered to Agruonn.
TEXT.French: Le massacre a déjà commencé. Votre peuple sera offert en sacrifice à Agruonn.
TEXT.German: Das Töten hat bereits begonnen. Euer Volk wird Agruonn geopfert.
TEXT.Italian: The killing has already begun. Your people will be offered to Agruonn.
TEXT.Spanish: The killing has already begun. Your people will be offered to Agruonn.

TEXT.English: The Cualli respect those who know how to wield power, and demonstrate to those who do not. Do you need a demonstration, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.French: Les Cuallis respectent ceux qui savent exercer le pouvoir, et montrent comment faire à ceux qui ne le savent pas. Avez-vous besoin d'une démonstration, [CT_NAME] ?
TEXT.German: Die Cualli respektieren diejenigen, die mit Macht umzugehen verstehen, und sie demonstrieren sie denjenigen, die es nicht vermögen. Benötigt Ihr eine Demonstration, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Italian: The Cualli respect those who know how to wield power, and demonstrate to those who do not. Do you need a demonstration, [CT_NAME]?
TEXT.Spanish: The Cualli respect those who know how to wield power, and demonstrate to those who do not. Do you need a demonstration, [CT_NAME]?

TEXT.English: The streets run with blood and there are still more to be slain - I have no time to waste on words.
TEXT.French: Les rues sont couvertes de sang et il en reste toujours à tuer. Je n'ai pas de temps à perdre en bavardage.
TEXT.German: Die Straßen sind blutgetränkt, und noch immer gibt es genug zum Erschlagen - Ich werde meine Zeit nicht mit Worten verschwenden.
TEXT.Italian: The streets run with blood and there are still more to be slain - I have no time to waste on words.
TEXT.Spanish: The streets run with blood and there are still more to be slain - I have no time to waste on words.

TEXT.English: I shall offer up a score of slaves to mark this day.
TEXT.French: Je devrais sacrifier une vingtaine d'esclaves en mémoire de ce jour.
TEXT.German: Ich sollte ein paar Sklaven opfern, um diesen Tag zu feiern.
TEXT.Italian: I shall offer up a score of slaves to mark this day.
TEXT.Spanish: I shall offer up a score of slaves to mark this day.

TEXT.English: There shall be no peace until the last of your people lies upon the altar with my knife through his heart.
TEXT.French: Il ne pourra y avoir de paix tant que le dernier de voter peuple ne sera pas gisant sur l'autel avec ma lame plantée dans son cœur.
TEXT.German: Es wird keinen Frieden geben, bevor nicht der Letzte Eures Volkes hier auf dem Altar liegt, meinen Dolch in seinem Herzen.
TEXT.Italian: There shall be no peace until the last of your people lies upon the altar with my knife through his heart.
TEXT.Spanish: There shall be no peace until the last of your people lies upon the altar with my knife through his heart.

TEXT.English: I am pleased to see you here, [CT_NAME]. Did you bring an "offering" to Agruonn?
TEXT.French: Je suis heureux de vous voir ici, [CT_NAME]. Avez-vous amené une "offrande" à Agruonn ?
TEXT.German: Ich bin entzückt, Euch hier zu sehen, [CT_NAME]. Habt Ihr ein "Angebot" für Agruonn?
TEXT.Italian: I am pleased to see you here, [CT_NAME]. Did you bring an "offering" to Agruonn?
TEXT.Spanish: I am pleased to see you here, [CT_NAME]. Did you bring an "offering" to Agruonn?

TEXT.English: Speak now. If I do not like your words, they shall be your last.
TEXT.French: Parlez maintenant. Si je n'aime pas vos mots, il pourraient bien être vos derniers.
TEXT.German: Sprecht nun. Sollten mir Eure Worte missfallen, so werden es Eure letzten gewesen sein.
TEXT.Italian: Speak now. If I do not like your words, they shall be your last.
TEXT.Spanish: Speak now. If I do not like your words, they shall be your last.

TEXT.English: The deal is bound.
TEXT.French: Le marché est conclu.
TEXT.German: Der Handel ist perfekt.
TEXT.Italian: The deal is bound.
TEXT.Spanish: The deal is bound.

TEXT.English: Make a better offer, or shall we make up the difference with your blood?
TEXT.French: Faites une meilleure offre, ou devrons-nous faire la différence avec votre sang?
TEXT.German: Macht ein besseres Angebot, oder sollen wir die Differenz mit Eurem Blut begleichen?
TEXT.Italian: Make a better offer, or shall we make up the difference with your blood?
TEXT.Spanish: Make a better offer, or shall we make up the difference with your blood?

TEXT.English: Your heart is in the right place. Make a better offer or it won't stay there.
TEXT.French: Vote cœur est à la bonne place. Faites une meilleure offre ou il n'y restera pas.
TEXT.German: Euer Herz ist am rechten Fleck. Macht ein besseres Angebot, wenn ihr wollt, dass es dort bleibt.
TEXT.Italian: Your heart is in the right place. Make a better offer or it won't stay there.
TEXT.Spanish: Your heart is in the right place. Make a better offer or it own't stay there.

TEXT.English: Our lord is sated for now - do you wish respite from the slaughter?
TEXT.French: Notre seigneur est satisfait pour le moment, souhaitez-vous vous remettre de ce massacre ?
TEXT.German: Unser Herr ist zufriedengestellt - für den Moment. Wünscht Ihr eine Ruhepause von dem Gemetzel?
TEXT.Italian: Our lord is sated for now - do you wish respite from the slaughter?
TEXT.Spanish: Our lord is sated for now - do you wish respite from the slaughter?

TEXT.English: I am pleased to accept your offering.
TEXT.French: Je suis heureux d'accepter votre offrande.
TEXT.German: Es ist mir ein Vergnügen, Euer Angebot anzunehmen.
TEXT.Italian: I am pleased to accept your offering.
TEXT.Spanish: I am pleased to accept your offering.

TEXT.English: *hisses*
TEXT.French: *sifflement*
TEXT.German: *zischelt*
TEXT.Italian: *hisses*
TEXT.Spanish: *hisses*

TEXT.English: Curse you, fools. If you die not by my hand, there shall be another! You cannot thwart Agruonn's will.
TEXT.French: Soyez maudits, fous que vous êtes. Si vous ne mourrez pas par ma main, ce sera par celle d'un autre! Vous ne pouvez vous opposer à la volonté d'Agruonn.
TEXT.German: Verflucht seid Ihr, Narr. Solltet Ihr nicht durch meine Hand fallen, dann durch die eines Anderen! Ihr könnt Agruonns Pläne nicht durchkreuzen.
TEXT.Italian: Curse you, fools. If you die not by my hand, there shall be another! You cannot thwart Agruonn's will.
TEXT.Spanish: Curse you, fools. If you die not by my hand, there shall be another! You cannot thwart Agruonn's will.

TEXT.English: Leave me ... and do what you want!
TEXT.French: Laissez-moi... et faites ce qui vous chante!
TEXT.German: Lasst mich ... und tut, was Ihr wollt!
TEXT.Italian: Leave me ... and do what you want!
TEXT.Spanish: Leave me ... and do what you want!

TEXT.English: This is ... this is ... not true!
TEXT.French: This is ... this is ... not true!
TEXT.German: Das ist ... das ist ... nicht wahr!
TEXT.Italian: This is ... this is ... not true!
TEXT.Spanish: This is ... this is ... not true!

TEXT.English: You're weak. And my pack is hungry.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes faible. Et ma meute est affamée.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid schwach. Und meine Meute ist hungrig.
TEXT.Italian: You're weak. And my pack is hungry.
TEXT.Spanish: Eres débil. Y mi manada está hambrienta

TEXT.English: Long has this tundra been ours to hunt, and you think now you can just claim it?
TEXT.French: Cette toundra est notre terrain de chasse depuis bien longtemps, et aujourd'hui vous pensez pouvoir nous la prendre?
TEXT.German: Lange Zeit schon dient uns die Tundra für die Jagd, und nun kommt Ihr und glaubt, Ihr habt ein Anrecht darauf?
TEXT.Italian: Long has this tundra been ours to hunt, and you think now you can just claim it?
TEXT.Spanish: Esta tundra ha sido nuestra para cazar desde hace tiempo, ¿y ahora crees que puedes reclamarla?

TEXT.English: Diplomacy is a trick of the weak to tie down the strong.
TEXT.French: La diplomatie est une ruse du faible pour entraver le fort.
TEXT.German: Diplomatie ist ein Trick der Schwachen, um die Starken an sie zu binden.
TEXT.Italian: Diplomacy is a trick of the weak to tie down the strong.
TEXT.Spanish: La diplomacia es un truco del débil para someter al fuerte.

TEXT.English: There is no reason for us to fight when weaker prey is so abundant.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas de raison de nous battre alors qu'il y a tant de proies plus faibles.
TEXT.German: Es gibt keinen Grund für uns, miteinander zu kämpfen, wenn schwächere Beute so reichlich vorhanden ist.
TEXT.Italian: There is no reason for us to fight when weaker prey is so abundant.
TEXT.Spanish: No hay razón para seguir luchando entre nosotros cuando presas más débiles abundan.

TEXT.English: I smell blood.
TEXT.French: Je flaire le sang.
TEXT.German: Ich rieche Blut.
TEXT.Italian: I smell blood.
TEXT.Spanish: Huelo sangre.

TEXT.English: I'm glad to have strong friends. Makes the betrayal more exciting once we vanquish our foes.
TEXT.French: Je suis heureux d'avoir des amis puissants. Ça ne rendra la trahison que plus excitante une fois que nous aurons vaincu nos ennemis.
TEXT.German: Es ist schön, mächtige Freunde zu haben. Dadurch wird der Verrat wesentlich aufregender, wenn wir erst unsere Feinde vom Angesicht der Erde getilgt haben.
TEXT.Italian: I'm glad to have strong friends. Makes the betrayal more exciting once we vanquish our foes.
TEXT.Spanish: Me agrada tener amigos fuertes. Hace que la traición sea más emocionante una vez que hayamos terminado con nuestros enemigos.

TEXT.English: Shouldn't you be preparing for our war?
TEXT.French: Ne devriez-vous pas vous préparer pour notre guerre ?
TEXT.German: Solltet Ihr Euch nicht auf unseren Krieg vorbereiten?
TEXT.Italian: Shouldn't you be preparing for our war?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿No deberías estar preparándote para nuestra guerra?

TEXT.English: Hmph. I guess we can do this the easy way. The hard way is so much more fun.
TEXT.French: Hmph, je crois que nous pouvons faire cela de la manière douce. La manière forte est tellement plus amusante.
TEXT.German: Hmpf... Ich glaube, das geht so einfach, obwohl die harte Tour mehr Spaß machen würde.
TEXT.Italian: Hmph. I guess we can do this the easy way. The hard way is so much more fun.
TEXT.Spanish: Hmph. Supongo que podemos hacer esto por las buenas, aunque sea mucho más divertido por las malas.

TEXT.English: Start running.
TEXT.French: Commencez à courir !
TEXT.German: Fangt an, zu rennen.
TEXT.Italian: Start running.
TEXT.Spanish: Empieza a correr.

TEXT.English: I was only looking for a reason.
TEXT.French: Je cherchais juste un prétexte.
TEXT.German: Ich habe nur noch einen Grund gesucht.
TEXT.Italian: I was only looking for a reason.
TEXT.Spanish: Sólo buscaba un pretexto.

TEXT.English: "The pack will never die. Someday, you will leave your 'civilization,' and we will be there to tear you to shreds."
TEXT.French: "La meute ne meurt jamais. Un de ces jours, vous quitterez votre 'civilisation', et nous serons là pour vous mettre en pièces."
TEXT.German: "Das Rudel wird niemals sterben. Eines Tages werdet Ihr Eure 'Zivilisation' verlassen, und wir werden da sein, um Euch in Stücke zu reißen."
TEXT.Italian: "The pack will never die. Someday, you will leave your 'civilization,' and we will be there to tear you to shreds."
TEXT.Spanish: "The pack will never die. Someday, you will leave your 'civilization,' and we will be there to tear you to shreds."

TEXT.English: We have tried everything to deter you from your futile path of meaningless destruction and corruption of all that was once pure. We have sought to sway you with gentle means, yet you have kept resisting us. Alas, you leave us no choice but to end this madness once and for all.
TEXT.French: Nous avons tout essayé pour vous détourner de la voie vide de sens de la destruction et de la corruption de ce qui fut pur. Nous avons essayé de vous convaincre gentiment, mais vous nous avez ignorés. Hélas, vous nous laissez d'autres choix que d'arrêter cette folie une fois pour toute.
TEXT.German: Wir haben versucht, Euch zu überzeugen, den Pfad der sinnlosen Zerstörung und Korrumpierung alles Reinen zu verlassen. Doch unsere Worte blieben unbeachtet. Wohlan, die Zeit der Worte ist vorbei. Ihr lasst uns keine andere Wahl, als Euren Wahnsinn auf diesem Wege zu beenden.
TEXT.Italian: We have tried everything to deter you from your futile path of meaningless destruction and corruption of all that was once pure. We have sought to sway you with gentle means, yet you have kept resisting us. Alas, you leave us no choice but to end this madness once and for all.
TEXT.Spanish: Hemos intentado de todo para disuadiros de vuestro futil camino de destrucción sin sentido y corrupción de todo lo que una vez fue puro. Hemos intentado influiros con métodos gentiles, pero habéis seguido resistiéndoos. Lamentablemente, no nos dejáis otra opción que terminar con esta locura de una vez por todas.

TEXT.English: Welcome to you, friend. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the Elohim. Our quest is one of peaceful preservation of these lands, and I trust you come to us in peace as well.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue à vous ami. Je suis [OUR_NAME], chef de l'Elohim. Notre quête consiste à préserver pacifiquement ces terres, et j'ai foi également en vos intentions pacifiques.
TEXT.German: Seid willkommen, Freund. Ich bin [OUR_NAME], Oberhaupt der Elohim. Unsere Aufgabe ist die friedliche Erhaltung dieser Ländereien, und ich vertraue darauf, dass Ihr ebenfalls in friedlicher Absicht kommt.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome to you, friend. I am [OUR_NAME], leader of the Elohim. Our quest is one of peaceful preservation of these lands, and I trust you come to us in peace as well.
TEXT.Spanish: Sed bienvenido, amigo. Yo soy [OUR_NAME], lider de Elohim. Nuestra búsqueda consiste en la preservación pacífica de estas tierras, y confío en que vos vengáis a nosotros en paz de igual manera.

TEXT.English: You stray too far from the path of peace. We do not wish to speak with you.
TEXT.French: Vous errez trop loin du chemin de la paix. Nous ne souhaitons pas vous parler.
TEXT.German: Ihr irrt weitab des Friedenspfades umher. Wir wünschen nicht, mit Euch zu sprechen.
TEXT.Italian: You stray too far from the path of peace. We do not wish to speak with you.
TEXT.Spanish: Vos os descarriáis demasiado del camino de la paz. No deseamos hablar con vos.

TEXT.English: We are grateful that you have accepted the only true path to wisdom. May the years of peace between our nations stretch throughout the ages, as a glorious example for all other creeds and nations.
TEXT.French: Nous nous réjouissons que vous ayez emprunté l'unique voie de la sagesse. Puisse les années de paix entre nos nations perdurer au cours des âges, et servir d'exemple aux autres peuples et nations.
TEXT.German: Wir sind sehr dankbar, dass Ihr den einzig wahren Pfad zur Weisheit akzeptiert habt. Mögen die Jahre des Friedens zwischen unseren Nationen über die Zeitalter hinweg andauern, als wunderbares Vorbild für alle anderen Nationen und Glaubensrichtungen.
TEXT.Italian: We are grateful that you have accepted the only true path to wisdom. May the years of peace between our nations stretch throughout the ages, as a glorious example for all other creeds and nations.
TEXT.Spanish: Agradecemos que hayáis aceptado el único camino verdadero a la sabiduría. Que los años de paz entre nuestras naciones se extiendan a lo largo de las eras, como un glorioso ejemplo a seguir para los demás credos y naciones.

TEXT.English: We have seen that your nature is destructive, and any solace we would gain by such a deal would only be temporary. Much as I regret it, you will have to be put down.
TEXT.French: Nous avons constaté que vous êtes de nature destructrice, et le réconfort que nous tirerions d'un tel accord ne serait que temporaire. Bien que je le regrette, vous devez être détruit.
TEXT.German: Wir haben Eure zerstörerische Natur gesehen, und jeder Trost, den wir aus solch einer Vereinbarung ziehen würden, wäre nicht dauerhaft. Es ist zwar bedauerlich, doch es ist Zeit für Euch abzudanken.
TEXT.Italian: We have seen that your nature is destructive, and any solace we would gain by such a deal would only be temporary. Much as I regret it, you will have to be put down.
TEXT.Spanish: Hemos visto que vuestra naturaleza es destructiva, y cualquier regocijo que pudiéramos ganar por un trato como este sería sólo temporal. Tanto como me arrepiento de ello, de igual manera debes ser derrocado.

TEXT.English: I bid you welcome, friend of the Elohim. Pray tell, what can I do for you?
TEXT.French: Je vous souhaite la bienvenue, ami des Elohim. Dites moi, que puis-je pour vous ?
TEXT.German: Ich entbiete Euch ein Willkommen, Freunde der Elohim. Sprecht, was können wir für Euch tun?
TEXT.Italian: I bid you welcome, friend of the Elohim. Pray tell, what can I do for you?
TEXT.Spanish: Yo os saludo, amigo de los Elohim. Por favor decidme, ¿qué puedo hacer por vos?

TEXT.English: You should not be coming here. Your violent stature is an abomination to the Elohim.
TEXT.French: Vous ne devriez pas venir ici. Votre nature violente est une abomination pour les Eholims.
TEXT.German: Ihr solltet nicht hier sein. Die Elohim verabscheuen Euer brutales Gebahren.
TEXT.Italian: You should not be coming here. Your violent stature is an abomination to the Elohim.
TEXT.Spanish: No tendríais que haber venido aquí. Vuestra naturaleza violenta es una abominación para los Elohim.

TEXT.English: We most humbly accept your generous proposal.
TEXT.French: Nous acceptons très humblement votre gracieuse proposition.
TEXT.German: Wir können Euer großzügiges Angebot nur akzeptieren.
TEXT.Italian: We most humbly accept your generous proposal.
TEXT.Spanish: Con toda humildad aceptamos vuestra generosa oferta.

TEXT.English: Why do you provoke us so? Having renounced violence makes us more resolute in resisting evil, not less.
TEXT.French: Pourquoi nous provoquez-vous ainsi? Avoir renoncé à la violence renforce notre résolution à résister au mal, pas l'inverse.
TEXT.German: Warum müsst Ihr uns so provozieren? Der Verzicht auf Gewalt macht uns dem Bösen gegenüber entschlossener, nicht empfänglicher.
TEXT.Italian: Why do you provoke us so? Having renounced violence makes us more resolute in resisting evil, not less.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Por qué nos provocáis de esta forma? Renunciando a la violencia nos hacemos más decididos en resistir la maldad, no menos.

TEXT.English: I am truly sorry, but such a deal would be impossible at this time.
TEXT.French: Je suis sincèrement désolé, mais un tel accord est impossible pour le moment.
TEXT.German: Ich bedaure außerordentlich, aber solch ein Geschäft ist derzeit unmöglich.
TEXT.Italian: I am truly sorry, but such a deal would be impossible at this time.
TEXT.Spanish: De verdad que lo siento, pero un acuerdo así es imposible en este momento.

TEXT.English: Why do you waste our time? You know we can never agree to this proposal.
TEXT.French: Pourquoi nous faire perdre notre temps ? Vous savez que nous n'accepterons jamais cette proposition.
TEXT.German: Warum verschwendet Ihr unsere Zeit? Ihr wisst, das wir diesem Vorschlag unmöglich zustimmen können.
TEXT.Italian: Why do you waste our time? You know we can never agree to this proposal.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Por qué malgastáis nuestro tiempo? Sabéis perfectamente que nunca podríamos acceder a esa proposición.

TEXT.English: This war is tearing our people apart, body and soul. Please, I beg of you, let us end this meaningless conflict before naught but ashes remains of both our nations.
TEXT.French: Cette guerre déchire l'âme et le corps de notre peuple. S'il vous plaît, mettons fin à ce conflit irraisonné avant qu'il ne reste que des cendres de nos deux nations.
TEXT.German: Dieser Krieg zermürbt unsere Völker, Körper und Geist gleichermaßen. Bitte, Ich flehe Euch an, lasst uns diesen sinnlosen Konflikt beenden, bevor nichts weiter als Asche von unser beider Nationen übrig bleibt.
TEXT.Italian: This war is tearing our people apart, body and soul. Please, I beg of you, let us end this meaningless conflict before naught but ashes remains of both our nations.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta guerra está dividiendo a nuestra gente, en cuerpo y alma. Por favor, os lo suplico, terminemos con este conflicto sin sentido antes de que nada más que ceniza sea lo que quede de sendas naciones.

TEXT.English: Thank you, noble friend.
TEXT.French: Merci, noble ami.
TEXT.German: Habt Dank, nobler Freund.
TEXT.Italian: Thank you, noble friend.
TEXT.Spanish: Gracias, noble amigo.

TEXT.English: Here is the deal we would propose. Accepting it is surely the wiser choice.
TEXT.French: Voici le marché que nous aimerions vous proposer. L'accepter est assurément le choix le plus sage.
TEXT.German: Hier ist unser Handelsvorschlag. Zustimmung ist die einzig weise Wahl.
TEXT.Italian: Here is the deal we would propose. Accepting it is surely the wiser choice.
TEXT.Spanish: Aquí está el trato que propondríamos. Aceptarlo es seguramente la decisión más sabia.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], we have a proposal to make that will surely further the peace between our nations.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], nous avons une proposition a vous faire qui va assurément renforcer la paix entre nos deux nations.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], wir haben hier einen Vorschlag für Euch, der den Frieden zwischen unseren Völkern erhalten wird.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], we have a proposal to make that will surely further the peace between our nations.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], tenemos una propuesta que haceros y que seguramente reforzará la paz entre nuestras naciones.

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], I hope you won't think ill of us for asking you this.
TEXT.French: J'espère que nous ne vous dégoûterons point en vous demandant ceci, [CT_NAME]
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], ich hoffe, Ihr denkt nicht schlecht von uns, weil wir Euch danach fragten.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], I hope you won't think ill of us for asking you this.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], espero que no penséis mal de nosotros por pediros esto.

TEXT.English: It was not for my own sake that I ask, but for the good of all. You hinder our mission with your stubbornness, [CT_NAME], and I urge you to think beyond your own position!
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas pour moi que je demandais, mais pour le bien de tous. Vous entravez notre mission avec votre entêtement, [CT_NAME], et je vous incite vivement à reconsidérer votre position.
TEXT.German: Es ist nicht nur das eigene Wohlergehen, das mir am Herzen liegt, sondern das aller. Ihr behindert unsere Mission mit Eurer Sturheit, [CT_NAME]. Ich mahne Euch, über Euren eigenen Horizont hinaus zu blicken!
TEXT.Italian: It was not for my own sake that I ask, but for the good of all. You hinder our mission with your stubbornness, [CT_NAME], and I urge you to think beyond your own position!
TEXT.Spanish: No fue por mi propio bien por lo que pedí esto, sino por el bien de todos. ¡Vos habéis impedido nuestra misión con vuestra terquedad, [CT_NAME], y os insto a pensar más allá de vuestra posición!

TEXT.English: "I fear for this world without us to tend to it. Do you have any clue what you have wrought?"
TEXT.French: "Je crains pour ce monde si nous ne nous en occupons plus. Avez-vous la moindre idée de ce que vous avez provoqué ?"
TEXT.German: "Ich fürchte um diese Welt, jetzt ohne uns, um uns um sie zu kümmern. Habt Ihr nur den Hauch einer Ahnung, was Ihr nun getan habt?"
TEXT.Italian: "I fear for this world without us to tend to it. Do you have any clue what you have wrought?"
TEXT.Spanish: "I fear for this world without us to tend to it. Do you have any clue what you have wrought?"

TEXT.English: Pray to your gods for mercy. Doubtless, your lamentations will fall upon deaf ears. But it will make you easier to strike down as you babble on in vain.
TEXT.French: Priez vos dieux pour votre grâce. Sans aucun doute, vos lamentations n'atteindront que de sourdes oreilles. Mais cela vous rendra vulnérables tandis que vous balbutierez en vain.
TEXT.German: Fleht Eure Götter um Gnade an. Zweifellos werden Eure Klagen auf taube Ohren stoßen. Aber so wird es uns leichter fallen, Euch niederzustrecken, während Ihr sinnlos vor Euch hinbrabbelt.
TEXT.Italian: Pray to your gods for mercy. Doubtless, your lamentations will fall upon deaf ears. But it will make you easier to strike down as you babble on in vain.
TEXT.Spanish: Reza a tus dioses por piedad. Sin lugar a dudas, tus a lamentaciones se le harán oídos sordos. Pero será más fácil acabar con tu vida mientras balbuceas en vano.

TEXT.English: I respect more the sheep who flees the shepherd than the one that remains to be mutton. Which sort are you?
TEXT.French: Je respecte bien plus le mouton qui fuit le berger que celui qui préfère suivre le troupeau. De quelle sorte êtes-vous ?
TEXT.German: Ich achte jenes Schaf, das dem Hirten entflieht, mehr als jenes, das bleibt und als Schlachtvieh endet. Welchem Typus würdet ihr Euch zurechnen?
TEXT.Italian: I respect more the sheep who flees the shepherd than the one that remains to be mutton. Which sort are you?
TEXT.Spanish: Respeto más a la oveja que huye de su pastor que la que se queda en el rebaño. ¿Cuál de ellas sois vos?

TEXT.English: If I wish not to see gods, why would I parley with their puppets?
TEXT.French: Si je ne souhaite pas voir les dieux, pourquoi parlementerais-je avec leurs marionnettes ?
TEXT.German: Wenn ich nicht wünsche, die Götter zu empfangen, warum sollte ich mich dann mit ihren Marionetten abgeben?
TEXT.Italian: If I wish not to see gods, why would I parley with their puppets?
TEXT.Spanish: Si no quiero saber nada de los dioses, ¿por qué tendría que hablar con sus marionetas?

TEXT.English: It is good to see peace. We play into the hands of the manipulators when we are at each other's throats, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: C'est bon de voir la paix revenir. Nous sommes que des marionnettes quand chacun se jette à la gorge de l'autre, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Es ist schön, Frieden zu haben. Wir spielen in die Hände der Manipulatoren, wenn wir uns gegenseitig an die Gurgel gehen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: It is good to see peace. We play into the hands of the manipulators when we are at each other's throats, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Es bueno ver la paz. Jugamos entre las manos de los manipuladores mientras cada uno agarra la garganta del otro, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Alas, I offered reason, you responded with fanaticism. For my people's sake, I must break you.
TEXT.French: Hélas, je vous ai offert la raison, vous avez répondu par la fanatisme. Pour le bien de mon peuple, je dois vous détruire.
TEXT.German: Wohlan, ich vermittelte Euch neue Einsichten, aber Ihr kanntet nur Engstirnigkeit. Das Wohlergehen meines Volkes verlangt Euren Sturz.
TEXT.Italian: Alas, I offered reason, you responded with fanaticism. For my people's sake, I must break you.
TEXT.Spanish: Por desgracia, os ofrecí una razón... respondísteis con fanatismo. Por el bien de mi pueblo, debéis ser destruido.

TEXT.English: As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods; They kill us for their sport.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes tels des mouches pour les vilains garçons, aux yeux des dieux : ils nous tuent pour se distraire.
TEXT.German: Wie die Fliegen den Knaben, so nutzen wir den Göttern. Sie vernichten uns zum Vergnügen.
TEXT.Italian: As flies to wanton boys, are we to the gods; They kill us for their sport.
TEXT.Spanish: Como moscas a niños gamberros, somos nosotros a los dioses; ellos nos matan para su entretenimiento.

TEXT.English: So, you wish to barter with the "heathen" do you? Out with it, then.
TEXT.French: Alors comme ça, vous voulez troquer avec le "païen" ?
TEXT.German: Wohlan, Ihr wünscht also, mit den "Heiden" zu handeln? Dann heraus damit.
TEXT.Italian: So, you wish to barter with the "heathen" do you? Out with it, then.
TEXT.Spanish: Luego, deseáis hacer intercambios con el "infiel", ¿verdad? Largaos de aquí, entonces.

TEXT.English: See, it wasn't so hard to think for yourself, now was it?
TEXT.French: Vous voyez, ce n'était pas si dur de penser par vous même,
TEXT.German: Na also. Nachdenken ist nicht allzu schwer, oder?
TEXT.Italian: See, it wasn't so hard to think for yourself, now was it?
TEXT.Spanish: Veis, no ha sido tan difícil pensar por vos mismo, ¿verdad?

TEXT.English: You must be mistaken-I do not answer prayers.
TEXT.French: Vous devez faire erreur, je ne suis pas celui qui répond aux prières.
TEXT.German: Ihr müsst Euch irren. Ich erhöre keine Gebete.
TEXT.Italian: You must be mistaken-I do not answer prayers.
TEXT.Spanish: Debéis estar equivocado... yo no respondo a las plegarias.

TEXT.English: The Grigori stand to gain nothing by this, my friend.
TEXT.French: Les Grigoris n'ont rien à y gagner, mon ami.
TEXT.German: Die Grigori werden so nichts gewinnen, mein Freund.
TEXT.Italian: The Grigori stand to gain nothing by this, my friend.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Grigori no ganan nada con esto, amigo mío.

TEXT.English: I need no revelation to spot a scam. Return when you wish to truly barter.
TEXT.French: Je n'ai besoin d'aucune révélation pour reconnaître une arnaque. Revenez quand vous voudrez vraiment troquer.
TEXT.German: Es riecht faulig hier. Kommt wieder, wenn Ihr richtig handeln wollt.
TEXT.Italian: I need no revelation to spot a scam. Return when you wish to truly barter.
TEXT.Spanish: No necesito niguna revelación para reconocer una estafa. Volved cuando realmente deéis intercambiar.

TEXT.English: Have you finished, or do your priests seek my head as well?
TEXT.French: Avez-vous fini, ou vos prêtres veulent-il également ma tête ?
TEXT.German: Seid Ihr fertig, oder trachten auch Eure Priester nach meinem Kopf?
TEXT.Italian: Have you finished, or do your priests seek my head as well?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Habéis terminado, o también vuestros sacerdotes buscan mi cabeza?

TEXT.English: I'm glad to see you can be reasonable after all.
TEXT.French: Je suis heureux que vous vous montriez finalement raisonnable.
TEXT.German: Es freut mich zu sehen, dass Ihr am Ende noch zur Vernunft gekommen seid.
TEXT.Italian: I'm glad to see you can be reasonable after all.
TEXT.Spanish: Me alegra observar que podéis ser razonable después de todo.

TEXT.English: The Order demands unquestioning obedience. The Overlords, a lifetime of slavery. The Veil takes your soul. See how much more merciful I am?
TEXT.French: L'Ordre demande une obéissance inconditionnelle. Les Suzerains, une vie d'esclavage. Le Voile prend votre âme. Voyez comme je suis miséricordieux?
TEXT.German: Die Weisung verlangt bedingungslosen Gehorsam, die Schatten lebenslange Knechtschaft. Der Schleier verschlingt Eure Seele. Seht Ihr nun, wie viel gnädiger ich bin?
TEXT.Italian: The Order demands unquestioning obedience. The Overlords, a lifetime of slavery. The Veil takes your soul. See how much more merciful I am?
TEXT.Spanish: El Orden demanda obediencia ciega. Los Supremos, una vida de esclavitud. El Velo atrapa vuestra alma. ¿Véis cuán más piadoso soy yo?

TEXT.English: I wish to test your faith, [CT_NAME]. Give me this. Or do you think your gods can protect you?
TEXT.French: Je souhaite éprouver votre foi, [CT_NAME]. Donnez-moi ceci. Ou pensez vous que vos dieux peuvent vous protéger?
TEXT.German: Ich würde gerne Euren Glauben prüfen, [CT_NAME]. Gebt mir das. Oder denkt Ihr, Eure Götter können Euch schützen?
TEXT.Italian: I wish to test your faith, [CT_NAME]. Give me this. Or do you think your gods can protect you?
TEXT.Spanish: Deseo poner a prueba vuestra fe, [CT_NAME]. Dadme esto. ¿O creéis que vuestros dioses pueden protegeros?

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], surely you realize that I am not the devil your meddling priests say? I must ask your assistance.
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], vous vous rendez sûrement compte que je ne suis pas le démon que vos prêtres importuns décrivent? Je dois vous demander de l'aide.
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], dass ich nicht der Teufel bin, den Eure laschen Priester in mir sehen, wisst Ihr? Ich muss Eure Unterstützung erbitten.
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], surely you realize that I am not the devil your meddling priests say? I must ask your assistance.
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], seguramente os daréis cuenta de que no soy el malvado que vuestros entrometidos sacerdotes dicen que soy, ¿verdad?. Debo pediros vuestra ayuda.

TEXT.English: You refuse me this petty tribute? I have always advocated self-sufficiency. Just hope I don't decide to take what I need by force.
TEXT.French: Vous me refusez cet insignifiant tribut ? J'ai toujours prôné l'autarcie. Espérez juste que je ne décide pas de prendre par la force ce dont j'ai besoin.
TEXT.German: Diesen winzigen Tribut verweigert Ihr? Ich war zwar schon immer für Selbstversorgung, aber passt bloß auf, dass ich mir nicht mit Gewalt hole, was ich brauche.
TEXT.Italian: You refuse me this petty tribute? I have always advocated self-sufficiency. Just hope I don't decide to take what I need by force.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Rechazáis mi insignificante tributo? Siempre he abogado por la autosuficiencia. Sólo esperemos que no decida coger lo que necesito por la fuerza.

TEXT.English: "I had meant to free you from your strings. So you killed me for it. Farewell, puppet, enjoy your dance."
TEXT.French: "Je comptais vous libérer de vos ficelles. Et vous m'avez tué pour cela. Adieu, marionnette, appréciez votre danse."
TEXT.German: "Ich wollte Euch nur von Euren Fäden befreien und Ihr habt mich dafür getötet. Lebt wohl, Marionette, genießt Euren Tanz."
TEXT.Italian: "I had meant to free you from your strings. So you killed me for it. Farewell, puppet, enjoy your dance."
TEXT.Spanish: "I had meant to free you from your strings. So you killed me for it. Farewell, puppet, enjoy your dance."

TEXT.English: Many people would sooner die than think; In fact, they do so.
TEXT.French: Many people would sooner die than think; In fact, they do so.
TEXT.German: Viele Leute würden lieber sterben als sich die Arbeit zu machen, wirklich nachzudenken. Und in der Tat, so kommt es dann meist auch.
TEXT.Italian: Many people would sooner die than think; In fact, they do so.
TEXT.Spanish: Many people would sooner die than think; In fact, they do so.

TEXT.English: A stupid man's report of what a clever man says can never be accurate, because he unconsciously translates what he hears into something he can understand.
TEXT.French: A stupid man's report of what a clever man says can never be accurate, because he unconsciously translates what he hears into something he can understand.
TEXT.German: Der Bericht eines dummen Mannes über das, was ein kluger Kopf gesagt hat, kann niemals richtig sein, da er unbewusst das, was er gehört hat, in etwas verwandelt, was er verstehen kann.
TEXT.Italian: A stupid man's report of what a clever man says can never be accurate, because he unconsciously translates what he hears into something he can understand.
TEXT.Spanish: A stupid man's report of what a clever man says can never be accurate, because he unconsciously translates what he hears into something he can understand.

TEXT.English: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.
TEXT.French: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.
TEXT.German: Leben ist nicht anderes als die Herausforderung, der Täter anstelle des Opfers zu sein.
TEXT.Italian: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.
TEXT.Spanish: Life is nothing but a competition to be the criminal rather than the victim.

TEXT.English: The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation.
TEXT.French: The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation.
TEXT.German: Der einzige Weg zur Erlösung der Menschheit ist - Kooperation.
TEXT.Italian: The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation.
TEXT.Spanish: The only thing that will redeem mankind is cooperation.

TEXT.English: It is a waste of energy to be angry with a man who behaves badly, just as it is to be angry with a horse that won't go.
TEXT.French: It is a waste of energy to be angry with a man who behaves badly, just as it is to be angry with a horse that won't go.
TEXT.German: Es ist eine Energieverschwendung, einem Mann wegen schlechten Verhaltens böse zu sein, das wäre dasselbe, als würde man seinem Pferd böse sein, weil es nicht so will, wie man selbst. Das bringt doch nichts.
TEXT.Italian: It is a waste of energy to be angry with a man who behaves badly, just as it is to be angry with a horse that won't go.
TEXT.Spanish: It is a waste of energy to be angry with a man who behaves badly, just as it is to be angry with a horse that won't go.

TEXT.English: Nothing personal, business is business, and you are a prime target.
TEXT.French: Rien de personnel, les affaires sont les affaires, et vous êtes une cible de choix.
TEXT.German: Nehmt's nicht persönlich. Geschäft ist Geschäft, und Ihr seid nun mal ein lohnendes Ziel.
TEXT.Italian: Nothing personal, business is business, and you are a prime target.
TEXT.Spanish: No es nada personal, los negocios son los negocios, y vos sois un objetivo primario.

TEXT.English: Well met. We will be fast friends indeed, [CT_NAME], for as long as you can afford it.
TEXT.French: Belle rencontre ! Nous serons bien sûr rapidement amis, [CT_NAME], du moins aussi longtemps que vous pourrez vous l'offrir.
TEXT.German: Gehabt Euch wohl. Wir werden sicher schnell Freundschaft schließen, [CT_NAME], wenn Ihr es Euch leisten könnt.
TEXT.Italian: Well met. We will be fast friends indeed, [CT_NAME], for as long as you can afford it.
TEXT.Spanish: Bienhallado. Sin duda seremos rápidos amigos, [CT_NAME], al menos mientras puedas mantener el ritmo.

TEXT.English: Idle chat is for old women, not warriors.
TEXT.French: Le bavardage frivole est pour les vielles femmes, pas pour les guerriers.
TEXT.German: Nutzloses Geplapper ist etwas für alte Frauen, nicht für Krieger.
TEXT.Italian: Idle chat is for old women, not warriors.
TEXT.Spanish: La habladuría frívola es cosa de viejas, no de guerreros.

TEXT.English: Well, we're always up for a raid. Do you know any other good targets?
TEXT.French: Hé bien, nous sommes troujours prêts pour un raid. Connaissez-vous d'autres bonnes cibles ?
TEXT.German: Nun, wir sind immer für einen Raubzug zu haben. Kennt Ihr vielleicht andere lukrative Ziele?
TEXT.Italian: Well, we're always up for a raid. Do you know any other good targets?
TEXT.Spanish: Well, we're always up for a raid. Do you know any other good targets?

TEXT.English: When there is plunder to be had from your fields? Nah...
TEXT.French: Alors qu'il reste des champs à vous piller? Nan...
TEXT.German: Wenn es sich bei Euch gerade so schön plündern und brandschatzen lässt? Nah...
TEXT.Italian: When there is plunder to be had from your fields? Nah...
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Cuando aún hay saqueos que hacer en vuestros campos? Nooo...

TEXT.English: Need the services of the Hippus?
TEXT.French: Besoin des services des Hippus ?
TEXT.German: Ihr braucht die Dienste der Hippus?
TEXT.Italian: Need the services of the Hippus?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Necesitáis los servicios de Hippus?

TEXT.English: You? I suppose we could help you, though you'll pay plenty for it.
TEXT.French: Vous ? Je suppose que nous pourrions vous aider, même si vous le payeriez cher.
TEXT.German: Ihr? Nun wir könnten Euch helfen, für einen guten Preis.
TEXT.Italian: You? I suppose we could help you, though you'll pay plenty for it.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Vos? Supongo que podríamos ayudaros, aunque tendréis que pagar mucho.

TEXT.English: Aye, and you're a shrewd negotiator.
TEXT.French: Aie, vous êtes un négociant avisé.
TEXT.German: Sicher doch, Ihr seid ein gewitzter Verhandlungspartner.
TEXT.Italian: Aye, and you're a shrewd negotiator.
TEXT.Spanish: Sip, sois un negociador astuto.

TEXT.English: You aren't as persuasive as you think you are, [CT_NAME]. Let's see how well you make your case one the field.
TEXT.French: Vous n'êtes pas aussi persuasif que vous le croyez, [CT_NAME]. Voyons voir comment vous défendrez votre cause sur le champ de bataille.
TEXT.German: So überzeugend seid Ihr nun auch nicht, [CT_NAME]. Mal sehen, wie Ihr Eure Sache auf dem Schlchtfeld vertretet.
TEXT.Italian: You aren't as persuasive as you think you are, [CT_NAME]. Let's see how well you make your case one the field.
TEXT.Spanish: No sois tan persuasivo como creéis que sois, [CT_NAME]. Veamos lo bien que defendéis vuestra causa en el campo.

TEXT.English: After all we've been through? Can't you do any better?
TEXT.French: Après tout ce que nous avons traversé ? Ne pouvez-vous pas faire un peu mieux ?
TEXT.German: Nach allem nur das? Das könntet ihr doch besser, oder?
TEXT.Italian: After all we've been through? Can't you do any better?
TEXT.Spanish: Después de todo hemos terminado? ¿No puedes proponer nada mejor?

TEXT.English: That? You want me to accept that? There's got to be someone who'd appreciate our friendship more.
TEXT.French: Ça ? Vous voulez que j'accepte ça ? Il doit y avoir quelqu'un qui saura mieux apprécier notre amitié.
TEXT.German: Das? Das haltet Ihr für akzeptabel? Es muss jemand anderen geben, der unsere Freundschaft höher schätzt.
TEXT.Italian: That? You want me to accept that? There's got to be someone who'd appreciate our friendship more.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Eso? ¿Queréis que acepte eso? Tiene que haber alguien que sepa apreciar más nuestra amistad.

TEXT.English: Perhaps we should renegotiate this war?
TEXT.French: Peut-être devrions nous renégocier cette guerre ?
TEXT.German: Vielleicht sollten wir diesen Krieg neu verhandeln?
TEXT.Italian: Perhaps we should renegotiate this war?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Quizá podríamos renegociar esta guerra?

TEXT.English: You are an honorable friend.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes un ami honorable.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid ein ehrenwerter Freund.
TEXT.Italian: You are an honorable friend.
TEXT.Spanish: Sois un amigo honorable.

TEXT.English: Don't think of it as theft. Think of it as extortion.
TEXT.French: Ne pensez pas que c'est du vol. Pensez y plutôt comme une extorsion.
TEXT.German: Bitte, denkt dabei nicht an Diebstahl, sondern an Erpressung.
TEXT.Italian: Don't think of it as theft. Think of it as extortion.
TEXT.Spanish: No lo veáis como un robo. Vedlo más bien como una extorsión.

TEXT.English: We could take this by raiding your villages and cities, but why don't you save us both the trouble?
TEXT.French: Nous pouvons prendre cela en pillant vos villages et vos villes, mais pourquoi ne nous épargneriez-vous pas cette peine?
TEXT.German: Wir könnten das aus Euren Dörfern und Städten rauben, nur, wollt Ihr uns allen diesen Ärger nicht ersparen?
TEXT.Italian: We could take this by raiding your villages and cities, but why don't you save us both the trouble?
TEXT.Spanish: Podríamos coger esto lanzando una incursión en vuestras aldeas y ciudades, pero ¿por qué no nos ahorráis esa molestia a ambos?

TEXT.English: For the gratitude of the Hippus, it's actually quite a deal!
TEXT.French: En échange de la gratitude des Hippus, c'est plutôt un bon marché!
TEXT.German: Ein guter Handel, für den Euch die Dankbarkeit der Hippus gewiss sei!
TEXT.Italian: For the gratitude of the Hippus, it's actually quite a deal!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡A cambio de la gratitud de los Hippus, esto es de hecho un buen trato!

TEXT.English: No? Very well. If a company of mercenaries rides through your land and happens to burn a few villages, remember this day.
TEXT.French: Non ? Très bien. S'il arrivait qu'une compagnie de mercenaire sillonne vos terre et que quelques villages brûlent, souvenez vous de ce jour.
TEXT.German: Nein? Na gut. Erinnert Euch dessen, wenn Söldner Euer Land plündern und brandschatzen.
TEXT.Italian: No? Very well. If a company of mercenaries rides through your land and happens to burn a few villages, remember this day.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿No? Muy bien. Si una compañía de mercenarios invade vuestras tierras y empiezan a quemar unas pocas aldeas, recordad este día.

TEXT.English: "We could have been an asset to you. Yet you kill us all. The spirits of the Hippus shall guide your enemies to you."
TEXT.French: "Nous aurions pu être un atout pour vous. Pourtant vous nous exterminez. Les esprits des Hippus guideront vos ennemis vers vous."
TEXT.German: "Wir hätten ein Gewinn für Euch sein können. Dennoch habt Ihr uns alle getötet. Die Geister der Hippus sollen Eure Feinde zu Euch führen."
TEXT.Italian: "We could have been an asset to you. Yet you kill us all. The spirits of the Hippus shall guide your enemies to you."
TEXT.Spanish: "We could have been an asset to you. Yet you kill us all. The spirits of the Hippus shall guide your enemies to you."

TEXT.English: You opposed me, [CT_NAME]. Your people do not deserve to see my glory reborn.
TEXT.French: Vous vous êtes opposé à moi, [CT_NAME]. Votre peuple ne mérite pas de voir ma glorieuse renaissance.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt Euch mir entgegengestellt, [CT_NAME]! Euer Volk verdient es nicht zu sehen, wie meine Herrlichkeit wiedergeboren wird!
TEXT.Italian: You opposed me, [CT_NAME]. Your people do not deserve to see my glory reborn.
TEXT.Spanish: Os habéis opuesto a mí, [CT_NAME]. Vuestro pueblo no es merecedor de mi gloria renacida.

TEXT.English: This age will be short, you should spend it preparing for what is to come.
TEXT.French: Cet âge sera court, vous devriez le consacrer à vous préparer à ce qui reste à venir.
TEXT.German: Auch dieses Zeitalter ist nicht von Dauer. Wappnet Euch für das, was da kommt.
TEXT.Italian: This age will be short, you should spend it preparing for what is to come.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta edad será corta, deberíais gastarla en prepararos para lo que está por llegar.

TEXT.English: I tire of your empty prattle echoing through these sacred caverns. Return to your lands.
TEXT.French: Je me fatigue de votre bavardage insensé résonnant à travers ces cavernes sacrées. Retournez sur vos terres.
TEXT.German: Ich werde Eurem leeren Geschwätz überdrüssig, das in diesen heiligen Höhlen widerhallt. Verschwindet in Euer eigenes Reich.
TEXT.Italian: I tire of your empty prattle echoing through these sacred caverns. Return to your lands.
TEXT.Spanish: Me canso de vuestro parloteo sin sentido dando ecos por estas cavernas sagradas. Volved a vuestra tierra.

TEXT.English: If you are wise, [CT_NAME], you'll use this peace to placate me.
TEXT.French: Si vous êtes sage, [CT_NAME], vous profiterez de cette trêve pour m'apaiser.
TEXT.German: Wenn Ihr weise seid, [CT_NAME], dann werdet Ihr diesen Frieden nutzen, um mich zu besänftigen.
TEXT.Italian: If you are wise, [CT_NAME], you'll use this peace to placate me.
TEXT.Spanish: Si sóis sabio, [CT_NAME], utilizaréis esta paz para aplacarme.

TEXT.English: I would not dream of quitting-I grow closer to this world by the season.
TEXT.French: Je ne rêverais même pas d'arrêter - je deviens plus proche de ce monde à chaque saison.
TEXT.German: Ich würde nicht mal im Traum daran denken, es zu beenden. Mit jeder weiteren Minute komme ich dieser Welt näher.
TEXT.Italian: I would not dream of quitting-I grow closer to this world by the season.
TEXT.Spanish: Ni en sueños desistiría... estoy más cerca de este mundo con cada estación.

TEXT.English: Between you and me, I think you'd better put on something a bit warmer.
TEXT.French: Entre vous et moi, je pense que vous feriez mieux d'enfiler quelque chose d'un peu plus chaud.
TEXT.German: Unter uns gesagt, solltet Ihr Euch wärmer anziehen.
TEXT.Italian: Between you and me, I think you'd better put on something a bit warmer.
TEXT.Spanish: Entre vos y yo, creo que lo mejor sería que os pusiérais algo un poco más abrigado.

TEXT.English: The howling winds cry of the wrongs done to me. We forget nothing.
TEXT.French: Les vents hurlant pleurent les torts qui m'ont été faits. Nous n'oublions rien.
TEXT.German: Das Heulen der Winde verkündet weithin Eure Missetaten an uns. Wir vergessen nichts.
TEXT.Italian: The howling winds cry of the wrongs done to me. We forget nothing.
TEXT.Spanish: Los vientos aullantes gritan por los males hechos a mí. Nunca olvidamos.

TEXT.English: Trying to appear too useful to destroy? Well, for once you've succeeded!
TEXT.French: Essayez-vous de paraître trop utile pour être détruit? Hé bien, pour une fois, vous avez réussi.
TEXT.German: Ihr sollt also lebend nützlicher sein als tot? Nun, diesmal habt Ihr noch recht!
TEXT.Italian: Trying to appear too useful to destroy? Well, for once you've succeeded!
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Tratando de parecer demasiado útiles para ser destruidos? Bien, por una vez lo habéis logrado.

TEXT.English: In time, you WILL come to regret your impertinence, mortal.
TEXT.French: Soyez assuré qu'un jour vous regretterez votre impertinence, mortel.
TEXT.German: Sehr bald schon werdet Ihr Eure Impertinenz BEREUEN, Sterblicher.
TEXT.Italian: In time, you WILL come to regret your impertinence, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: Con el tiempo, lamentaréis vuestra impertinencia, mortal.

TEXT.English: You'd best dig a little deeper if you want to stay on my good side, mortal.
TEXT.French: Vous feriez mieux de creuser un peu plus profond si vous ne voulez pas baisser dans mon estime, mortel.
TEXT.German: Wenn Ihr in guter Erinnerung bleiben wollt, Sterblicher, erhöht Ihr besser Euer Angebot noch ein bisschen.
TEXT.Italian: You'd best dig a little deeper if you want to stay on my good side, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: Lo mejor sería que escabárais un poco más profundo si queréis seguir a mi provechoso lado, mortal.

TEXT.English: You have no idea who you are insulting with this absurd proposal, do you?
TEXT.French: Vous n'avez aucune idée de qui vous insultez avec cette proposition absurde, n'est-ce pas ?
TEXT.German: Ihr wisst nicht, wen Ihr mit diesem absurden Angebot beleidigt, nicht wahr?
TEXT.Italian: You have no idea who you are insulting with this absurd proposal, do you?
TEXT.Spanish: No tenéis ni idea de a quién estáis insultando con esta absurda propuesta, ¿verdad?

TEXT.English: This is getting a bit too hot for me. Accept peace now and we will remember you in the next age.
TEXT.French: Cela devient un peu trop chaud pour moi. Acceptez la paix maintenant, et je m'en souviendrai dans le prochain Âge.
TEXT.German: Das hier wird mir langsam etwas zu heiß. Akzeptiert jetzt mein Friedensangebot, und wird werden Eurer im nächsten Zeitalter gedenken.
TEXT.Italian: This is getting a bit too hot for me. Accept peace now and we will remember you in the next age.
TEXT.Spanish: Esto se está poniendo un poco demasiado caluroso para mí. Aceptad la paz ahora, y os recordaremos en la siguiente edad.

TEXT.English: Yes, this is a fitting offering.
TEXT.French: Oui, c'est une offre équitable.
TEXT.German: Ja, das ist ein angemessenes Angebot.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, this is a fitting offering.
TEXT.Spanish: Sí, esta es una oferta equitativa

TEXT.English: In time, you WILL come to regret your impertinence, mortal.
TEXT.French: Un jour, vous regretterez À COUP SÛR votre impertinence, mortel.
TEXT.German: Sehr bald schon werdet Ihr Eure Impertinenz BEREUEN, Sterblicher.
TEXT.Italian: In time, you WILL come to regret your impertinence, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: Con el tiempo, os arrepentiréis por vuestra impertinencia, mortal.

TEXT.English: "No! I was so close to returning! You cannot truly finish me, mortal, and I will see your end!"
TEXT.French: "Non ! J'étais si proche du retour ! Vous ne pouvez pas réellement me tuer, mortel, et je verrai votre fin !"
TEXT.German: "Nein! Ich war so kurz vor meiner Wiederkehr! Ihr könnt mich nicht wirklich vernichten, Sterblicher, und ich werde Euer Ende sehen!"
TEXT.Italian: "No! I was so close to returning! You cannot truly finish me, mortal, and I will see your end!"
TEXT.Spanish: "No! I was so close to returning! You cannot truly finish me, mortal, and I will see your end!"

TEXT.English: Weak.
TEXT.French: Faible.
TEXT.German: Weak.
TEXT.Italian: Weak.
TEXT.Spanish: Weak.

TEXT.English: Free.
TEXT.French: Libres.
TEXT.German: Free.

TEXT.Spanish: Free.

TEXT.English: Protection.
TEXT.French: Protection.
TEXT.German: Protection.
TEXT.Italian: Protection.
TEXT.Spanish: Protection.

TEXT.French: L'hiver reviendra.
TEXT.German: Winter will return.
TEXT.Italian: Winter will return.
TEXT.Spanish: Winter will return.

TEXT.French: Je propose.

TEXT.English: Be reasonnable.
TEXT.French: Soyez raisonnable.
TEXT.German: Be reasonnable.

TEXT.English: Agreement ended.
TEXT.French: Accord terminé.
TEXT.German: Agreement ended.

TEXT.French: Plus maintenant.

TEXT.French: Nos accords.

TEXT.French: Insultant.
TEXT.German: Insulting.

TEXT.Spanish: Insulting.

TEXT.French: Tenez.

TEXT.French: Indigne.

TEXT.French: Donnez.

TEXT.English: Foolish.
TEXT.French: Sot.
TEXT.German: Foolish.
TEXT.Italian: Foolish.
TEXT.Spanish: Foolish.

TEXT.English: Unwise.
TEXT.French: Imprudent.
TEXT.German: Unwise.
TEXT.Italian: Unwise.
TEXT.Spanish: Unwise.

TEXT.English: Insolent.
TEXT.French: Insolent.
TEXT.German: Insolent.
TEXT.Italian: Insolent.
TEXT.Spanish: Insolent.

TEXT.English: War against the %s1:2.
TEXT.French: Guerre contre les %s1:2.
TEXT.German: War against the %s1:2.
TEXT.Italian: War against the %s1:2.
TEXT.Spanish: War against the %s1:2.

TEXT.English: I know the price of my downfall. Do you know the price of your rise?
TEXT.French: I know the price of my downfall. Do you know the price of your rise?
TEXT.German: Ich kenne den Preis meines Untergangs. Kennt Ihr den Eures Aufstiegs?
TEXT.Italian: I know the price of my downfall. Do you know the price of your rise?
TEXT.Spanish: I know the price of my downfall. Do you know the price of your rise?

TEXT.English: Winter, cold and relentless, comes for you.
TEXT.French: L'Hiver, froid et implacable, vient pour vous.
TEXT.German: Winter, cold and relentless, comes for you.
TEXT.Italian: Winter, cold and relentless, comes for you.
TEXT.Spanish: Winter, cold and relentless, comes for you.

TEXT.English: We can resume our plans, Winter will inevitably come, and nothing will stop it.
TEXT.French: Nous pouvons reprendre nos plans, l'Hiver viendra inévitablement, et rien ne pourra l'arrêter.
TEXT.German: We can resume our plans, Winter will inevitably come, and nothing will stop it.
TEXT.Italian: We can resume our plans, Winter will inevitably come, and nothing will stop it.
TEXT.Spanish: We can resume our plans, Winter will inevitably come, and nothing will stop it.

TEXT.English: We are experiencing setbacks, protect us and be spared from the cold grip of Winter for now.
TEXT.French: Nos plans connaissent des revers, protégez nous et soyez épargnés de l'emprise glacée de l'Hiver pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: We are experiencing setbacks, protect us and be spared from the cold grip of Winter for now.
TEXT.Italian: We are experiencing setbacks, protect us and be spared from the cold grip of Winter for now.
TEXT.Spanish: We are experiencing setbacks, protect us and be spared from the cold grip of Winter for now.

TEXT.English: Another mortal tribe? With the guidance of our Master Auric, an everlasting Winter will befall these lands once more. Embrace it while you can, or prepare yourself to be consumed by the eternal snows.
TEXT.French: Une autre tribu de mortels? Sous la direction de notre Maître Auric, un Hiver perpétuel s'abattra à nouveau sur ces terres. Embrassez-le tant que vous le pouvez, ou préparez vous à être consumés par les neiges éternelles.
TEXT.German: Another mortal tribe? With the guidance of our Master Auric, an everlasting Winter will befall these lands once more. Embrace it while you can, or prepare yourself to be consumed by the eternal snows.
TEXT.Italian: Another mortal tribe? With the guidance of our Master Auric, an everlasting Winter will befall these lands once more. Embrace it while you can, or prepare yourself to be consumed by the eternal snows.
TEXT.Spanish: Another mortal tribe? With the guidance of our Master Auric, an everlasting Winter will befall these lands once more. Embrace it while you can, or prepare yourself to be consumed by the eternal snows.

TEXT.English: I long for the time when the icy grip of death will silence you forever.
TEXT.French: J'attends avec impatience le moment où l'emprise froide de la mort vous réduira à jamais au silence.
TEXT.German: I long for the time when the icy grip of death will silence you forever.
TEXT.Italian: I long for the time when the icy grip of death will silence you forever.
TEXT.Spanish: I long for the time when the icy grip of death will silence you forever.

TEXT.English: Do not mistake this truce for victory, Winter will come all the same in the end.
TEXT.French: Ne prenez pas cette trêve pour une victoire, l'Hiver viendra quoi qu'il arrive.
TEXT.German: Do not mistake this truce for victory, Winter will come all the same in the end.
TEXT.Italian: Do not mistake this truce for victory, Winter will come all the same in the end.
TEXT.Spanish: Do not mistake this truce for victory, Winter will come all the same in the end.

TEXT.English: Winter shall not end. Not this time. Accept your fate.
TEXT.French: L'Hiver ne prendra pas fin. Pas cette fois. Acceptez votre destin.
TEXT.German: Winter shall not end. Not this time. Accept your fate.
TEXT.Italian: Winter shall not end. Not this time. Accept your fate.
TEXT.Spanish: Winter shall not end. Not this time. Accept your fate.

TEXT.English: You have served the interests of the future God of Winter well. You may enter the tent of our Master Auric to recognize his divinity by yourself.
TEXT.French: Vous avez bien servi les intérêts du futur Dieu de l'Hiver. Vous pouvez entrer dans la tente de notre Maître Auric pour contempler sa divinité par vous-même.
TEXT.German: You have served the interests of the future God of Winter well. You may enter the tent of our Master Auric to recognize his divinity by yourself.
TEXT.Italian: You have served the interests of the future God of Winter well. You may enter the tent of our Master Auric to recognize his divinity by yourself.
TEXT.Spanish: You have served the interests of the future God of Winter well. You may enter the tent of our Master Auric to recognize his divinity by yourself.

TEXT.English: Our Master is busy with divine affairs, mortal. If you bring anything to serve our cause, I will be the one to handle it.
TEXT.French: Notre Maître est occupé par des affaires divines. Si vous apportez de quoi servir notre cause, c'est moi qui m'en occuperais.
TEXT.German: Our Master is busy with divine affairs, mortal. If you bring anything to serve our cause, I will be the one to handle it.
TEXT.Italian: Our Master is busy with divine affairs, mortal. If you bring anything to serve our cause, I will be the one to handle it.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Master is busy with divine affairs, mortal. If you bring anything to serve our cause, I will be the one to handle it.

TEXT.English: You have yet to embrace the ways of our Master. Do you feel the wind in your own lands chilling? Your time is running short...
TEXT.French: Vous n'avez pas encore adopté la voie de notre Maître. Sentez-vous l'air se refroidir même dans vos propres terres? Le temps qu'il vous reste s'écoule rapidement...
TEXT.German: You have yet to embrace the ways of our Master. Do you feel the wind in your own lands chilling? Your time is running short...
TEXT.Italian: You have yet to embrace the ways of our Master. Do you feel the wind in your own lands chilling? Your time is running short...
TEXT.Spanish: You have yet to embrace the ways of our Master. Do you feel the wind in your own lands chilling? Your time is running short...

TEXT.English: Your very presence is a disturbance. I advise you to leave, quickly.
TEXT.French: Votre simple présence est une perturbation. Je vous conseille de partir, rapidement.
TEXT.German: Your very presence is a disturbance. I advise you to leave, quickly.
TEXT.Italian: Your very presence is a disturbance. I advise you to leave, quickly.
TEXT.Spanish: Your very presence is a disturbance. I advise you to leave, quickly.

TEXT.English: I would kill you myself, but then I would not have the pleasure to see your dying body freezing in the snow.
TEXT.French: Je vous tuerais bien moi-même, mais dans ce cas je n'aurais pas le plaisir de voir votre corps mourrant geler dans la neige.
TEXT.German: I would kill you myself, but then I would not have the pleasure to see your dying body freezing in the snow.
TEXT.Italian: I would kill you myself, but then I would not have the pleasure to see your dying body freezing in the snow.
TEXT.Spanish: I would kill you myself, but then I would not have the pleasure to see your dying body freezing in the snow.

TEXT.English: Our divine Master is beyond petty material needs, but our people is not.
TEXT.French: Notre Maître divin est au dessus de tels besoins matériels futiles, mais notre peuple ne l'est pas.
TEXT.German: Our divine Master is beyond petty material needs, but our people is not.
TEXT.Italian: Our divine Master is beyond petty material needs, but our people is not.
TEXT.Spanish: Our divine Master is beyond petty material needs, but our people is not.

TEXT.English: That seems adequate, I should not have to disturb our Master to consult Him on this matter.
TEXT.French: Cela devrait être adéquat, je ne devrais pas avoir à déranger notre Maître pour Le consulter là-dessus.
TEXT.German: That seems adequate, I should not have to disturb our Master to consult Him on this matter.
TEXT.Italian: That seems adequate, I should not have to disturb our Master to consult Him on this matter.
TEXT.Spanish: That seems adequate, I should not have to disturb our Master to consult Him on this matter.

TEXT.English: Be glad that you are wasting my time and not my Master's, though I advise you not to present us another impudent offer like this one.
TEXT.French: Réjouissez-vous de gaspiller mon temps et pas celui de mon Maître, bien que je vous conseille de ne pas présenter à nouveau d'offre aussi impertinente.
TEXT.German: Be glad that you are wasting my time and not my Master's, though I advise you not to present us another impudent offer like this one.
TEXT.Italian: Be glad that you are wasting my time and not my Master's, though I advise you not to present us another impudent offer like this one.
TEXT.Spanish: Be glad that you are wasting my time and not my Master's, though I advise you not to present us another impudent offer like this one.

TEXT.English: Mock me all you want with those impudent propositions. I will be the one mocking you when your carcass will be left to rot under the snow.
TEXT.French: Moquez vous de moi autant que vous le voulez avec ces propositions impertinentes. Je serais celui qui me moquera de vous quand votre carcasse pourrira sous la neige.
TEXT.German: Mock me all you want with those impudent propositions. I will be the one mocking you when your carcass will be left to rot under the snow.
TEXT.Italian: Mock me all you want with those impudent propositions. I will be the one mocking you when your carcass will be left to rot under the snow.
TEXT.Spanish: Mock me all you want with those impudent propositions. I will be the one mocking you when your carcass will be left to rot under the snow.

TEXT.English: You show reason. All hope for you is not yet lost.
TEXT.French: Vous faites preuve de raison. Tout espoir n'est peut-être pas perdu pour vous.
TEXT.German: You show reason. All hope for you is not yet lost.
TEXT.Italian: You show reason. All hope for you is not yet lost.
TEXT.Spanish: You show reason. All hope for you is not yet lost.

TEXT.English: Do not expect me to thank you. Winter is coming for you all the same.
TEXT.French: Ne vous attendez pas à des remerciements. L'Hiver viendra pour vous quoi qu'il arrive.
TEXT.German: Do not expect me to thank you. Winter is coming for you all the same.
TEXT.Italian: Do not expect me to thank you. Winter is coming for you all the same.
TEXT.Spanish: Do not expect me to thank you. Winter is coming for you all the same.

TEXT.English: You are unreasonnable. Let us hope for your own good that the next blizzard helps you to change your mind.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes déraisonnable. Espérons pour votre propre bien que le prochain blizzard vous aidera à changer d'avis.
TEXT.German: You are unreasonnable. Let us hope for your own good that the next blizzard helps you to change your mind.
TEXT.Italian: You are unreasonnable. Let us hope for your own good that the next blizzard helps you to change your mind.
TEXT.Spanish: You are unreasonnable. Let us hope for your own good that the next blizzard helps you to change your mind.

TEXT.English: I did not expect anything else from you, if you could see reason you would bow before the God of the Age to come.
TEXT.French: Je ne m'attendais à rien d'autre de votre part, si vous étiez raisonnable, vous vous proesterneriez devant le Dieu de l'Âge à venir.
TEXT.German: I did not expect anything else from you, if you could see reason you would bow before the God of the Age to come.
TEXT.Italian: I did not expect anything else from you, if you could see reason you would bow before the God of the Age to come.
TEXT.Spanish: I did not expect anything else from you, if you could see reason you would bow before the God of the Age to come.

TEXT.English: If I have to waste my time bargaining for you, it would better be worth it.
TEXT.French: Si je dois perdre mon temps à négocier pour vous, cela a intérêt à en valoir la peine.
TEXT.German: If I have to waste my time bargaining for you, it would better be worth it.
TEXT.Italian: If I have to waste my time bargaining for you, it would better be worth it.
TEXT.Spanish: If I have to waste my time bargaining for you, it would better be worth it.

TEXT.English: We are taking tributes, not offering them.
TEXT.French: Nous prenons les tributs, nous n'en offrons pas.
TEXT.German: We are taking tributes, not offering them.
TEXT.Italian: We are taking tributes, not offering them.
TEXT.Spanish: We are taking tributes, not offering them.

TEXT.English: It is insulting to see you stand here, thinking you have anything of enough importance to bargain with us.
TEXT.French: C'est insultant de vous voir vous tenir ici, à penser que vous avez quoi que ce soit d'assez important pour négocier avec nous.
TEXT.German: It is insulting to see you stand here, thinking you have anything of enough importance to bargain with us.
TEXT.Italian: It is insulting to see you stand here, thinking you have anything of enough importance to bargain with us.
TEXT.Spanish: It is insulting to see you stand here, thinking you have anything of enough importance to bargain with us.

TEXT.English: We offer you a temporary truce before Winter inevitably returns, mortal. Think of what you could spend the last days of your pitiful life doing instead of a war against a God.
TEXT.French: Nous vous offrons une trêve temporaire avant que l'Hiver ne revienne inévitablement. Pensez à ce à quoi d'autre qu'une guerre contre un Dieu vous pourriez passer les derniers jours de votre misérable vie.
TEXT.German: We offer you a temporary truce before Winter inevitably returns, mortal. Think of what you could spend the last days of your pitiful life doing instead of a war against a God.
TEXT.Italian: We offer you a temporary truce before Winter inevitably returns, mortal. Think of what you could spend the last days of your pitiful life doing instead of a war against a God.
