TEXT.Spanish: We offer you a temporary truce before Winter inevitably returns, mortal. Think of what you could spend the last days of your pitiful life doing instead of a war against a God.

TEXT.English: On the behalf of my Master, I offer you an agreement. It would be unwise to disappoint us both.
TEXT.French: Au nom de mon Maître, je vous propose cet accord. Il serait imprudent de nous décevoir tous les deux.
TEXT.German: On the behalf of my Master, I offer you an agreement. It would be unwise to disappoint us both.
TEXT.Italian: On the behalf of my Master, I offer you an agreement. It would be unwise to disappoint us both.
TEXT.Spanish: On the behalf of my Master, I offer you an agreement. It would be unwise to disappoint us both.

TEXT.English: Our Master think that it could still be useful to trade with someone like you. He may not be so lenient next time.
TEXT.French: Notre Maître pense utile de tout de même essayer de commercer avec vous. Il pourrait ne pas être aussi indulgent la prochaine fois.
TEXT.German: Our Master think that it could still be useful to trade with someone like you. He may not be so lenient next time.
TEXT.Italian: Our Master think that it could still be useful to trade with someone like you. He may not be so lenient next time.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Master think that it could still be useful to trade with someone like you. He may not be so lenient next time.

TEXT.English: This agreement is no longer of any use to us, mortal.
TEXT.French: Cet accord ne nous est plus d'aucune utilité.
TEXT.German: This agreement is no longer of any use to us, mortal.
TEXT.Italian: This agreement is no longer of any use to us, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: This agreement is no longer of any use to us, mortal.

TEXT.English: On behalf of my Master, I cancel this agreement.
TEXT.French: Au nom de mon Maître, je mets fin à cet accord.
TEXT.German: On behalf of my Master, I cancel this agreement.
TEXT.Italian: On behalf of my Master, I cancel this agreement.
TEXT.Spanish: On behalf of my Master, I cancel this agreement.

TEXT.English: Anything that can serve our Master is welcome.
TEXT.French: Tout ce qui peut servir à notre Maître est le bienvenu.
TEXT.German: Anything that can serve our Master is welcome.
TEXT.Italian: Anything that can serve our Master is welcome.
TEXT.Spanish: Anything that can serve our Master is welcome.

TEXT.English: These are the agreements that received the blessing of our Master.
TEXT.French: Voici les accords qui ont reçu la bénédiction de notre Maître.
TEXT.German: These are the agreements that received the blessing of our Master.
TEXT.Italian: These are the agreements that received the blessing of our Master.
TEXT.Spanish: These are the agreements that received the blessing of our Master.

TEXT.English: ...Fine. But remember that a weakling relying on other's aid is of no value to a God.
TEXT.French: ...D'accord. Mais souvenez vous qu'un être faible dépendant de l'aide des autres n'est d'aucune utilité à un Dieu.
TEXT.German: ...Fine. But remember that a weakling relying on other's aid is of no value to a God.
TEXT.Italian: ...Fine. But remember that a weakling relying on other's aid is of no value to a God.
TEXT.Spanish: ...Fine. But remember that a weakling relying on other's aid is of no value to a God.

TEXT.English: Our Master does not need you. We do not have to concede anything to you.
TEXT.French: Notre Maître n'a pas besoin de vous. Nous n'avons pas à vous concéder quoi que ce soit.
TEXT.German: Our Master does not need you. We do not have to concede anything to you.
TEXT.Italian: Our Master does not need you. We do not have to concede anything to you.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Master does not need you. We do not have to concede anything to you.

TEXT.English: ...Fine. But know that you have earned the full fury of a God today.
TEXT.French: ...D'accord. Mais sachez que vous vous êtes attiré la pleine fureur d'un Dieu aujourd'hui.
TEXT.German: ...Fine. But know that you have earned the full fury of a God today.
TEXT.Italian: ...Fine. But know that you have earned the full fury of a God today.
TEXT.Spanish: ...Fine. But know that you have earned the full fury of a God today.

TEXT.English: Do you think you can so openly try to extort the possessions of a God? I should spill your blood on the snow right now for this offence!
TEXT.French: Vous pensez pouvoir tenter d'extorquer aussi ouvertement les possessions d'un Dieu? Je devrais faire couler votre sang sur la neige tout de suite pour cette offense !
TEXT.German: Do you think you can so openly try to extort the possessions of a God? I should spill your blood on the snow right now for this offence!
TEXT.Italian: Do you think you can so openly try to extort the possessions of a God? I should spill your blood on the snow right now for this offence!
TEXT.Spanish: Do you think you can so openly try to extort the possessions of a God? I should spill your blood on the snow right now for this offence!

TEXT.English: Our Master wants to give you this. Make good use of it.
TEXT.French: Notre Maître veux vous donner ceci. Faites-en bon usage.
TEXT.German: Our Master wants to give you this. Make good use of it.
TEXT.Italian: Our Master wants to give you this. Make good use of it.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Master wants to give you this. Make good use of it.

TEXT.English: The return of the God of Winter is at hand, we only need this for the final preparations.
TEXT.French: Le retour du Dieu de l'Hiver est proche, nous avons seulement besoin de ceci pour les derniers préparatifs.
TEXT.German: The return of the God of Winter is at hand, we only need this for the final preparations.
TEXT.Italian: The return of the God of Winter is at hand, we only need this for the final preparations.
TEXT.Spanish: The return of the God of Winter is at hand, we only need this for the final preparations.

TEXT.English: You are making yourself an enemy of the future God of this world.
TEXT.French: Vous vous faites un ennemi du futur Dieu de ce monde.
TEXT.German: You are making yourself an enemy of the future God of this world.
TEXT.Italian: You are making yourself an enemy of the future God of this world.
TEXT.Spanish: You are making yourself an enemy of the future God of this world.

TEXT.English: An eternal Winter will soon come to these lands for a second time. Do you remember what happened to "cvilization" the first time?
TEXT.French: Un Hiver éternal viendra bientôt s'abattre sur ces terres pour la seconde fois. Vous souvenez-vous de ce qu'il est arrivé à la "civilisation" la première fois?
TEXT.German: An eternal Winter will soon come to these lands for a second time. Do you remember what happened to "cvilization" the first time?
TEXT.Italian: An eternal Winter will soon come to these lands for a second time. Do you remember what happened to "cvilization" the first time?
TEXT.Spanish: An eternal Winter will soon come to these lands for a second time. Do you remember what happened to "cvilization" the first time?

TEXT.English: You were quick to make yourself an obstacle to our projects.
TEXT.French: Vous devenez rapidement un obstacle à nos projets.
TEXT.German: You were quick to make yourself an obstacle to our projects.
TEXT.Italian: You were quick to make yourself an obstacle to our projects.
TEXT.Spanish: You were quick to make yourself an obstacle to our projects.

TEXT.English: Winter is soon to come. Our men are regrouping, our giants are ready to crush your cities, and the White Dragon's shadow will soon darken your lands. We offer you one more chance : forfeit what we want of you, and you may yet live for now.
TEXT.French: L'Hiver arrive bientôt. Nos hommes se regroupent, nos géants sont prêts à écraser vos villes, and l'ombre du Dragon Blanc assombrira bientôt vos terres. Nous vous offrons une dernière chance : abandonnez nous ce que nous voulons de vous, et vous pourrez continuer à vivre pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: Winter is soon to come. Our men are regrouping, our giants are ready to crush your cities, and the White Dragon's shadow will soon darken your lands. We offer you one more chance : forfeit what we want of you, and you may yet live for now.
TEXT.Italian: Winter is soon to come. Our men are regrouping, our giants are ready to crush your cities, and the White Dragon's shadow will soon darken your lands. We offer you one more chance : forfeit what we want of you, and you may yet live for now.
TEXT.Spanish: Winter is soon to come. Our men are regrouping, our giants are ready to crush your cities, and the White Dragon's shadow will soon darken your lands. We offer you one more chance : forfeit what we want of you, and you may yet live for now.

TEXT.English: Our Master, Auric, is soon to be reborn as the God of Winter. Hand over what is wanted of you, pitiful mortal, or you are soon to meet Him... and your demise.
TEXT.French: Notre Maître, Auric, va bientôt renaître en tant que Dieu de l'Hiver. Remettez-nous ce que nous attendons de vous, ou préparez vous à Le rencontrer... ainsi que votre mort.
TEXT.German: Our Master, Auric, is soon to be reborn as the God of Winter. Hand over what is wanted of you, pitiful mortal, or you are soon to meet Him... and your demise.
TEXT.Italian: Our Master, Auric, is soon to be reborn as the God of Winter. Hand over what is wanted of you, pitiful mortal, or you are soon to meet Him... and your demise.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Master, Auric, is soon to be reborn as the God of Winter. Hand over what is wanted of you, pitiful mortal, or you are soon to meet Him... and your demise.

TEXT.English: Bow before the God of Winter, mortal, and you may yet live to see the Age to come.
TEXT.French: Inclinez vous devant le Dieu de l'Hiver, mortel, et vous pourriez vivre pour voir l'Âge à venir.
TEXT.German: Bow before the God of Winter, mortal, and you may yet live to see the Age to come.
TEXT.Italian: Bow before the God of Winter, mortal, and you may yet live to see the Age to come.
TEXT.Spanish: Bow before the God of Winter, mortal, and you may yet live to see the Age to come.

TEXT.English: Pathetic, you were offered a chance to redeem yourself before the coming of the next Age, and you refused it. Even without a God on our side, we can crush your primitive tribe of puny mortals right now.
TEXT.French: Pathétique, vous vous êtes vu offrir une chance de vous racheter avant l'arrivée du prochain Âge, et vous l'avez refusée. Même sans Dieu de notre côté, nous pourrions écraser votre tribu de mortels primitifs tout de suite.
TEXT.German: Pathetic, you were offered a chance to redeem yourself before the coming of the next Age, and you refused it. Even without a God on our side, we can crush your primitive tribe of puny mortals right now.
TEXT.Italian: Pathetic, you were offered a chance to redeem yourself before the coming of the next Age, and you refused it. Even without a God on our side, we can crush your primitive tribe of puny mortals right now.
TEXT.Spanish: Pathetic, you were offered a chance to redeem yourself before the coming of the next Age, and you refused it. Even without a God on our side, we can crush your primitive tribe of puny mortals right now.

TEXT.English: You have proven that your impudence will be your undoing, mortal.
TEXT.French: Vous venez de prouver que votre insolence sera votre perte.
TEXT.German: You have proven that your impudence will be your undoing, mortal.
TEXT.Italian: You have proven that your impudence will be your undoing, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: You have proven that your impudence will be your undoing, mortal.

TEXT.English: You won't live to see the coming Age, mortal.
TEXT.French: Vous ne vivrez pas pour voir l'Âge à venir.
TEXT.German: You won't live to see the coming Age, mortal.
TEXT.Italian: You won't live to see the coming Age, mortal.
TEXT.Spanish: You won't live to see the coming Age, mortal.

TEXT.English: The %s1:2 are hindering the plans of our Master. Join the war against them, and you may earn His favor.
TEXT.French: Les %s1:2 perturbent les plans de notre Maître. Rejoignez la guerre contre eux, et vous pourrez peut-être obtenir Sa faveur.
TEXT.German: The %s1:2 are hindering the plans of our Master. Join the war against them, and you may earn His favor.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1:2 are hindering the plans of our Master. Join the war against them, and you may earn His favor.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1:2 are hindering the plans of our Master. Join the war against them, and you may earn His favor.

TEXT.English: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.
TEXT.French: Le dragon blanc attends, je ne regrette seulement de ne pas pouvoir le voir s'occuper de vous.
TEXT.German: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.
TEXT.Italian: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.
TEXT.Spanish: The white dragon awaits, I am only sorry I won't see it come for you.

TEXT.English: Rage against me as you will, the Winter will not end.
TEXT.French: Vous pouvez vous acharner contre moi autant que vous le voudrez, l'Hiver ne prendra pas fin.
TEXT.German: Rage against me as you will, the Winter will not end.
TEXT.Italian: Rage against me as you will, the Winter will not end.
TEXT.Spanish: Rage against me as you will, the Winter will not end.

TEXT.English: In life or death I only wait for the God of Winter's rebirth. You cannot change that.
TEXT.French: Dans la vie comme dans la mort je n'attends que la renaissance du Dieu de l'Hiver. Vous n'y changerez rien.
TEXT.German: In life or death I only wait for the God of Winter's rebirth. You cannot change that.
TEXT.Italian: In life or death I only wait for the God of Winter's rebirth. You cannot change that.
TEXT.Spanish: In life or death I only wait for the God of Winter's rebirth. You cannot change that.

TEXT.English: I will make your death quick. Torture can wait until we meet in Hell.
TEXT.French: Votre mort sera rapide. La torture attendra que nous nous voyions en Enfer.
TEXT.German: Ich werde Euch schnell töten. Der Folterspaß kann warten, bis wir uns in der Hölle wiedertreffen.
TEXT.Italian: I will make your death quick. Torture can wait until we meet in Hell.
TEXT.Spanish: Haré que muráis con rapidez. La tortura puede esperar hasta que nos encontremos en el Infierno.

TEXT.English: Ahh... a new tribe slinking across creation, still in that twilight between birth and the recruitment of hell.
TEXT.French: Ahh... Une nouvelle tribu, se glissant furtivement dans la création, restant dans ce crépuscule entre la naissance et l'enrôlement par l'Enfer.
TEXT.German: Ahh... ein neuer Wurm im Schatten der Schöpfung, noch im Zwielicht von Geburt und Hölle.
TEXT.Italian: Ahh... a new tribe slinking across creation, still in that twilight between birth and the recruitment of hell.
TEXT.Spanish: Ahh... una nueva tribu escabulléndose a través de la creación, aún en ese crepúsculo entre el nacimiento y el reclutamiento del infierno.

TEXT.English: Do I look like that friendly to you? Be gone, lest my flames do the "talking!"
TEXT.French: Vous semble-je si amical ? Partez, avant que mes flammes ne "discutent" avec vous !
TEXT.German: Sehe ich so gutmütig aus? Haut ab, damit meine Flammen nicht das "Reden" übernehmen müssen!
TEXT.Italian: Do I look like that friendly to you? Be gone, lest my flames do the "talking!"
TEXT.Spanish: ¿A caso parezco que me sienta amigable con vos? ¡Largo, para que mis llamas sean las que hablen!

TEXT.English: Brute force has its charm. But intimidation and seduction are just as effective.
TEXT.French: La force brute a son charme. Mais l'intimidation et la séduction sont tout aussi efficaces.
TEXT.German: Brachiale Gewalt hat ihren Charme. Aber Einschüchterung und Bestechung sind nicht weniger effektiv.
TEXT.Italian: Brute force has its charm. But intimidation and seduction are just as effective.
TEXT.Spanish: La fuerza bruta tiene su encanto. Pero la intimidación y la seducción son igual de efectivos.

TEXT.English: Why should the son of fire fall down before a son of clay?
TEXT.French: Pourquoi le fils du feu devrait-il s'agenouiller devant un fils d'argile ?
TEXT.German: Warum sollte sich der Sohn des Feuers einem Erdenwurm beugen?
TEXT.Italian: Why should the son of fire fall down before a son of clay?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Por qué debería el hijo del fuego rendirse ante un hijo del barro?

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], tell me what you need. Power? Yes, I believe we can make an arrangement...
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], dites-moi de quoi vous avez besoin. La puissance ? Oui, je crois que nous pouvons nous arranger...
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], sagt mir, was Ihr begehrt. Macht? Nun ich denke, das können wir arrangieren...
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], tell me what you need. Power? Yes, I believe we can make an arrangement...
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], decidme que necesitáis. ¿Poder? Sí, creo que podemos hacer preparativos...

TEXT.English: Please, come a little closer, [CT_NAME]. Come to my world, where the rules aren't stacked in favor of pathetic motes like yourself.
TEXT.French: S'il vous plaît, venez un peu plus près, [CT_NAME]. Venez dans mon monde, où les règles ne s'accumulent pas en faveur des misérables grains de poussière comme vous.
TEXT.German: Bitte, kommt ein wenig näher, [CT_NAME]. Kommt in meine Welt, wo die Gesetze nicht zu Gunsten erbärmlicher Staubkörner wie Euch ausgelegt werden.
TEXT.Italian: Please, come a little closer, [CT_NAME]. Come to my world, where the rules aren't stacked in favor of pathetic motes like yourself.
TEXT.Spanish: Por favor, acercaos un poco más, [CT_NAME]. Venid a mi mundo, donde las reglas no responden en favor de las motas patéticas como tú.

TEXT.English: This will do for now. Your next request can be paid in blood and souls, my friend.
TEXT.French: Cela ira pour l'instant. Votre prochaine requête pourrait se payer de sang et d'âmes, mon ami.
TEXT.German: Soweit so gut. Euer nächster Handel wird mit Blut und Verderbnis vergolten werden, mein Freund.
TEXT.Italian: This will do for now. Your next request can be paid in blood and souls, my friend.
TEXT.Spanish: Esto servirá por ahora. Vuestra siguiente petición puede pagarse con sangre y almas, amigo mío.

TEXT.English: Demand? You demand? The flames do not give, they consume.
TEXT.French: Demander ? Vous demandez ? Les flammes ne donnent pas, elles consument.
TEXT.German: Forderung? Ihr fordert? Das Feuer gibt nicht, es verschlingt.
TEXT.Italian: Demand? You demand? The flames do not give, they consume.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Demanda? ¿Vos demandáis? Las llamas no dan, consumen.

TEXT.English: Each word you offer in defiance will merit a lifetime of torture when your soul falls into my hands. Enjoy well your bravado.
TEXT.French: Chaque mot que vous nous opposez en défi méritera une vie de torture lorsque votre âme tombera entre mes mains. Profitez bien de votre bravade.
TEXT.German: Durch jedes ablehnende Wort verdient Ihr eine weitere lebenslange Folter, wenn mir Eure Seele schließlich in die Hände fällt. Bis dahin, genießt Eure Frechheiten.
TEXT.Italian: Each word you offer in defiance will merit a lifetime of torture when your soul falls into my hands. Enjoy well your bravado.
TEXT.Spanish: Con cada palabra que me ofrezcáis en desafío se os retribuirá con una vida de tortura cuando vuestra alma caiga en mis manos. Disfrutad de vuestra bravata.

TEXT.English: "So I am banished from the earth. I will await you in hell, worm. Hahahahahaha!"
TEXT.French: "Ainsi je suis banni de la terre. Je vous attendrai en enfer, vermisseau. Ha Ha Ha Ha HA HA !"
TEXT.German: "Dann bin ich eben von der Erde verbannt. Ich werde auf dich in der Hölle warten, du Wurm. Hahahahahaha!"
TEXT.Italian: "So I am banished from the earth. I will await you in hell, worm. Hahahahahaha!"
TEXT.Spanish: "So I am banished from the earth. I will await you in hell, worm. Hahahahahaha!"

TEXT.English: Our warriors will have much to sing about after this war, [CT_NAME]. Let's hope your boys don't embarrass themselves.
TEXT.French: Nos guerriers auront beaucoup d'exploits à chanter après cette guerre, [CT_NAME]. Espérons que vos gamins ne se ridiculiseront pas.
TEXT.German: Unsere Krieger werden nach diesem Krieg viel zu besingen haben, [CT_NAME]. Lasst uns hoffen, dass sich Eure Jammerlappen nicht selbst in Verlegenheit bringen werden.
TEXT.Italian: Our warriors will have much to sing about after this war, [CT_NAME]. Let's hope your boys don't embarrass themselves.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros guerreros tendrán mucho de lo que cantar después de esta guerra, [CT_NAME]. Esperemos que vuestros chicos no se avergüencen a sí mismos.

TEXT.English: The Dwarven Nation was never dimmed by the Age of Ice as winter has no hold on the underhome.
TEXT.French: La Nation Naine n'a jamais été affectée par l'Âge de Glace, l'hiver n'ayant pas droit de cité à Maisonterre.
TEXT.German: Das Zwergenvolk ward von eisigen Zeiten nie verschreckt. Der Arm des Winters reicht nicht bis in unsere Stätten im Berg.
TEXT.Italian: The Dwarven Nation was never dimmed by the Age of Ice as winter has no hold on the underhome.
TEXT.Spanish: La Nación Enana nunca fue afectada por la Edad de Hielo, el invierno no tiene lugar en los hogares subterráneos.

TEXT.English: Ach, more of your blabbing? I much prefer the sound of hammer and steel.
TEXT.French: Ach, encore vos bavardages ? Je préfère nettement le son du marteau et de l'acier.
TEXT.German: Oh je, mehr von Eurem Geschwätz? Ich bevorzuge den Klang von Hammer und Stahl.
TEXT.Italian: Ach, more of your blabbing? I much prefer the sound of hammer and steel.
TEXT.Spanish: Aj, ¿más parloteo del vuestro? Prefiero mucho más el sonido del martillo y el acero.

TEXT.English: Don't think I'm a-trustin' you yet, but we can save the battle for another day, aye?
TEXT.French: N'allez pas croire que j'vous fais confiance, mais nous pouvons garder l'affrontement en réserve, non ?
TEXT.German: Glaubt nicht, ich würde Euch bereits vertrauen. Aber wir können uns den Kampf für einen anderen Tag aufheben, nicht wahr?
TEXT.Italian: Don't think I'm a-trustin' you yet, but we can save the battle for another day, aye?
TEXT.Spanish: No creáis que confío en vos todavía, pero podemos dejar la batalla para otro dia, ¿no?

TEXT.English: What're you trying to pull? No, enough of that, stand and fight!
TEXT.French: Qu'essayez-vous d'obtenir ? Non, il suffit, levez-vous et battez-vous !
TEXT.German: Was versucht Ihr herauszuschlagen? Nichts da, genug davon, steht auf und kämpft!
TEXT.Italian: What're you trying to pull? No, enough of that, stand and fight!
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Pero de qué intentáis escapar? ¡No, suficiente de eso, mantenéos firme y luchad!

TEXT.English: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Come, we've much to discuss!
TEXT.French: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Venez, nous avons beaucoup à discuter !
TEXT.German: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Kommt, wir haben viel zu besprechen!
TEXT.Italian: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Come, we've much to discuss!
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, [CT_NAME]. ¡Venid, tenemos mucho que hablar!

TEXT.English: You think you're so high-and-mighty, eh? Well you'd better not overlook the dwarves, I'll tell ye!
TEXT.French: Vous vous croyez tellement grand-et-fort, hein ? Et bien vous ferez mieux de ne pas regarder les Nains de haut, j'vous l'dis !
TEXT.German: Ihr seid wohl sehr eingenommen von Eurer Größe und Macht, he? Aber ich sage Euch, unterschätzt die Zwerge nicht!
TEXT.Italian: You think you're so high-and-mighty, eh? Well you'd better not overlook the dwarves, I'll tell ye!
TEXT.Spanish: Creéis que sóis tan alto como poderoso, ¿eh? Bueno, lo mejor será que no infravaloréis a los Enanos, ¡te lo digo yo!

TEXT.English: I know a bargain when I see one!
TEXT.French: Je reconnais une affaire lorsque j'en vois une.
TEXT.German: Ich kann ein gutes Geschäft erkennen, wenn es sich ergibt.
TEXT.Italian: I know a bargain when I see one!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Reconozco una ganga cuando veo una!

TEXT.English: Ah, no, these dwarves won't be shoved around by the likes of you!
TEXT.French: Ah, non, ces Nains ne serons pas malmenés par vos semblables !
TEXT.German: Ah, nein, diese Zwerge lassen sich nicht von Leuten wie Euch herumschubsen!
TEXT.Italian: Ah, no, these dwarves won't be shoved around by the likes of you!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Ah, no, estos Enanos no serán empujados por gente como vos!

TEXT.English: We would prefer to fill our vaults through "trade" but conquest works as well.
TEXT.French: Nous préférons remplir nos coffres par le "commerce", mais la conquête marche aussi bien.
TEXT.German: Wir bevorzugen eher Reichtum durch Handel, aber Eroberung ist auch ein Weg.
TEXT.Italian: We would prefer to fill our vaults through "trade" but conquest works as well.
TEXT.Spanish: Preferiríamos llenar nuestras arcas por medio del "comercio", aunque la conquista también vale.

TEXT.English: "My gold! You've taken all my gold! Kill me if you will, vermin, there are dwarves untouchable in the Underhome."
TEXT.French: "Mon or ! Vous avez pris tout mon or ! Tuez-moi si vous voulez, vermine, il y a des nains que vous ne pourrez atteindre à Maisonterre."
TEXT.German: "Mein Gold! Ihr habt mein ganzes Gold genommen! Tötet mich, wenn Ihr wollt, Ungeziefer, denn es gibt noch Zwerge, unberührbar in der Unterwelt."
TEXT.Italian: "My gold! You've taken all my gold! Kill me if you will, vermin, there are dwarves untouchable in the Underhome."
TEXT.Spanish: "My gold! You've taken all my gold! Kill me if you will, vermin, there are dwarves untouchable in the Underhome."

TEXT.English: You are a bully, plain and simple. If war is the only way to show you the error of you ways, we will not shy away from it!
TEXT.French: Vous êtes brutal, quelconque et simplet. Si la guerre est la seule manière de vous montrer vos erreurs, nous n'y répugnerons point!
TEXT.German: Ihr seid ein primitiver, einfältiger Rüpel. Falls Krieg der einzige Weg ist, Euch Eure Fehler aufzuzeigen, werden wir nicht davor zurückschrecken, ihn zu gehen.
TEXT.Italian: You are a bully, plain and simple. If war is the only way to show you the error of you ways, we will not shy away from it!
TEXT.Spanish: Sois un matón, simple y llanamente. Si la guerra es la única forma de mostraros el error de vuestra dirección, ¡entonces no nos alejaremos de ella!

TEXT.English: Only by standing together can we hope to remain through the challenges of the coming age.
TEXT.French: C'est en restant ensemble que nous pourrons résister aux épreuves de nouvel Âge.
TEXT.German: Nur gemeinsam können wir die Herausforderungen des kommenden Zeitalters überstehen.
TEXT.Italian: Only by standing together can we hope to remain through the challenges of the coming age.
TEXT.Spanish: Sólo manteniéndonos unidos podemos esperar permanecer a través de los desafíos de la era que se avecina.

TEXT.English: There are matters for me to attend to more urgent than your talk, [CT_NAME]. Another time.
TEXT.French: Il y a des sujets plus urgents que votre discussion, [CT_NAME]. Une autre fois.
TEXT.German: Ich habe Angelegenheiten zu erledigen, die weitaus dringlicher sind, als Euer Geplapper, [CT_NAME]. Ein anderes mal vielleicht.
TEXT.Italian: There are matters for me to attend to more urgent than your talk, [CT_NAME]. Another time.
TEXT.Spanish: Tengo cosas más importantes que hacer que hablar con vos, [CT_NAME]. En otro momento.

TEXT.English: Let this age be one of trust and harmony, as the Age of Magic never was.
TEXT.French: Faisons de cet âge une ère de confiance et d'harmonie, comme jamais l'Âge de la Magie ne le fut.
TEXT.German: Lasst dieses Zeitalter eine Epoche des Vertrauens und der Harmonie sein, wie es das Zeitalter der Magie niemals war.
TEXT.Italian: Let this age be one of trust and harmony, as the Age of Magic never was.
TEXT.Spanish: Dejemos que esta era sea una de confianza y harmonía, como la Edad de la Magia no pudo ser.

TEXT.English: If I let you go now, you'll only threaten us again. Much as it goes against my nature, you must be devoured.
TEXT.French: Si je vous laisse partir maintenant, vous ne ferez que nous menacer à nouveau. Bien que cela aille à l'encontre de ma nature, vous devez être dévoré.
TEXT.German: Ließe ich Euch so davonkommen, wäre es nur eine Frage der Zeit, bis Ihr uns wieder bedroht. Es ist mir unangenehm, doch Ihr müsst unterworfen werden.
TEXT.Italian: If I let you go now, you'll only threaten us again. Much as it goes against my nature, you must be devoured.
TEXT.Spanish: Si os dejo ir ahora, lo único que haréis será volver a amenazar muestras vidas. Mas eso va en contra de mi naturaleza, debéis ser devorado.

TEXT.English: It is good to speak with you again, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: C'est bon de parler à nouveau avec vous, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Schön, Euch wieder zu sehen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: It is good to speak with you again, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Me alegra volver a hablar con vos, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: Greatness comes from building up, [CT_NAME], not tearing down.
TEXT.French: La grandeur vient de la construction, [CT_NAME], pas de la destruction.
TEXT.German: Wahre Größe kommt von innen, [CT_NAME], nicht vom Äusseren.
TEXT.Italian: Greatness comes from building up, [CT_NAME], not tearing down.
TEXT.Spanish: La grandeza proviene de la construcción, [CT_NAME], no de la destrucción.

TEXT.English: Let's hope this will draw our people closer.
TEXT.French: Espérons que cela rapprochera nos peuples.
TEXT.German: Lasst uns hoffen, dass dies unsere Völker einander näher bringt.
TEXT.Italian: Let's hope this will draw our people closer.
TEXT.Spanish: Esperemos que esto aproxime más a nuestros pueblos.

TEXT.English: This isn't the way we do things around here, [CT_NAME]. Take your bullying elsewhere.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas ainsi que nous faisons par ici, [CT_NAME]. Remportez vos imbécilités.
TEXT.German: So läuft das hier nicht, [CT_NAME]. Geht und schikaniert jemand anderes.
TEXT.Italian: This isn't the way we do things around here, [CT_NAME]. Take your bullying elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: Así no es como hacemos las cosas aquí, [CT_NAME]. Lleváos vuestras bravuconadas a otra parte.

TEXT.English: Come now, don't get upset over this. We are building an edifice to last the ages, and I gave you a chance to be a part. The loss is yours.
TEXT.French: Allons, n'en soyez pas chamboulé. Nous construisons un édifice qui traversera le temps, et je vous ai donné une chance d'en faire partie. Le préjudice est vôtre.
TEXT.German: Kommt schon, Ihr werdet doch nicht verstimmt sein. Wir errichten ein Bauwerk, das die Zeitalter überdauern wird, und ich gab Euch die Chance daran mitzuwirken. Euer Pech.
TEXT.Italian: Come now, don't get upset over this. We are building an edifice to last the ages, and I gave you a chance to be a part. The loss is yours.
TEXT.Spanish: Venga, no os trastornéis más con esto. Estamos construyendo un edificio que dure hasta el fin de los tiempos, y os di la oportunidad de formar parte de ello. La pérdida es vuestra.

TEXT.English: "Our proud cities lay in ashes. Our noble dragon is never to lead again. And I... do what you will with me, it matters not now that my people are destroyed."
TEXT.French: "Nos fières villes sont réduites en cendres. Notre noble dragon ne nous dirigera jamais plus. Et moi... faites ce que vous voulez de moi, peu m'importe maintenant que mon peuple est anéanti."
TEXT.German: "Unsere stolzen Städte sind zu Asche geworden. Unser edler Drache wird uns niemals wieder führen. Und ich... macht mit mir, was Ihr wollt, es ist nicht mehr wichtig, jetzt, wo mein Volk vernichtet ist."
TEXT.Italian: "Our proud cities lay in ashes. Our noble dragon is never to lead again. And I... do what you will with me, it matters not now that my people are destroyed."
TEXT.Spanish: "Our proud cities lay in ashes. Our noble dragon is never to lead again. And I... do what you will with me, it matters not now that my people are destroyed."

TEXT.English: I can see a mere raid won't fix you. See those thousand sails over yonder? They're coming for your wine, your riches, your women, and your life!
TEXT.French: Je vois qu'un simple raid ne vous arrêtera pas. Voyez-vous ces milliers de voiles à l'horizon ? Elles viennent pour votre vin, vos richesses, vos femmes et votre vie!
TEXT.German: Es war wohl abzusehen, dass ein... kleines Scharmützel mir Euch nicht untertan machen wird. So schaut, schaut hinaus zum Ozean, über die Weltenlinie hinaus. Seht die Tausend Segel, wie sie kommen um sich Euren Wein, Euren Reichtum, Eure Weiber und schließlich auch Euer Leben zu nehmen!
TEXT.Italian: I can see a mere raid won't fix you. See those thousand sails over yonder? They're coming for your wine, your riches, your women, and your life!
TEXT.Spanish: Puedo ver que una mera incursión no te arreglaría. ¿Ves esas miles de velas sobre el horizonte? ¡Vienen a por vuestro vino, vuestras riquezas, vuestras mujeres y tu vida!

TEXT.English: Enjoy well your continents and crowded cities, but leave the islands to us.
TEXT.French: Jouissez de vos continents et de vos villes peuplées, mais laissez nous les îles.
TEXT.German: Erfreut Euch Eurer Kontinente und verstopften Städte, aber lasst uns die Inseln.
TEXT.Italian: Enjoy well your continents and crowded cities, but leave the islands to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Disfruta de tus continentes y abarrotadas ciudades, pero deja las islas para nosotros.

TEXT.English: Found sea-legs, have you? Well, take them elsewhere.
TEXT.French: Vous vous êtes trouvé le pied marin ? Hé bien, emportez-le ailleurs.
TEXT.German: Ihr habt an Standfestigkeit gewonnen, nicht wahr? Nun, stellt sie woanders unter Beweis.
TEXT.Italian: Found sea-legs, have you? Well, take them elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: Tienes mareos, ¿verdad? Bien, pues llévatelos a otra parte.

TEXT.English: It's good to be friends, [CT_NAME]. It makes your ships easier to plunder.
TEXT.French: C'est bien qu'on soit amis, [CT_NAME]. Ça rend vos navires plus faciles à piller.
TEXT.German: Freunde sind doch etwas Schönes, [CT_NAME]. So wird die Plünderung Eurer Schiffe zum Kinderspiel.
TEXT.Italian: It's good to be friends, [CT_NAME]. It makes your ships easier to plunder.
TEXT.Spanish: Es bueno ser amigos, [CT_NAME]. Hace que vuestros navíos sean más fáciles de saquear.

TEXT.English: Stop now? But my ships haven't sampled the hospitality of all your harbors yet!
TEXT.French: Arrêter maintenant ? Mais mes bateaux n'ont pas encore goûté à l'hospitalité de tous vos ports !
TEXT.German: Jetzt aufhören? Aber meine Schiffe haben noch nicht die Gastlichkeit all Eurer Häfen genießen können!
TEXT.Italian: Stop now? But my ships haven't sampled the hospitality of all your harbors yet!
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Parar ahora? ¡Pero si mis naves aún no han saboreado la hospitalidad de vuestros puertos!

TEXT.English: Ahoy there! Can I offer you some rum?
TEXT.French: Salut à vous ! Puis-je vous offrir un peu d'rhum ?
TEXT.German: Ahoi Euch! Ihr nehmt doch sicher einen Schluck Rum?
TEXT.Italian: Ahoy there! Can I offer you some rum?
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Ah, hola! ¿Puedo ofrecerte un poco de ron?

TEXT.English: If you do not impress me, you WILL be swimming home.
TEXT.French: Si vous ne me faites pas bonne impression, vous rentrerez à la NAGE !
TEXT.German: Wenn Ihr mich nicht beeindruckt, werdet Ihr nach Hause SCHWIMMEN.
TEXT.Italian: If you do not impress me, you WILL be swimming home.
TEXT.Spanish: Si no me impresionáis, volveréis a casa NADANDO.

TEXT.English: It's a deal, you salty old dog.
TEXT.French: Topez-la, vieux loup de mer.
TEXT.German: Hey alte Seegurke, abgemacht.
TEXT.Italian: It's a deal, you salty old dog.
TEXT.Spanish: Trato hecho, viejo lobo de mar.

TEXT.English: That deal's all wet. And you're about to be.
TEXT.French: Ce marché mérite de passer par-dessus bord. Et vous êtes sur le point de le rejoindre.
TEXT.German: Das Geschäft ist abgesoffen. Und Ihr werdet es bald auch sein.
TEXT.Italian: That deal's all wet. And you're about to be.
TEXT.Spanish: Este trato está muy mojado. Y tú también lo estarás pronto.

TEXT.English: Aye, it's a good deal, but we just can't take it right now.
TEXT.French: Aie, c'est une bonne proposition, mais nous ne pouvons juste pas l'accepter pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: Ay, ein guter Vorschlag. Wir können jedoch nicht sofort darauf eingehen.
TEXT.Italian: Aye, it's a good deal, but we just can't take it right now.
TEXT.Spanish: Sip, es un buen trato, pero simplemente no podemos aceptarlo en este momento.

TEXT.English: Blast you! You haven't enough loot to make me accept that!
TEXT.French: Du vent ! Vous n'avez pas assez de butin pour me faire accepter ça !
TEXT.German: Verschwindet! Ihr habt nicht genug Zaster, damit ich das akzeptiere!
TEXT.Italian: Blast you! You haven't enough loot to make me accept that!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Maldito seas! ¡No tienes suficiente riqueza para hacerme aceptar eso!

TEXT.English: Shiver me timbers! It seems I find myself a bit short-handed. Now, beating me like this wouldn't be any sport, would it?
TEXT.French: Que mes madriers en frissonnent ! Il semble que je me retrouve un peu à court. Me battre maintenant de cette manière ne serait pas très sportif, n'est-ce pas ?
TEXT.German: Potz Blitz! Es scheint, ich bin ein wenig in die Unterzahl geraten. Mich nun so zu schlagen, wäre nun wirklich keine Herausforderung, oder?
TEXT.Italian: Shiver me timbers! It seems I find myself a bit short-handed. Now, beating me like this wouldn't be any sport, would it?
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Rayos y truenos! Parece que me encuentro un poco corto de tripulación. Ahora, darme una paliza como esta no habrá sido tan fácil, ¿verdad?

TEXT.English: I told the lads you'd be a good one. You have the Lanun's thanks.
TEXT.French: J'disais aux f'mmes qu'vous étiez un brave homme. V's avez les remerciements des Lanuns.
TEXT.German: Ich hab den Jungs erzählt, Ihr wärt ein feiner Kerl. Der Dank der Lanun ist Euch sicher.
TEXT.Italian: I told the lads you'd be a good one. You have the Lanun's thanks.
TEXT.Spanish: Les dije a las señoritas que eras un buen hombre. Tienes el agradecimiento de Lanun.

TEXT.English: You'd do well to share your riches with me. The wrath of the Sea is a terrible thing, savvy?
TEXT.French: Vous feriez mieux de partager vos richesses avec nous. La fureur de la Mer est une chose terrible, n's pas ?
TEXT.German: Ihr tut gut daran, Euren Reichtum mit mir zu teilen. Der Zorn der See ist fürchterlich, nicht wahr?
TEXT.Italian: You'd do well to share your riches with me. The wrath of the Sea is a terrible thing, savvy?
TEXT.Spanish: Harías bien en compartir tus riquezas conmigo. La ira del Mar es algo terrible, ¿no crees?

TEXT.English: We make a good pair, you and I! But you know what'd make things even better between the two of us?
TEXT.French: Nous faisons la paire, tous les deux! Mais savez vous comment nous rapprocher encore?
TEXT.German: Wir passen gut zusammen, Ihr und ich! Aber wisst Ihr, was unsere Beziehungen noch weiter verbessern kann?
TEXT.Italian: We make a good pair, you and I! But you know what'd make things even better between the two of us?
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Hacemos una buena pareja, tú y yo! Pero, ¿sabes qué podría poner las cosas incluso mejor entre nosotros?

TEXT.English: Do you want to give your old friends the Lanun a hand?
TEXT.French: Acceptez-vous de donner un coup de main à vos vieux amis Lanuns ?
TEXT.German: Wollt Ihr Euren alten Freunden, den Lanun, beistehen?
TEXT.Italian: Do you want to give your old friends the Lanun a hand?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Querrías hechar una mano a tus viejos amigos los Lanun?

TEXT.English: Ah, so I can't charm the goods outta ye, huh? My mateys are much less charming, but they can be even more persuasive, I've found.
TEXT.French: Ah, j'ne puis vous soutirer ces biens par mes charmes, hein ? Mes potes sont bien moins charmants, mais j'ai remarqué qu'ils pouvaient être bien plus persuasifs.
TEXT.German: Ach, also wirkt mein Charme bei Euch nicht? Meine Kameraden sind weniger charmant, können jedoch sehr viel überzeugender sein, wie ich meinen darf.
TEXT.Italian: Ah, so I can't charm the goods outta ye, huh? My mateys are much less charming, but they can be even more persuasive, I've found.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, así que no puedo cogerte esos porductos con mis encantos, ¿eh?. Mis chicos son menos encantadores, pero me he dado cuenta de que pueden ser incluso más persuasivos.

TEXT.English: "Cities! Who needs 'em? Venture on the waves again, 'mate' and you'll walk the plank!"
TEXT.French: "L'villes ! Qui n'a b'soin ? L'aventure sur l'vagues à nouveau, "cam'rade", et vous passerez su'l'planche !"
TEXT.German: "Städte! Wer braucht die schon? Reis' wieder einmal auf den Wellen, 'Kumpel', und du wirst über die Planke gehen!"
TEXT.Italian: "Cities! Who needs 'em? Venture on the waves again, 'mate' and you'll walk the plank!"
TEXT.Spanish: "Cities! Who needs 'em? Venture on the waves again, 'mate' and you'll walk the plank!"

TEXT.English: You are quite wealthy, but your fleet is terribly underdefended. Clearly, your ships are just waiting to be plundered, and I shall do just that.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes plutôt riche, mais votre flotte manque terriblement de défense. Vos navires ne demandent clairement qu'à être pillés, et c'est bien ce que je compte faire.
TEXT.German: You are quite wealthy, but your fleet is terribly underdefended. Clearly, your ships are just waiting to be plundered, and I shall do just that.
TEXT.Italian: You are quite wealthy, but your fleet is terribly underdefended. Clearly, your ships are just waiting to be plundered, and I shall do just that.
TEXT.Spanish: You are quite wealthy, but your fleet is terribly underdefended. Clearly, your ships are just waiting to be plundered, and I shall do just that.

TEXT.English: We are ready to set sail again. Do not worry, we shall be gentle with your men, as long as they don't resist us too much.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes prêts à mettre les voiles de nouveau. Ne vous en faites pas, nous seront gentils avec vos hommes, tant qu'ils ne nous résistent pas trop.
TEXT.German: We are ready to set sail again. Do not worry, we shall be gentle with your men, as long as they don't resist us too much.
TEXT.Italian: We are ready to set sail again. Do not worry, we shall be gentle with your men, as long as they don't resist us too much.
TEXT.Spanish: We are ready to set sail again. Do not worry, we shall be gentle with your men, as long as they don't resist us too much.

TEXT.English: My ships will need repairing before they can set sail again. Would you mind offering us safe harbor for the time being? We can certainly make it worth your while.
TEXT.French: Mes navires vont avoir besoin de réparations avant de pouvoir reprendre la mer. Pourriez-vous nous laisser entrer dans vos ports pour l'instant? Vous verrez certainement que cela en vaut la peine.
TEXT.German: My ships will need repairing before they can set sail again. Would you mind offering us safe harbor for the time being? We can certainly make it worth your while.
TEXT.Italian: My ships will need repairing before they can set sail again. Would you mind offering us safe harbor for the time being? We can certainly make it worth your while.
TEXT.Spanish: My ships will need repairing before they can set sail again. Would you mind offering us safe harbor for the time being? We can certainly make it worth your while.

TEXT.English: Greetings. I am Casin Loveless, captain of this ship. Do not think of my crew and me as mindless brutes because of our activities on the seas. I've bested those who did so in both duels and debates.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, je suis Casin Loveless, capitaine de ce navire. Ne nous prenez pas, moi et mon équipage, pour des brutes écervelées en raison de nos activités. Jusque-là j'ai battu tous ceux qui l'ont fait soit en duel, soit lors d'un débat intellectuel.
TEXT.German: Greetings. I am Casin Loveless, captain of this ship. Do not think of my crew and me as mindless brutes because of our activities on the seas. I've bested those who did so in both duels and debates.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings. I am Casin Loveless, captain of this ship. Do not think of my crew and me as mindless brutes because of our activities on the seas. I've bested those who did so in both duels and debates.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings. I am Casin Loveless, captain of this ship. Do not think of my crew and me as mindless brutes because of our activities on the seas. I've bested those who did so in both duels and debates.

TEXT.English: I'd rather talk to an oyster than to you. It would be a better use of my time.
TEXT.French: Je préfèrerais parler à une huître plutôt qu'à vous, ce serait une moindre perte de temps.
TEXT.German: I'd rather talk to an oyster than to you. It would be a better use of my time.
TEXT.Italian: I'd rather talk to an oyster than to you. It would be a better use of my time.
TEXT.Spanish: I'd rather talk to an oyster than to you. It would be a better use of my time.

TEXT.English: Fine, you can go back to your shores and repair your ships. Fill them up with gold, then bring them back to me, will you?
TEXT.French: D'accord, vous pouvez retournez vers vos rivages et réparer vos navires. Mais remplissez les à nouveau d'or, puis ramenez les à moi encore une fois, voulez-vous?
TEXT.German: Fine, you can go back to your shores and repair your ships. Fill them up with gold, then bring them back to me, will you?
TEXT.Italian: Fine, you can go back to your shores and repair your ships. Fill them up with gold, then bring them back to me, will you?
TEXT.Spanish: Fine, you can go back to your shores and repair your ships. Fill them up with gold, then bring them back to me, will you?

TEXT.English: Already? We've only just begun, and there are still so many ships to plunder in your fleet...
TEXT.French: Déjà? Nous venons simplement de commencer, et il y a encore tant de navires à piller dans votre flotte...
TEXT.German: Already? We've only just begun, and there are still so many ships to plunder in your fleet...
TEXT.Italian: Already? We've only just begun, and there are still so many ships to plunder in your fleet...
TEXT.Spanish: Already? We've only just begun, and there are still so many ships to plunder in your fleet...

TEXT.English: Greetings, my friend, please make yourself comfortable. To what do I owe the pleasure?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, prenez vos aises. Qu'est-ce qui me vaut le plaisir de votre visite?
TEXT.German: Greetings, my friend, please make yourself comfortable. To what do I owe the pleasure?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, my friend, please make yourself comfortable. To what do I owe the pleasure?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, my friend, please make yourself comfortable. To what do I owe the pleasure?

TEXT.English: Greetings. I hope my crew treated you well along the way.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, j'espère que mon équipage vous a traité correctement sur le chemin.
TEXT.German: Greetings. I hope my crew treated you well along the way.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings. I hope my crew treated you well along the way.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings. I hope my crew treated you well along the way.

TEXT.English: Greetings, what have you come here to discuss?
TEXT.French: Bienvenue, de quoi êtes-vous venus discuter?
TEXT.German: Greetings, what have you come here to discuss?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, what have you come here to discuss?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, what have you come here to discuss?

TEXT.English: Make it quick; I don't have time for your nonsense.
TEXT.French: Faites vite, je n'ai pas le temps pour vos absurdités.
TEXT.German: Make it quick; I don't have time for your nonsense.
TEXT.Italian: Make it quick; I don't have time for your nonsense.
TEXT.Spanish: Make it quick; I don't have time for your nonsense.

TEXT.English: Oh, great! My new training dummy has arrived. Just stand still...
TEXT.French: Oh, on dirait que mon nouveau mannequin d'entrainement est arrivé. Restez immobile un instant...
TEXT.German: Oh, great! My new training dummy has arrived. Just stand still...
TEXT.Italian: Oh, great! My new training dummy has arrived. Just stand still...
TEXT.Spanish: Oh, great! My new training dummy has arrived. Just stand still...

TEXT.English: What have you brought for me: knowledge or riches?
TEXT.French: Que m'apportez-vous, du savoir ou des richesses?
TEXT.German: What have you brought for me: knowledge or riches?
TEXT.Italian: What have you brought for me: knowledge or riches?
TEXT.Spanish: What have you brought for me: knowledge or riches?

TEXT.English: You certainly have a way with words. It's a deal.
TEXT.French: Vous savez vous y prendre avec les mots. Marché conclu.
TEXT.German: You certainly have a way with words. It's a deal.
TEXT.Italian: You certainly have a way with words. It's a deal.
TEXT.Spanish: You certainly have a way with words. It's a deal.

TEXT.English: Come now, don't insult me. You know I won't accept something as unfair as this.
TEXT.French: Allez, ne m'insultez pas. Vous savez que je n'accepterais pas quelque chose d'aussi inégal.
TEXT.German: Come now, don't insult me. You know I won't accept something as unfair as this.
TEXT.Italian: Come now, don't insult me. You know I won't accept something as unfair as this.
TEXT.Spanish: Come now, don't insult me. You know I won't accept something as unfair as this.

TEXT.English: Just shut up if you can't come up with anything better; even a fool can see how unfair of a deal this is.
TEXT.French: Taisez vous simplement si vous ne pouvez pas trouver quelque chose de mieux, même un imbécile verrait à quel point cette accord est inégal.
TEXT.German: Just shut up if you can't come up with anything better; even a fool can see how unfair of a deal this is.
TEXT.Italian: Just shut up if you can't come up with anything better; even a fool can see how unfair of a deal this is.
TEXT.Spanish: Just shut up if you can't come up with anything better; even a fool can see how unfair of a deal this is.

TEXT.English: Always glad to do business with you.
TEXT.French: C'est toujours un plaisir de faire affaire avec vous.
TEXT.German: Always glad to do business with you.
TEXT.Italian: Always glad to do business with you.
TEXT.Spanish: Always glad to do business with you.

TEXT.English: So, you can use your brain after all. That's good to know.
TEXT.French: Eh bien, vous pouvez parfois utiliser votre cervelle apparemment. C'est bon à savoir.
TEXT.German: So, you can use your brain after all. That's good to know.
TEXT.Italian: So, you can use your brain after all. That's good to know.
TEXT.Spanish: So, you can use your brain after all. That's good to know.

TEXT.English: It's a shame that so many people do not understand what's good for them.
TEXT.French: C'est dommage que tant de gens ne comprennent pas ce qui est bon pour eux.
TEXT.German: It's a shame that so many people do not understand what's good for them.
TEXT.Italian: It's a shame that so many people do not understand what's good for them.
TEXT.Spanish: It's a shame that so many people do not understand what's good for them.

TEXT.English: Why did I even bother? If you're as worthless on the sea as you are at recognizing what's good for you, what I want will soon be mine anyway.
TEXT.French: Pourquoi est-ce que je m'embête? Si vous êtes aussi doués sur les mers que pour reconnaître une bonne affaire, ce que je veux sera bientôt à moi de toutes façons.
TEXT.German: Why did I even bother? If you're as worthless on the sea as you are at recognizing what's good for you, what I want will soon be mine anyway.
TEXT.Italian: Why did I even bother? If you're as worthless on the sea as you are at recognizing what's good for you, what I want will soon be mine anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Why did I even bother? If you're as worthless on the sea as you are at recognizing what's good for you, what I want will soon be mine anyway.

TEXT.English: I get to choose the terms of our deal? Well, I'm certainly not going to complain about it.
TEXT.French: Vous me laissez dicter les termes de notre accord? Eh bien, ce n'est pas moins qui vais m'en plaindre.
TEXT.German: I get to choose the terms of our deal? Well, I'm certainly not going to complain about it.
TEXT.Italian: I get to choose the terms of our deal? Well, I'm certainly not going to complain about it.
TEXT.Spanish: I get to choose the terms of our deal? Well, I'm certainly not going to complain about it.

TEXT.English: I hope for you that, like me, you wouldn't give so much to someone who has so little to offer in return.
TEXT.French: J'espère pour vous que, comme moi, vous ne donneriez pas tant à quelqu'un qui a si peu à offrir en retour.
TEXT.German: I hope for you that, like me, you wouldn't give so much to someone who has so little to offer in return.
TEXT.Italian: I hope for you that, like me, you wouldn't give so much to someone who has so little to offer in return.
TEXT.Spanish: I hope for you that, like me, you wouldn't give so much to someone who has so little to offer in return.

TEXT.English: You really thought I would give that away? What a fool you are.
TEXT.French: Vous pensiez réellement que je vous laisserais cela? Quel idiot vous êtes.
TEXT.German: You really thought I would give that away? What a fool you are.
TEXT.Italian: You really thought I would give that away? What a fool you are.
TEXT.Spanish: You really thought I would give that away? What a fool you are.

TEXT.English: I offer you peace. You should be able to recognize the benefits it brings you, such as not having to go back to your capital soaked in salt water.
TEXT.French: Je vous offre la paix. Vous devriez être capable de reconnaître les bénéfices qu'elle vous apporterait, comme ne pas avoir à rentrer dans votre capitale après un bain involontaire dans l'eau salée.
TEXT.German: I offer you peace. You should be able to recognize the benefits it brings you, such as not having to go back to your capital soaked in salt water.
TEXT.Italian: I offer you peace. You should be able to recognize the benefits it brings you, such as not having to go back to your capital soaked in salt water.
TEXT.Spanish: I offer you peace. You should be able to recognize the benefits it brings you, such as not having to go back to your capital soaked in salt water.

TEXT.English: You are a reasonable being, I know you will recognize how fair and advantageous this offer is for the both of us.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes un être de raison, vous devriez reconnaître à quel point cette offre est équitable et avantageuse pour nous deux.
TEXT.German: You are a reasonable being, I know you will recognize how fair and advantageous this offer is for the both of us.
TEXT.Italian: You are a reasonable being, I know you will recognize how fair and advantageous this offer is for the both of us.
TEXT.Spanish: You are a reasonable being, I know you will recognize how fair and advantageous this offer is for the both of us.

TEXT.English: If you can use your brain for a second or two, you should recognize that this is a fair offer.
TEXT.French: Si vous arrivez à faire preuve d'intelligence quelques instants, vous devriez reconnaître que cette offre est équitable.
TEXT.German: If you can use your brain for a second or two, you should recognize that this is a fair offer.
TEXT.Italian: If you can use your brain for a second or two, you should recognize that this is a fair offer.
TEXT.Spanish: If you can use your brain for a second or two, you should recognize that this is a fair offer.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry, but I can no longer honor this deal. Our situation has changed too much since.
TEXT.French: Je suis désolée, mais je ne peux plus honorer cet accord, notre situation a trop changée depuis.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry, but I can no longer honor this deal. Our situation has changed too much since.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry, but I can no longer honor this deal. Our situation has changed too much since.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry, but I can no longer honor this deal. Our situation has changed too much since.

TEXT.English: It is risky to deal with fools; you never know if they're going to forget their part. That's why I have to cancel this one here.
TEXT.French: C'est risqué de commercer avec des idiots, on ne sait jamais si ils ne vont pas oublier de remplir leur part du marché. C'est quoi je dois annuler celui-ci.
TEXT.German: It is risky to deal with fools; you never know if they're going to forget their part. That's why I have to cancel this one here.
TEXT.Italian: It is risky to deal with fools; you never know if they're going to forget their part. That's why I have to cancel this one here.
TEXT.Spanish: It is risky to deal with fools; you never know if they're going to forget their part. That's why I have to cancel this one here.

TEXT.English: Good, you're a clever one.
TEXT.French: Bien, vous êtes loin d'être stupide.
TEXT.German: Good, you're a clever one.
TEXT.Italian: Good, you're a clever one.
TEXT.Spanish: Good, you're a clever one.

TEXT.English: Yes, I can refresh your memory.
TEXT.French: Oui, je peux vous rafraîchir la mémoire.
TEXT.German: Yes, I can refresh your memory.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, I can refresh your memory.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, I can refresh your memory.

TEXT.English: Sure, you can have this. Be sure to make good use of it.
TEXT.French: Bien sûr, vous pouvez prendre cela. Assurez-vous d'en faire bon usage.
TEXT.German: Sure, you can have this. Be sure to make good use of it.
TEXT.Italian: Sure, you can have this. Be sure to make good use of it.
TEXT.Spanish: Sure, you can have this. Be sure to make good use of it.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry, but no, I still need it.
TEXT.French: Je suis désolée mais c'est non, j'en ai encore besoin.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry, but no, I still need it.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry, but no, I still need it.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry, but no, I still need it.

TEXT.English: Take it. You are surrounded by weak men, it would be easier than you think to convince some of them to bring it back to me.
TEXT.French: Tenez. Vous êtes entouré d'hommes faibles,ce sera plus facile que vous ne le pensez d'en convaincre certains de me ramener cela.
TEXT.German: Take it. You are surrounded by weak men, it would be easier than you think to convince some of them to bring it back to me.
TEXT.Italian: Take it. You are surrounded by weak men, it would be easier than you think to convince some of them to bring it back to me.
TEXT.Spanish: Take it. You are surrounded by weak men, it would be easier than you think to convince some of them to bring it back to me.

TEXT.English: Don't make me laugh, you lack both the eloquence and the presence to be intimidating.
TEXT.French: Ne me faites pas rire, il vous manque à la fois l'éloquence et la prestance pour intimider.
TEXT.German: Don't make me laugh, you lack both the eloquence and the presence to be intimidating.
TEXT.Italian: Don't make me laugh, you lack both the eloquence and the presence to be intimidating.
TEXT.Spanish: Don't make me laugh, you lack both the eloquence and the presence to be intimidating.

TEXT.English: Here, you can have this. I know you will make good use of it.
TEXT.French: Prenez ceci. Je sais que vous en ferez bon usage.
TEXT.German: Here, you can have this. I know you will make good use of it.
TEXT.Italian: Here, you can have this. I know you will make good use of it.
TEXT.Spanish: Here, you can have this. I know you will make good use of it.

TEXT.English: A little help can go a long way to ensure your safety on the seas. What do you think?
TEXT.French: Un peu d'aide peut contribuer grandement à assurer votre sécurité en mer. Qu'en pensez-vous?
TEXT.German: A little help can go a long way to ensure your safety on the seas. What do you think?
TEXT.Italian: A little help can go a long way to ensure your safety on the seas. What do you think?
TEXT.Spanish: A little help can go a long way to ensure your safety on the seas. What do you think?

TEXT.English: It is clear you don't know where your interests lie.
TEXT.French: Il est clair que vous n'avez pas conscience de vos intérêts.
TEXT.German: It is clear you don't know where your interests lie.
TEXT.Italian: It is clear you don't know where your interests lie.
TEXT.Spanish: It is clear you don't know where your interests lie.

TEXT.English: You know, it is hard leading a fleet as large as mine. Sometimes, a crew goes rogue and attacks ships against my orders, failing to distinguish friends from foes.
TEXT.French: Vous savez, c'est difficile de diriger une flotte aussi large que la mienne. Parfois, un équipage peut se rebeller et décider d'attaquer des navires contre mes ordres
TEXT.German: You know, it is hard leading a fleet as large as mine. Sometimes, a crew goes rogue and attacks ships against my orders, failing to distinguish friends from foes.
TEXT.Italian: You know, it is hard leading a fleet as large as mine. Sometimes, a crew goes rogue and attacks ships against my orders, failing to distinguish friends from foes.
TEXT.Spanish: You know, it is hard leading a fleet as large as mine. Sometimes, a crew goes rogue and attacks ships against my orders, failing to distinguish friends from foes.

TEXT.English: I'll let you know that I have a good memory.
TEXT.French: Je vous ferais savoir que j'ai une bonne mémoire.
TEXT.German: I'll let you know that I have a good memory.
TEXT.Italian: I'll let you know that I have a good memory.
TEXT.Spanish: I'll let you know that I have a good memory.

TEXT.English: I offer you an opportunity to invest in the safety of your ships. I advise you to take it.
TEXT.French: Je vous offre une opportunité d'investir dans la sécurité de vos navires. Je vous conseille de la saisir.
TEXT.German: I offer you an opportunity to invest in the safety of your ships. I advise you to take it.
TEXT.Italian: I offer you an opportunity to invest in the safety of your ships. I advise you to take it.
TEXT.Spanish: I offer you an opportunity to invest in the safety of your ships. I advise you to take it.

TEXT.English: Giving up your riches can make you a less interesting target for pirates. Think about it.
TEXT.French: Abandonner vos richesses peut faire de vous une cible moins intéressante pour des pirates. Pensez-y.
TEXT.German: Giving up your riches can make you a less interesting target for pirates. Think about it.
TEXT.Italian: Giving up your riches can make you a less interesting target for pirates. Think about it.
TEXT.Spanish: Giving up your riches can make you a less interesting target for pirates. Think about it.

TEXT.English: The seas can be very dangerous this time of the year. I advise you to put this in safer hands. Like mine.
TEXT.French: Les mers peuvent être très dangereuses en cette période de l'année, je vous conseille de mettre ceci entre des mains plus sûres. Comme les miennes.
TEXT.German: The seas can be very dangerous this time of the year. I advise you to put this in safer hands. Like mine.
TEXT.Italian: The seas can be very dangerous this time of the year. I advise you to put this in safer hands. Like mine.
TEXT.Spanish: The seas can be very dangerous this time of the year. I advise you to put this in safer hands. Like mine.

TEXT.English: It seems that you don't know how to make good use of your riches. Don't worry, this won't be an issue for very long.
TEXT.French: Il semblerait que vous ne sachiez pas faire bon usage de vos richesses. Ne vous en faites pas, ce ne sera pas un problème pour très longtemps, elles seront bientôt à moi.
TEXT.German: It seems that you don't know how to make good use of your riches. Don't worry, this won't be an issue for very long.
TEXT.Italian: It seems that you don't know how to make good use of your riches. Don't worry, this won't be an issue for very long.
TEXT.Spanish: It seems that you don't know how to make good use of your riches. Don't worry, this won't be an issue for very long.

TEXT.English: You have made an unwise decision.
TEXT.French: Vous avez pris une décision peu judicieuse.
TEXT.German: You have made an unwise decision.
TEXT.Italian: You have made an unwise decision.
TEXT.Spanish: You have made an unwise decision.

TEXT.English: I was expecting this. Let's just hope that nothing ends up slipping off one of your ships.
TEXT.French: Je m'y attendais, espérons simplement que cela ne finisse pas par glisser d'un de vos navires.
TEXT.German: I was expecting this. Let's just hope that nothing ends up slipping off one of your ships.
TEXT.Italian: I was expecting this. Let's just hope that nothing ends up slipping off one of your ships.
TEXT.Spanish: I was expecting this. Let's just hope that nothing ends up slipping off one of your ships

TEXT.English: I'd like for you to join me against the %s1:2; the element of surprise could help us plunder their ships even more easily.
TEXT.French: J'aimerais que vous me joignez contre les %s1:2, l'effet de surprise devrait nous aider à piller leurs navires encore plus aisément.
TEXT.German: I'd like for you to join me against the %s1:2; the element of surprise could help us plunder their ships even more easily.
TEXT.Italian: I'd like for you to join me against the %s1:2; the element of surprise could help us plunder their ships even more easily.
TEXT.Spanish: I'd like for you to join me against the %s1:2; the element of surprise could help us plunder their ships even more easily.

TEXT.English: I dare you to face me, cowards. I can prove to you that your faith is wrong. I can prove to you that your philosophy is wrong. I can prove to you that you can have a better life. I can turn your men, your army, your whole family against you. And if all of that isn't enough? I can still pierce through your body with my sword.
TEXT.French: Je vous mets au défi de m'affronter par vous-mêmes, lâches . Je peux vous prouver que votre foi est déplacée . Je peux vous prouver que votre philosophie se trompe. Je peux vous prouver que vous pouvez avoir une meilleure vie. Je peux retourner vos hommes, votre armée, votre famille entière contre vous. Et si ce n'est pas assez? Je peux toujours vous transpercer de mon épée.
TEXT.German: I dare you to face me, cowards. I can prove to you that your faith is wrong. I can prove to you that your philosophy is wrong. I can prove to you that you can have a better life. I can turn your men, your army, your whole family against you. And if all of that isn't enough? I can still pierce through your body with my sword.
TEXT.Italian: I dare you to face me, cowards. I can prove to you that your faith is wrong. I can prove to you that your philosophy is wrong. I can prove to you that you can have a better life. I can turn your men, your army, your whole family against you. And if all of that isn't enough? I can still pierce through your body with my sword.
TEXT.Spanish: I dare you to face me, cowards. I can prove to you that your faith is wrong. I can prove to you that your philosophy is wrong. I can prove to you that you can have a better life. I can turn your men, your army, your whole family against you. And if all of that isn't enough? I can still pierce through your body with my sword.

TEXT.English: You look like a monkey in a negligee.
TEXT.French: Vous ressemblez à un singe qui se néglige.
TEXT.German: Ihr gleicht dem Affen auf dem Schleifstein.
TEXT.Italian: You look like a monkey in a negligee.
TEXT.Spanish: Parecéis un mono en una bata.

TEXT.English: Only a fool would arouse the tempest. And a fool thou art.
TEXT.French: Seul un fou réveillerait l'tempête. Et fou v'l'êtes.
TEXT.German: Nur Narren erwecken den Sturm der Lanun! Und Ihr seid wohl einer.
TEXT.Italian: Only a fool would arouse the tempest. And a fool thou art.
TEXT.Spanish: Sólo un tonto despertaría a la tempestad. Y un tonto es lo que sois.

TEXT.English: The mother ocean calls the Lanun. Keep your feet in the dirt, and we'll get along fine.
TEXT.French: Not'mère l'océan appelle les Lanuns. Gardez vos pieds dans l'boue, et tout ira bien.
TEXT.German: Mutter Ozean gebahr die Lanun. Behaltet Eure Füsse im Dreck, und wir haben ein Auskommen.
TEXT.Italian: The mother ocean calls the Lanun. Keep your feet in the dirt, and we'll get along fine.
TEXT.Spanish: La madre océano llama a los Lanun. Mantened vuestros pies en la tierra, y nos llevaremos bien.

TEXT.English: Aw, ye got your feet wet for nothing. Take a swim.
TEXT.French: Ah, v'v'z'êtes mouillé les pieds p'r rien. R'tournez faire trempette.
TEXT.German: Ach, nun habt Ihr Euch ganz umsonst nasse Füße geholt. Taucht ab.
TEXT.Italian: Aw, ye got your feet wet for nothing. Take a swim.
TEXT.Spanish: Baj, traéis los pies húmedos para nada. Daos un baño.

TEXT.English: Time to return to the sea. My warriors are ill at ease on land for so long.
TEXT.French: L'est temps de r'tourner en mer. M'guerriers sont mal à l'aise d'rester si lontemps sur terre.
TEXT.German: Zeit, wieder in See zu stechen. Meine Krieger fühlen sich an Land langsam unbehaglich.
TEXT.Italian: Time to return to the sea. My warriors are ill at ease on land for so long.
TEXT.Spanish: Es hora de volver al mar. Mis guerreros se ponen malos cuando descansan en tierra tanto tiempo.

TEXT.English: Ye seek to stop the wave from falling? To quell the storm at the peak of its fury? To stay the maw of the kraken once opened?
TEXT.French: V'z'essayez d'stopper l'vague ? D'étouffer la tempête au summum de sa fureur ? D'rester dans l'gueule du kraken après l'avoir ouverte ?
TEXT.German: Diese Welle wollt Ihr stoppen? Den Sturm auf dem Höhepunkt seiner Wut bezwingen? Dem Schlund des Kraken die Stirn bieten, wenn er Euch schon halb verschlungen hat?
TEXT.Italian: Ye seek to stop the wave from falling? To quell the storm at the peak of its fury? To stay the maw of the kraken once opened?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Buscáis parar la ola justo antes de que rompa? ¿Sofocar la tormenta en el apogeo de su furia? ¿Detener las fauces del kraken una vez abiertas?

TEXT.English: I hope you are having a pleasant voyage. The waters around here can be rough on those more accustomed to frog ponds.
TEXT.French: J'espère que vous faites bon voyage. Les eaux environnantes peuvent être rudes pour ceux qui sont plus accoutumés aux mares aux canards.
TEXT.German: Hattet Ihr eine angenehme Reise? Die See hier kann sehr rauh mit jenen umgehen, die das Umherschippern in Froschtümpeln gewohnt sind.
TEXT.Italian: I hope you are having a pleasant voyage. The waters around here can be rough on those more accustomed to frog ponds.
TEXT.Spanish: Espero que estéis teniendo un viaje agradable. Las aguas de por aquí pueden parecer revueltas para aquellos acostumbrados a los charcos.

TEXT.English: Ye're on the wrong side of the Kraken of Fields.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes du mauvais côté du territoire des Krakens.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid auf der falschen Seite des Kraken der Felder.
TEXT.Italian: Ye're on the wrong side of the Kraken of Fields.
TEXT.Spanish: Estáis en el lado incorrecto de los Dominios del Kraken.

TEXT.English: The seas are ever hungry-but my people are satisfied with this... for now.
TEXT.French: Les mers sont toujours affamées, mais mon peuple s'satisfait d'ça... pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: Das Meer ist unersättlich. Aber mein Volk ist zufrieden... für den Moment.
TEXT.Italian: The seas are ever hungry-but my people are satisfied with this... for now.
TEXT.Spanish: El mar siempre está hambriento, pero mi pueblo está satisfecho con esto... de momento.

TEXT.English: The restless void fills me with hunger. Your presumption fills me with anger. Not a good combination for you
TEXT.French: Le vide turbulent nourrit m'faim. Vot'arrogance nourrit m'colère. Pas une bonn' comb'naison pour vous.
TEXT.German: Die unruhige Leere macht mich hungrig. Eure Anmaßung macht mich ärgerlich. Das ist keine angenehme Kombination für Euch.
TEXT.Italian: The restless void fills me with hunger. Your presumption fills me with anger. Not a good combination for you
TEXT.Spanish: El vacío agitado alimenta mi odio. Tu presunción alimenta mi ira. No es una buena combinación para vos...

TEXT.English: Hmmph. Not going to cut it, but I'll give ye credit for trying.
TEXT.French: Hmmph. Ca n'va pas, mais j'vous accorde le crédit d'avoir essayé.
TEXT.German: Hmmpf. Ich werde das nicht annehmen, aber Ihr bekommt meine Anerkennung für den Versuch.
TEXT.Italian: Hmmph. Not going to cut it, but I'll give ye credit for trying.
TEXT.Spanish: Hmmph. No me lo trago, pero os doy crédito por intentarlo.

TEXT.English: Ye wish to insult me? Truly? Pray ye have power to match your guts.
TEXT.French: V'voulez m'insulter ? Vraiment ? Priez de p'voir r'ssembler vos tripes.
TEXT.German: Ihr wollt uns kränken? Wahrhaftig? Betet, dass Eure Macht ebenso groß ist wie Euer Mut.
TEXT.Italian: Ye wish to insult me? Truly? Pray ye have power to match your guts.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Queréis insultarme? ¿De verdad? Rezad para que tengáis poder para ensamblar vuestras tripas.

TEXT.English: The seas have calmed, and so should we.
TEXT.French: La mer s'est calmée, et nous de même.
TEXT.German: Die rauhe See hat sich beruhigt, und wir mit ihr.
TEXT.Italian: The seas have calmed, and so should we.
TEXT.Spanish: Los mares se han calmado, y nosotros deberíamos hacerlo también.

TEXT.English: Well, we are grateful for a safe port, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Bien, nous v'sommes reconnaissants pour un port sûr, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Nun, wir sind dankbar für diesen sicheren Hafen, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: Well, we are grateful for a safe port, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Bien, estamos agradecidos por un puerto seguro, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: A storm brews on the waters, dark and inescapable. Perhaps ye could postpone the monsoon?
TEXT.French: Une tempête s'prépare en mer, sombre et inéluctable. P'tet vous pourriez repousser la mousson ?
TEXT.German: Ein Sturm braut sich auf den Meeren zusammen, dunkel und unentrinnbar. Vielleicht könnt Ihr den Monsun abwenden?
TEXT.Italian: A storm brews on the waters, dark and inescapable. Perhaps ye could postpone the monsoon?
TEXT.Spanish: Una tormenta se prepara en las aguas, oscura e ineludible. ¿Quizás podríais posponer el monzón?

TEXT.English: A little tribute will keep our ships in other waters, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Un petit tribut gard'ra n'navires dans d'autres eaux, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Ein geringer Tribut ließe unsere Schiffe in ferneren Gewässern segeln, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: A little tribute will keep our ships in other waters, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Un pequeño tributo mantendrá nuestras naves en otras aguas, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: [CT_NAME], surely it is better to have the Lanun a strong friend than a desperate enemy?
TEXT.French: [CT_NAME], il est sûrement mieux d'voir dans les Lanuns un ami fort plutôt qu'un ennemi désespéré?
TEXT.German: [CT_NAME], es ist sicher besser, die Lanun als starken Freund zu haben, denn als verzweifelten Feind?
TEXT.Italian: [CT_NAME], surely it is better to have the Lanun a strong friend than a desperate enemy?
TEXT.Spanish: [CT_NAME], seguro que es mejor tener a Lanun como un amigo fuerte que como un enemigo desesperado, ¿verdad?

TEXT.English: So like a man to shout defiance into the face of the tempest. Prepare for the tempest to respond.
TEXT.French: Tel un homme défiant l'tempête. Attendez-vous à ce que l'tempête y r'ponde.
TEXT.German: Jeder, der den Sturm herausfordert, sollte sich auf dessen Antwort gefasst machen.
TEXT.Italian: So like a man to shout defiance into the face of the tempest. Prepare for the tempest to respond.
TEXT.Spanish: Como un hombre que grita desafiante en la cara de la tempestad. Preparáos para la respuesta de la tempestad.

TEXT.English: "So, the Kraken of the Fields is destroyed? It matters not. Mother Ocean will consume you all."
TEXT.French: "Ainsi le Kraken des Abysses a été détruit ? Peu importe. La Mère Océan vous dévorera tous."
TEXT.German: "Also, der Kraken der Felder ist zerstört? Es ist nicht wichtig. Mutter Ozean wird euch alle verzehren."
TEXT.Italian: "So, the Kraken of the Fields is destroyed? It matters not. Mother Ocean will consume you all."
TEXT.Spanish: "So, the Kraken of the Fields is destroyed? It matters not. Mother Ocean will consume you all."

TEXT.English: I hope you and your men will reflect on your actions once we have sent your ships on the bottom of the ocean.
TEXT.French: J'espère que vous et vos hommes réfléchirons à ce que vous avez fait une fois que nous aurons envoyé vos navires au fond des océans.
TEXT.German: I hope you and your men will reflect on your actions once we have sent your ships on the bottom of the ocean.
TEXT.Italian: I hope you and your men will reflect on your actions once we have sent your ships on the bottom of the ocean.
TEXT.Spanish: I hope you and your men will reflect on your actions once we have sent your ships on the bottom of the ocean.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry friend, but we're ready to sail the seas on our own again.
TEXT.French: Je suis désolé, mais nous sommes prêts à de nouveau naviguer sur les mers par nous même.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry friend, but we're ready to sail the seas on our own again.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry friend, but we're ready to sail the seas on our own again.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry friend, but we're ready to sail the seas on our own again.

TEXT.English: Our fleet is badly damaged. Care to provide a bit of space in your ports while we repair our ships?
TEXT.French: Notre flotte est très endommagée. Pourriez-vous nous faire un peu d'espace dans vos ports le temps que nous réparions nos navires?
TEXT.German: Our fleet is badly damaged. Care to provide a bit of space in your ports while we repair our ships?
TEXT.Italian: Our fleet is badly damaged. Care to provide a bit of space in your ports while we repair our ships?
TEXT.Spanish: Our fleet is badly damaged. Care to provide a bit of space in your ports while we repair our ships?

TEXT.English: Welcome on board, friend, I'm captain Mordmorgan. If you think of the high seas as lawless, our next meeting will surely prove you wrong. Otherwise, your merchants will probably be happy to bask in the safety our fleet brings to the waves.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue à bord, je suis le capitaine Mordmorgan. Si vous pensez qu'aucune loi ne s'applique en haute mer, notre prochaine rencontre vous prouvera sûrement le contraire. Autrement, vos marchants seront probablement heureux de profiter de la sécurité apportée par notre flotte sur les mers.
TEXT.German: Welcome on board, friend, I'm captain Mordmorgan. If you think of the high seas as lawless, our next meeting will surely prove you wrong. Otherwise, your merchants will probably be happy to bask in the safety our fleet brings to the waves.
TEXT.Italian: Welcome on board, friend, I'm captain Mordmorgan. If you think of the high seas as lawless, our next meeting will surely prove you wrong. Otherwise, your merchants will probably be happy to bask in the safety our fleet brings to the waves.
TEXT.Spanish: Welcome on board, friend, I'm captain Mordmorgan. If you think of the high seas as lawless, our next meeting will surely prove you wrong. Otherwise, your merchants will probably be happy to bask in the safety our fleet brings to the waves.

TEXT.English: Swear off your life of crime, and maybe we will have something to talk about.
TEXT.French: Renoncez à votre vie criminelle, et peut-être que nous aurons plus à nous dire.
TEXT.German: Swear off your life of crime, and maybe we will have something to talk about.
TEXT.Italian: Swear off your life of crime, and maybe we will have something to talk about.
TEXT.Spanish: Swear off your life of crime, and maybe we will have something to talk about.

TEXT.English: That will do for now. But bear in mind that the next time I catch you, I won't be so lenient.
TEXT.French: Cela devrait faire l'affaire pour l'instant. Mais gardez en tête que la prochaine fois que je vous attrape, je ne serais pas aussi indulgent.
TEXT.German: That will do for now. But bear in mind that the next time I catch you, I won't be so lenient.
TEXT.Italian: That will do for now. But bear in mind that the next time I catch you, I won't be so lenient.
TEXT.Spanish: That will do for now. But bear in mind that the next time I catch you, I won't be so lenient.
