TEXT.English: Already? Do not think you can fool me by simply walking by and and telling me that you are gonna stop your plundering without an ounce of sincerity.
TEXT.French: Déjà? Ne croyez donc pas que vous pouvez me tromper simplement en venant me voir et m'annoncer que vous allez arrêter vos pillages sans la moindre once de sincérité.
TEXT.German: Already? Do not think you can fool me by simply walking by and and telling me that you are gonna stop your plundering without an ounce of sincerity.
TEXT.Italian: Already? Do not think you can fool me by simply walking by and and telling me that you are gonna stop your plundering without an ounce of sincerity.
TEXT.Spanish: Already? Do not think you can fool me by simply walking by and and telling me that you are gonna stop your plundering without an ounce of sincerity.

TEXT.English: Greetings, friend. Care for some rhum?
TEXT.French: La bienvenue à vous. Vous voulez un peu de rhum?
TEXT.German: Greetings, friend. Care for some rhum?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, friend. Care for some rhum?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, friend. Care for some rhum?

TEXT.English: Greetings, friend. To what do we owe the pleasure?
TEXT.French: La bienvenue à vous. Qu'est-ce qui nous vaut le plaisir?
TEXT.German: Greetings, friend. To what do we owe the pleasure?
TEXT.Italian: Greetings, friend. To what do we owe the pleasure?
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings, friend. To what do we owe the pleasure?

TEXT.English: Greetings. I trust your ships have been keeping to themselves until now.
TEXT.French: Bienvenue. J'espère que vos navires se gardent de toute offense jusqu'ici.
TEXT.German: Greetings. I trust your ships have been keeping to themselves until now.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings. I trust your ships have been keeping to themselves until now.
TEXT.Spanish: Greetings. I trust your ships have been keeping to themselves until now.

TEXT.English: I hope you remember that any criminal activity on the seas will be met with retribution.
TEXT.French: J'espère que vous vous souvenez que toute activité criminelle en mer sera punie.
TEXT.German: I hope you remember that any criminal activity on the seas will be met with retribution.
TEXT.Italian: I hope you remember that any criminal activity on the seas will be met with retribution.
TEXT.Spanish: I hope you remember that any criminal activity on the seas will be met with retribution.

TEXT.English: I don't trust you, but I trust my men will be ready to handle you when we inevitably catch you on the seas.
TEXT.French: Je ne vous fais pas confiance, par contre je fais confiance à la capacité de mes hommes à s'occuper de vous lorsque nous vous attraperons inévitablement en mer.
TEXT.German: I don't trust you, but I trust my men will be ready to handle you when we inevitably catch you on the seas.
TEXT.Italian: I don't trust you, but I trust my men will be ready to handle you when we inevitably catch you on the seas.
TEXT.Spanish: I don't trust you, but I trust my men will be ready to handle you when we inevitably catch you on the seas.

TEXT.English: Let's see if I can still make use of my old bargaining skills.
TEXT.French: Voyons si mes talents dans la négoce n'ont pas rouillé.
TEXT.German: Let's see if I can still make use of my old bargaining skills.
TEXT.Italian: Let's see if I can still make use of my old bargaining skills.
TEXT.Spanish: Let's see if I can still make use of my old bargaining skills.

TEXT.English: Well, you drive a hard bargain, but we can still benefit from that.
TEXT.French: Eh bien, vous êtes dur en affaire, mais nous devrions quand même y gagner.
TEXT.German: Well, you drive a hard bargain, but we can still benefit from that.
TEXT.Italian: Well, you drive a hard bargain, but we can still benefit from that.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, you drive a hard bargain, but we can still benefit from that.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry friend, this looks like a net loss for us.
TEXT.French: Désolé, mais on a l'air d'être perdants dans l'affaire.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry friend, this looks like a net loss for us.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry friend, this looks like a net loss for us.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry friend, this looks like a net loss for us.

TEXT.English: I'm used to swindlers more skilled than you are.
TEXT.French: J'ai connu des escrocs plus doués que vous.
TEXT.German: I'm used to swindlers more skilled than you are.
TEXT.Italian: I'm used to swindlers more skilled than you are.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm used to swindlers more skilled than you are.

TEXT.English: Thank you friend, I'm certain that this will benefit us both.
TEXT.French: Merci, je suis certain que cela nous bénéficiera à chacun.
TEXT.German: Thank you friend, I'm certain that this will benefit us both.
TEXT.Italian: Thank you friend, I'm certain that this will benefit us both.
TEXT.Spanish: Thank you friend, I'm certain that this will benefit us both.

TEXT.English: See? Everyone can benefit from unhindered trade, even you.
TEXT.French: Vous voyez? Tout le monde peut y gagner à ce que le commerce se déroule sans problèmes, même vous.
TEXT.German: See? Everyone can benefit from unhindered trade, even you.
TEXT.Italian: See? Everyone can benefit from unhindered trade, even you.
TEXT.Spanish: See? Everyone can benefit from unhindered trade, even you.

TEXT.English: Well, looks like my bargaining skills have become a bit rusty.
TEXT.French: Eh bien, on dirait que mes talents en négoce ont un peu rouillé.
TEXT.German: Well, looks like my bargaining skills have become a bit rusty.
TEXT.Italian: Well, looks like my bargaining skills have become a bit rusty.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, looks like my bargaining skills have become a bit rusty.

TEXT.English: Bah, how could someone used to stealing from others could recognize a fair agreement when they're presented one?
TEXT.French: Pff, comment quelqu'un qui a l'habitude de simplement voler aux autres pourrait reconnaître un accord équitable quand on lui en présente un?
TEXT.German: Bah, how could someone used to stealing from others could recognize a fair agreement when they're presented one?
TEXT.Italian: Bah, how could someone used to stealing from others could recognize a fair agreement when they're presented one?
TEXT.Spanish: Bah, how could someone used to stealing from others could recognize a fair agreement when they're presented one?

TEXT.English: Back in the day, I would have considered this a fair offer.
TEXT.French: J'aurais considéré ceci comme une offre équitable à une époque.
TEXT.German: Back in the day, I would have considered this a fair offer.
TEXT.Italian: Back in the day, I would have considered this a fair offer.
TEXT.Spanish: Back in the day, I would have considered this a fair offer.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry friend, but this is too much for what you have to offer.
TEXT.French: Désolé, mais c'est trop demandé par rapport à ce que vous pouvez donner en échange.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry friend, but this is too much for what you have to offer.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry friend, but this is too much for what you have to offer.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry friend, but this is too much for what you have to offer.

TEXT.English: You would know that a fair agreement is impossible here if you were more used to peaceful trading and less to piracy.
TEXT.French: Vous sauriez qu'un accord équitable est impossible si vous étiez plus habitué au commerce pacifique et moins à la piraterie.
TEXT.German: You would know that a fair agreement is impossible here if you were more used to peaceful trading and less to piracy.
TEXT.Italian: You would know that a fair agreement is impossible here if you were more used to peaceful trading and less to piracy.
TEXT.Spanish: You would know that a fair agreement is impossible here if you were more used to peaceful trading and less to piracy.

TEXT.English: Do you swear to abandon your current life of piracy and to commit to penance?
TEXT.French: Jurez vous d'abandonner votre vie de piraterie et de faire pénitence?
TEXT.German: Do you swear to abandon your current life of piracy and to commit to penance?
TEXT.Italian: Do you swear to abandon your current life of piracy and to commit to penance?
TEXT.Spanish: Do you swear to abandon your current life of piracy and to commit to penance?

TEXT.English: These people are in need of your protection. Do you swear to protect them from pirates and raiders?
TEXT.French: Ces gens ont besoin de votre protection. Jurez vous de les protéger des pirates et des pillards?
TEXT.German: These people are in need of your protection. Do you swear to protect them from pirates and raiders?
TEXT.Italian: These people are in need of your protection. Do you swear to protect them from pirates and raiders?
TEXT.Spanish: These people are in need of your protection. Do you swear to protect them from pirates and raiders?

TEXT.English: I think this trade agreement should benefit both of us. What do you say?
TEXT.French: Je pense que cet accord commercial nous bénéficierais à tous les deux. Qu'en pensez vous?
TEXT.German: I think this trade agreement should benefit both of us. What do you say?
TEXT.Italian: I think this trade agreement should benefit both of us. What do you say?
TEXT.Spanish: I think this trade agreement should benefit both of us. What do you say?

TEXT.English: I know you are more used to unscrupulous raiding, but perhaps you still have enough common sense to recognize that you could actually benefit from this.
TEXT.French: Je sais que vous avez plutôt l'habitude de piller sans scrupules, mais peut-être que vous avez encore assez de bon sens pour reconnaître que pourriez tirer bénéfice de ceci.
TEXT.German: I know you are more used to unscrupulous raiding, but perhaps you still have enough common sense to recognize that you could actually benefit from this.
TEXT.Italian: I know you are more used to unscrupulous raiding, but perhaps you still have enough common sense to recognize that you could actually benefit from this.
TEXT.Spanish: I know you are more used to unscrupulous raiding, but perhaps you still have enough common sense to recognize that you could actually benefit from this.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry friend, but I have to put this agreement on hold for now.
TEXT.French: Je suis désolé, mais je dois suspendre cet accord pour le moment.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry friend, but I have to put this agreement on hold for now.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry friend, but I have to put this agreement on hold for now.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry friend, but I have to put this agreement on hold for now.

TEXT.English: I can't trust my ships to return with the promised goods as long as you continue your plundering. I'll have to put an end to this agreement for now.
TEXT.French: Tant que vous continuerez vos pillages, je craindrais toujours de ne pas voir revenir mes navires avec votre part du marché. Je vais devoir mettre fin à cet accord pour le moment.
TEXT.German: I can't trust my ships to return with the promised goods as long as you continue your plundering. I'll have to put an end to this agreement for now.
TEXT.Italian: I can't trust my ships to return with the promised goods as long as you continue your plundering. I'll have to put an end to this agreement for now.
TEXT.Spanish: I can't trust my ships to return with the promised goods as long as you continue your plundering. I'll have to put an end to this agreement for now.

TEXT.English: My thanks to you.
TEXT.French: Je vous remercie.
TEXT.German: My thanks to you.
TEXT.Italian: My thanks to you.
TEXT.Spanish: My thanks to you.

TEXT.English: Here are the trade agreements we have signed so far.
TEXT.French: Voici les accords commerciaux que nous avons signé jusqu'ici.
TEXT.German: Here are the trade agreements we have signed so far.
TEXT.Italian: Here are the trade agreements we have signed so far.
TEXT.Spanish: Here are the trade agreements we have signed so far.

TEXT.English: I can certainly spare this for you, friend.
TEXT.French: Je peux certainement vous fournir ceci.
TEXT.German: I can certainly spare this for you, friend.
TEXT.Italian: I can certainly spare this for you, friend.
TEXT.Spanish: I can certainly spare this for you, friend.

TEXT.English: I'm sorry friend, but this is simply too much for me to hand you without anything in return.
TEXT.French: Je suis désolée, mais c'est simplement bien plus que ce que je peux vous donner sans rien en retour.
TEXT.German: I'm sorry friend, but this is simply too much for me to hand you without anything in return.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sorry friend, but this is simply too much for me to hand you without anything in return.
TEXT.Spanish: I'm sorry friend, but this is simply too much for me to hand you without anything in return.

TEXT.English: You catched us by surprise this time. I advise you to stop now, as the next ship you'll try to plunder may be the last for you.
TEXT.French: Vous nous avez eu par surprise cette fois-ci. Je vous conseille de vous arrêtez maintenant, le prochaine navire que vous essayerez de piller pourrait être le dernier pour vous.
TEXT.German: You catched us by surprise this time. I advise you to stop now, as the next ship you'll try to plunder may be the last for you.
TEXT.Italian: You catched us by surprise this time. I advise you to stop now, as the next ship you'll try to plunder may be the last for you.
TEXT.Spanish: You catched us by surprise this time. I advise you to stop now, as the next ship you'll try to plunder may be the last for you.

TEXT.English: I've ended the activites of pirates more fearsome than you are. I am not afraid of you.
TEXT.French: J'ai mis fin aux activités de pirates plus terrifiants que vous. Je n'ai pas peur de vous.
TEXT.German: I've ended the activites of pirates more fearsome than you are. I am not afraid of you.
TEXT.Italian: I've ended the activites of pirates more fearsome than you are. I am not afraid of you.
TEXT.Spanish: I've ended the activites of pirates more fearsome than you are. I am not afraid of you.

TEXT.English: Take this friend, along with a bottle of rhum.
TEXT.French: Tenez, prenez ceci, ainsi qu'une bouteille de rhum.
TEXT.German: Take this friend, along with a bottle of rhum.
TEXT.Italian: Take this friend, along with a bottle of rhum.
TEXT.Spanish: Take this friend, along with a bottle of rhum.

TEXT.English: We've been hard at work keeping the seas clean from pirates, but it has been a very demanding task these last few months. Could you perhaps help us by sparing this for us?
TEXT.French: Nous avons travaillé dur pour bouter les pirates hors des mers, mais cette tâche s'est avérée assez difficile ces derniers mois. Pourriez vous peut-être nous aider en nous donnant ceci?
TEXT.German: We've been hard at work keeping the seas clean from pirates, but it has been a very demanding task these last few months. Could you perhaps help us by sparing this for us?
TEXT.Italian: We've been hard at work keeping the seas clean from pirates, but it has been a very demanding task these last few months. Could you perhaps help us by sparing this for us?
TEXT.Spanish: We've been hard at work keeping the seas clean from pirates, but it has been a very demanding task these last few months. Could you perhaps help us by sparing this for us?

TEXT.English: That's too bad, your trade activities on the seas have been lacking protection recently, and without us they may suffer from it.
TEXT.French: C'est dommage, vos activités commerciales maritimes manquaient cruellement de protection ces derniers temps, and sans nous elles risquent d'en souffrir.
TEXT.German: That's too bad, your trade activities on the seas have been lacking protection recently, and without us they may suffer from it.
TEXT.Italian: That's too bad, your trade activities on the seas have been lacking protection recently, and without us they may suffer from it.
TEXT.Spanish: That's too bad, your trade activities on the seas have been lacking protection recently, and without us they may suffer from it.

TEXT.English: That's too bad, we'll see what we can do but we fear that an upsurge in pirate activity may happen sooner rather than later.
TEXT.French: C'est dommage, nous verrons ce que l'on peut faire, mais nous craignons une activité pirate accrue prochainement.
TEXT.German: That's too bad, we'll see what we can do but we fear that an upsurge in pirate activity may happen sooner rather than later.
TEXT.Italian: That's too bad, we'll see what we can do but we fear that an upsurge in pirate activity may happen sooner rather than later.
TEXT.Spanish: That's too bad, we'll see what we can do but we fear that an upsurge in pirate activity may happen sooner rather than later.

TEXT.English: I know that you ships have never been lacking protection, friend, but I can't say the same about many of your trading partners. Bear in mind that they benefit from our efforts.
TEXT.French: Je sais que vos navires n'ont jamais manqué de protection, mais je ne peux pas en dire autant de certains de vos partenaires commerciaux. Gardez en tête qu'ils bénéficient de nos efforts.
TEXT.German: I know that you ships have never been lacking protection, friend, but I can't say the same about many of your trading partners. Bear in mind that they benefit from our efforts.
TEXT.Italian: I know that you ships have never been lacking protection, friend, but I can't say the same about many of your trading partners. Bear in mind that they benefit from our efforts.
TEXT.Spanish: I know that you ships have never been lacking protection, friend, but I can't say the same about many of your trading partners. Bear in mind that they benefit from our efforts.

TEXT.English: We know that you have been raiding unprotected merchant vessels recently. I advise you to hand over the goods you have stolen, before we send you and your men back to your lands swimming.
TEXT.French: Nous savons que vous avez pillé des navires marchants sans protection récemment. Je vous conseille de nous laisser tous les biens que vous avez volé, avant que vous et vos hommes n'ayez à rentrer chez vous à la nage.
TEXT.German: We know that you have been raiding unprotected merchant vessels recently. I advise you to hand over the goods you have stolen, before we send you and your men back to your lands swimming.
TEXT.Italian: We know that you have been raiding unprotected merchant vessels recently. I advise you to hand over the goods you have stolen, before we send you and your men back to your lands swimming.
TEXT.Spanish: We know that you have been raiding unprotected merchant vessels recently. I advise you to hand over the goods you have stolen, before we send you and your men back to your lands swimming.

TEXT.English: Many merchants have been complaining about your raids. I advise you to hand over any stolen goods.
TEXT.French: Plusieurs marchants se sont plaints de vos pillages. Je vous conseille de nous laisser tous les biens que vous avez volé.
TEXT.German: Many merchants have been complaining about your raids. I advise you to hand over any stolen goods.
TEXT.Italian: Many merchants have been complaining about your raids. I advise you to hand over any stolen goods.
TEXT.Spanish: Many merchants have been complaining about your raids. I advise you to hand over any stolen goods.

TEXT.English: Many are growing suspicious of you. if you have any stolen goods, I advise you to hand them over now.
TEXT.French: Beaucoup deviennent suspicieux de vous. Si vous avez volé des biens, je vous conseille de nous les laisser maintenant.
TEXT.German: Many are growing suspicious of you. if you have any stolen goods, I advise you to hand them over now.
TEXT.Italian: Many are growing suspicious of you. if you have any stolen goods, I advise you to hand them over now.
TEXT.Spanish: Many are growing suspicious of you. if you have any stolen goods, I advise you to hand them over now.

TEXT.English: You won't keep what you have stolen for very long. No piracy goes unpunished on my watch.
TEXT.French: Vous ne garderez pas ce que vous avez volé très longtemps. La piraterie ne reste pas longtemps impunie sous ma surveillance.
TEXT.German: You won't keep what you have stolen for very long. No piracy goes unpunished on my watch.
TEXT.Italian: You won't keep what you have stolen for very long. No piracy goes unpunished on my watch.
TEXT.Spanish: You won't keep what you have stolen for very long. No piracy goes unpunished on my watch.

TEXT.English: No matter, if you continue your criminal activities on the sea, know that we will inevitably catch you.
TEXT.French: Peu importe, si vous continuez vos activités criminelles, sachez que nous vous attraperons inévitablement.
TEXT.German: No matter, if you continue your criminal activities on the sea, know that we will inevitably catch you.
TEXT.Italian: No matter, if you continue your criminal activities on the sea, know that we will inevitably catch you.
TEXT.Spanish: No matter, if you continue your criminala activities on the sea, know that we will inevitably catch you.

TEXT.English: I hope for you that these rumors are not true. In any case, I have my eyes on you.
TEXT.French: J'espère pour vous que ces rumeurs sont infondées. Dans tous les cas, je vous garde tout de même à l'oeil.
TEXT.German: I hope for you that these rumors are not true. In any case, I have my eyes on you.
TEXT.Italian: I hope for you that these rumors are not true. In any case, I have my eyes on you.
TEXT.Spanish: I hope for you that these rumors are not true. In any case, I have my eyes on you.

TEXT.English: The %s1:2 have been plundering the seas for too long, I ask you to help us put an end to their raids.
TEXT.French: Les %s1:2 s'adonnent au pillage sur les mers depuis trop longtemps, je vous prie de nous aider à mettre fin à leurs raids.
TEXT.German: The %s1:2 have been plundering the seas for too long, I ask you to help us put an end to their raids.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1:2 have been plundering the seas for too long, I ask you to help us put an end to their raids.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1:2 have been plundering the seas for too long, I ask you to help us put an end to their raids.

TEXT.English: So, this is how it ends? So be it, I simply hope that those I could get out of piracy won't return to their old ways, and that the remaining thieves on the seas will recognize the error of their ways, or be sent to the bottom of the sea by a prey too big for them.
TEXT.French: Alors, c'est comme ça que ça se termine? Soit, j'espère simplement que ceux que j'ai pu sortir de la piraterie n'y retourneront pas, et que les voleurs restants sur les mers se rendront compte de leurs erreurs, ou seront envoyés au fond de l'eau par une proie trop grosse pour eux.
TEXT.German: So, this is how it ends? So be it, I simply hope that those I could get out of piracy won't return to their old ways, and that the remaining thieves on the seas will recognize the error of their ways, or be sent to the bottom of the sea by a prey too big for them.
TEXT.Italian: So, this is how it ends? So be it, I simply hope that those I could get out of piracy won't return to their old ways, and that the remaining thieves on the seas will recognize the error of their ways, or be sent to the bottom of the sea by a prey too big for them.
TEXT.Spanish: So, this is how it ends? So be it, I simply hope that those I could get out of piracy won't return to their old ways, and that the remaining thieves on the seas will recognize the error of their ways, or be sent to the bottom of the sea by a prey too big for them.

TEXT.English: I gave ye a choice, ye be the one who chose the hard way. Now my ships will soon be able to cross yer whole empire as I turn yer lands into seas of blood.
TEXT.French: J't'ai donné le choix, c'toi qui as choisi la manière dure. Maintenant mes navires pourront bientôt traverser l'intégralité d'ton empire à mesure que j'transforme tes terres en mers de sang.
TEXT.German: I gave ye a choice, ye be the one who chose the hard way. Now my ships will soon be able to cross yer whole empire as I turn yer lands into seas of blood.
TEXT.Italian: I gave ye a choice, ye be the one who chose the hard way. Now my ships will soon be able to cross yer whole empire as I turn yer lands into seas of blood.
TEXT.Spanish: I gave ye a choice, ye be the one who chose the hard way. Now my ships will soon be able to cross yer whole empire as I turn yer lands into seas of blood.

TEXT.English: Me ships are ready to take to the seas again. Don't think ye'll be spared.
TEXT.French: Mes navires sont prêts à reprendre la mer. Crois pas que j'vais t'épargner pour autant.
TEXT.German: Me ships are ready to take to the seas again. Don't think ye'll be spared.
TEXT.Italian: Me ships are ready to take to the seas again. Don't think ye'll be spared.
TEXT.Spanish: Me ships are ready to take to the seas again. Don't think ye'll be spared.

TEXT.English: Me ships need to dock for the time being. Take us in yer ports, and ye'll be spared for now.
TEXT.French: Mes navires ont besoin d'accoster un moment. Laissez nous d'la place dans vos ports, et vous s'rez épargnés pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: Me ships need to dock for the time being. Take us in yer ports, and ye'll be spared for now.
TEXT.Italian: Me ships need to dock for the time being. Take us in yer ports, and ye'll be spared for now.
TEXT.Spanish: Me ships need to dock for the time being. Take us in yer ports, and ye'll be spared for now.

TEXT.English: Ye be welcome to my ship! I trust ye heard the legend of Blackheart, it be all true: leave us yer shores and yer gold, or we'll also take the lives of every man, woman, and child we find along the way.
TEXT.French: Bienv'nue sur mon navire! J'imagine que t'as entendu parlé de la légende de Blackheart, tout est vrai : laisse nous tes rivages et ton or, ou on prendra également les vies des hommes, femmes et enfants qu'on trouvera sur l'chemin.
TEXT.German: Ye be welcome to my ship! I trust ye heard the legend of Blackheart, it be all true : leave us yer shores and yer gold, or we'll also take the lives of every man, woman and child we find along the way.
TEXT.Italian: Ye be welcome to my ship! I trust ye heard the legend of Blackheart, it be all true : leave us yer shores and yer gold, or we'll also take the lives of every man, woman and child we find along the way.
TEXT.Spanish: Ye be welcome to my ship! I trust ye heard the legend of Blackheart, it be all true : leave us yer shores and yer gold, or we'll also take the lives of every man, woman and child we find along the way.

TEXT.English: Leave me ship before I feed ye to me kraken!
TEXT.French: Pars de ton navire avant que j'te donne à manger à mon kraken!
TEXT.German: Leave me ship before I feed ye to me kraken!
TEXT.Italian: Leave me ship before I feed ye to me kraken!
TEXT.Spanish: Leave me ship before I feed ye to me kraken!

TEXT.English: We can end our bloodshed for now, but don't think we'll be far from yer shores.
TEXT.French: On peut mettre fin à c'bain d'sang pour l'instant, mais crois pas qu'on sera loin d'tes rivages.
TEXT.German: We can end our bloodshed for now, but don't think we'll be far from yer shores.
TEXT.Italian: We can end our bloodshed for now, but don't think we'll be far from yer shores.
TEXT.Spanish: We can end our bloodshed for now, but don't think we'll be far from yer shores.

TEXT.English: If ye wanted me to spare the lives of yer people, it be too late, but I'll still take the gold.
TEXT.French: Si tu voulais que j'épargne la vie de tes gens, c'est trop tard, mais je prend quand même l'or.
TEXT.German: If ye wanted me to spare the lives of yer people, it be too late, but I'll still take the gold.
TEXT.Italian: If ye wanted me to spare the lives of yer people, it be too late, but I'll still take the gold.
TEXT.Spanish: If ye wanted me to spare the lives of yer people, it be too late, but I'll still take the gold.

TEXT.English: I don't have a lot to feed me kraken with because of ye, but I appreciate quickly delivered coffers. What do ye want?
TEXT.French: C'pas avec toi que j'ai beaucoup d'quoi nourrir mon kraken, mais j'apprécie les coffres qui arrivent vite. Qu'est-ce que tu veux?
TEXT.German: I don't have a lot to feed me kraken with because of ye, but I appreciate quickly delivered coffers. What do ye want?
TEXT.Italian: I don't have a lot to feed me kraken with because of ye, but I appreciate quickly delivered coffers. What do ye want?
TEXT.Spanish: I don't have a lot to feed me kraken with because of ye, but I appreciate quickly delivered coffers. What do ye want?

TEXT.English: Ye be reasonable, I can appreciate that. What are ye here for?
TEXT.French: T'es raisonnable, j'apprécie ça. Qu'est-ce qui m'vaut ta présence?
TEXT.German: Ye be reasonable, I can appreciate that. What are ye here for?
TEXT.Italian: Ye be reasonable, I can appreciate that. What are ye here for?
TEXT.Spanish: Ye be reasonable, I can appreciate that. What are ye here for?

TEXT.English: What are ye here for? Are ye here to surrender yer riches?
TEXT.French: Qu'est-ce qui m'vaut ta présence? T'es là pour nous r'mettre vos richesses?
TEXT.German: What are ye here for? Are ye here to surrender yer riches?
TEXT.Italian: What are ye here for? Are ye here to surrender yer riches?
TEXT.Spanish: What are ye here for? Are ye here to surrender yer riches?

TEXT.English: Yer here? Ye'd better have a whole coffer of gold with ye!
TEXT.French: Toi, ici? Y a intérêt à c'que t'ai un coffre entier d'or avec toi!
TEXT.German: Yer here? Ye'd better have a whole coffer of gold with ye!
TEXT.Italian: Yer here? Ye'd better have a whole coffer of gold with ye!
TEXT.Spanish: Yer here? Ye'd better have a whole coffer of gold with ye!

TEXT.English: Speak, before I spill yer blood!
TEXT.French: Parle, avant que j'fasse couler ton sang!
TEXT.German: Speak, before I spill yer blood!
TEXT.Italian: Speak, before I spill yer blood!
TEXT.Spanish: Speak, before I spill yer blood!

TEXT.English: I don't haggle. What do ye have that could even be of interest?
TEXT.French: Je marchande pas. Qu'est-ce vous pourriez même avoir qui soit intéressant?
TEXT.German: I don't haggle. What do ye have that could even be of interest?
TEXT.Italian: I don't haggle. What do ye have that could even be of interest?
TEXT.Spanish: I don't haggle. What do ye have that could even be of interest?

TEXT.English: I be more used to getting what I want by force, but I guess this isn't that bad of an offer.
TEXT.French: J'ai plus l'habitude de prendre c'que j'veux par la force, mais j'suppose que c'est pas une si mauvaise offre.
TEXT.German: I be more used to getting what I want by force, but I guess this isn't that bad of an offer.
TEXT.Italian: I be more used to getting what I want by force, but I guess this isn't that bad of an offer.
TEXT.Spanish: I be more used to getting what I want by force, but I guess this isn't that bad of an offer.

TEXT.English: Don't think ye can extort me just because ye've been handing me yer gold until now.
TEXT.French: Crois pas qu'tu peux m'extorquer parce que tu m'as gentiment filé ton or jusqu'à maintenant.
TEXT.German: Don't think ye can extort me just because ye've been handing me yer gold until now.
TEXT.Italian: Don't think ye can extort me just because ye've been handing me yer gold until now.
TEXT.Spanish: Don't think ye can extort me just because ye've been handing me yer gold until now.

TEXT.English: I have a counteroffer: hand me yer valuables, before I turn yer waters red.
TEXT.French: J'ai une contre-offre : file moi vos objets de valeur avant que je ne rende vos rivages rouges.
TEXT.German: I have a counteroffer: hand me yer valuables, before I turn yer waters red.
TEXT.Italian: I have a counteroffer: hand me yer valuables, before I turn yer waters red.
TEXT.Spanish: I have a counteroffer: hand me yer valuables, before I turn yer waters red.

TEXT.English: Don't ye get used to it, it probably won't happen again.
TEXT.French: T'habitues pas, ça se reproduira sûrement pas.
TEXT.German: Don't ye get used to it, it probably won't happen again.
TEXT.Italian: Don't ye get used to it, it probably won't happen again.
TEXT.Spanish: Don't ye get used to it, it probably won't happen again.

TEXT.English: I'll let yer people thank ye for letting them live another day.
TEXT.French: J'vais laisser tes gens te r'mercier pour leur avoir permis de vivre un autre jour.
TEXT.German: I'll let yer people thank ye for letting them live another day.
TEXT.Italian: I'll let yer people thank ye for letting them live another day.
TEXT.Spanish: I'll let yer people thank ye for letting them live another day.

TEXT.English: Ye know I won't be giving anything in return next time, right?
TEXT.French: Tu sais que la prochaine fois j'proposerais rien en échange, hein?
TEXT.German: Ye know I won't be giving anything in return next time, right?
TEXT.Italian: Ye know I won't be giving anything in return next time, right?
TEXT.Spanish: Ye know I won't be giving anything in return next time, right?

TEXT.English: Ye know I can always redirect a few ships to yer shores, right?
TEXT.French: Tu sais que j'peux toujours rediriger quelques navires vers tes côtes, hein?
TEXT.German: Ye know I can always redirect a few ships to yer shores, right?
TEXT.Italian: Ye know I can always redirect a few ships to yer shores, right?
TEXT.Spanish: Ye know I can always redirect a few ships to yer shores, right?

TEXT.English: If I didn't have me cannons aimed at yer cities as we speak, I might consider this offer.
TEXT.French: Si j'avais pas mes canons orientés vers vos villes en c'moment, p't'être que j'accepterais cette offre.
TEXT.German: If I didn't have me cannons aimed at yer cities as we speak, I might consider this offer.
TEXT.Italian: If I didn't have me cannons aimed at yer cities as we speak, I might consider this offer.
TEXT.Spanish: If I didn't have me cannons aimed at yer cities as we speak, I might consider this offer.

TEXT.English: I don't haggle, I get what I want or I take it.
TEXT.French: Je marchande pas, j'obtiens c'que j'veux ou j'le prends.
TEXT.German: I don't haggle, I get what I want or I take it.
TEXT.Italian: I don't haggle, I get what I want or I take it.
TEXT.Spanish: I don't haggle, I get what I want or I take it.

TEXT.English: Ye know I can just spill the blood of yer people for that, right?
TEXT.French: Tu sais que j'peux juste faire couler le sang d'tes paysans pour ça, hein?
TEXT.German: Ye know I can just spill the blood of yer people for that, right?
TEXT.Italian: Ye know I can just spill the blood of yer people for that, right?
TEXT.Spanish: Ye know I can just spill the blood of yer people for that, right?

TEXT.English: Now I hope the message got through to ye. Will ye hand me yer gold from now on, or do I have to paint more of yer lands with the blood of yer children?
TEXT.French: Maintenant j'espère que le message est passé. Tu vas m'filer ton or à partir de maintenant, ou faut que j'peigne encore vos terres avec le sang d'vos enfants?
TEXT.German: Now I hope the message got through to ye. Will ye hand me yer gold from now on, or do I have to paint more of yer lands with the blood of yer children?
TEXT.Italian: Now I hope the message got through to ye. Will ye hand me yer gold from now on, or do I have to paint more of yer lands with the blood of yer children?
TEXT.Spanish: Now I hope the message got through to ye. Will ye hand me yer gold from now on, or do I have to paint more of yer lands with the blood of yer children?

TEXT.English: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, so I guess I'll have to haggle this time.
TEXT.French: Mes navires répandent déjà le feu et le sang loin de vos côtes, donc je s'ppose que j'vais devoir marchander pour cette fois.
TEXT.German: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, so I guess I'll have to haggle this time.
TEXT.Italian: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, so I guess I'll have to haggle this time.
TEXT.Spanish: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, so I guess I'll have to haggle this time.

TEXT.English: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, don't waste this opportunity to keep me at bay.
TEXT.French: Mes navires répandent déjà le feu et le sang loin de vos côtes, gaspille pas cette chance de me garder éloigné.
TEXT.German: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, don't waste this opportunity to keep me at bay.
TEXT.Italian: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, don't waste this opportunity to keep me at bay.
TEXT.Spanish: Me ships are already bringing fire and blood far from yer shores, don't waste this opportunity to keep me at bay.

TEXT.English: The legend of Blackheart isn't born by trading for what I want.
TEXT.French: La légende de Blackheart est pas née parce que j'échangeais pour obtenir c'que j'voulais.
TEXT.German: The legend of Blackheart isn't born by trading for what I want.
TEXT.Italian: The legend of Blackheart isn't born by trading for what I want.
TEXT.Spanish: The legend of Blackheart isn't born by trading for what I want.

TEXT.English: Yer goods will soon be mine, I don't have to let ye extort me anymore.
TEXT.French: Tes biens s'ront bientôt à moi, j'ai pas b'soin te laisse m'extorquer plus longtemps.
TEXT.German: Yer goods will soon be mine, I don't have to let ye extort me anymore.
TEXT.Italian: Yer goods will soon be mine, I don't have to let ye extort me anymore.
TEXT.Spanish: Yer goods will soon be mine, I don't have to let ye extort me anymore.

TEXT.English: No blood will be shed for now, it seems.
TEXT.French: Aucun sang ne coulera pour l'instant il semblerait.
TEXT.German: No blood will be shed for now, it seems.
TEXT.Italian: No blood will be shed for now, it seems.
TEXT.Spanish: No blood will be shed for now, it seems.

TEXT.English: Here be what we agreed on, for now.
TEXT.French: V'là ce sur quoi on s'est mit d'accord pour l'instant.
TEXT.German: Here be what we agreed on, for now.
TEXT.Italian: Here be what we agreed on, for now.
TEXT.Spanish: Here be what we agreed on, for now.

TEXT.English: Bah, take it, I'll soon take it back anyway.
TEXT.French: Prends ça, je le récupérerais bientôt de toutes façons.
TEXT.German: Bah, take it, I'll soon take it back anyway.
TEXT.Italian: Bah, take it, I'll soon take it back anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Bah, take it, I'll soon take it back anyway.

TEXT.English: For handing me yer gold 'til now, I think the right to live be more than enough a compensation.
TEXT.French: Pour m'avoir filé ton or jusque-là, j'crois qu'le droit d'vivre est une compensation plus que suffisante.
TEXT.German: For handing me yer gold 'til now, I think the right to live be more than enough a compensation.
TEXT.Italian: For handing me yer gold 'til now, I think the right to live be more than enough a compensation.
TEXT.Spanish: For handing me yer gold 'til now, I think the right to live be more than enough a compensation.

TEXT.English: Taking from me, when I be in trouble? Bahaha, ye could soon get a legend for yerself! Too bad yer dead body will soon serve as a figurehead for me ship.
TEXT.French: Me prendre à moi, pendant que j'ai des ennuis? Hahaha, tu pourrais bientôt avoir ta propre légende! Dommage que ton cadavre servira bientôt de figure de proue à mon navire.
TEXT.German: Taking from me, when I be in trouble? Bahaha, ye could soon get a legend for yerself! Too bad yer dead body will soon serve as a figurehead for me ship.
TEXT.Italian: Taking from me, when I be in trouble? Bahaha, ye could soon get a legend for yerself! Too bad yer dead body will soon serve as a figurehead for me ship.
TEXT.Spanish: Taking from me, when I be in trouble? Bahaha, ye could soon get a legend for yerself! Too bad yer dead body will soon serve as a figurehead for me ship.

TEXT.English: Nah, ye don't understand, I be the one asking for gold, and If ye value the life of those close to ye I advise ye to bring it quickly.
TEXT.French: Nan, tu comprends pas, je suis celui qui demande de l'or, et si t'accordes la moindre valeur à la vie d'tes proches j'te conseille de me l'apporter rapidement.
TEXT.German: Nah, ye don't understand, I be the one asking for gold, and If ye value the life of those close to ye I advise ye to bring it quickly.
TEXT.Italian: Nah, ye don't understand, I be the one asking for gold, and If ye value the life of those close to ye I advise ye to bring it quickly.
TEXT.Spanish: Nah, ye don't understand, I be the one asking for gold, and If ye value the life of those close to ye I advise ye to bring it quickly.

TEXT.English: Take this, it be what I usually give to obedient weaklings.
TEXT.French: Prends ça, c'est c'que j'offre généralement aux gringalets obéissants.
TEXT.German: Take this, it be what I usually give to obedient weaklings.
TEXT.Italian: Take this, it be what I usually give to obedient weaklings.
TEXT.Spanish: Take this, it be what I usually give to obedient weaklings.

TEXT.English: Hand over what I want, and I'll consider delaying the time of yer next payment.
TEXT.French: File moi c'que j'demande, et j'réfléchirais peut-être à retarder le jour d'ton prochain payement.
TEXT.German: Hand over what I want, and I'll consider delaying the time of yer next payment.
TEXT.Italian: Hand over what I want, and I'll consider delaying the time of yer next payment.
TEXT.Spanish: Hand over what I want, and I'll consider delaying the time of yer next payment.

TEXT.English: Yer next payment just got doubled: twice the gold, and twice the price in blood if ye don't have it.
TEXT.French: Ton prochain payement vient de doubler: deux fois plus d'or demandé, et deux fois plus de sang versé si tu l'as pas.
TEXT.German: Yer next payment just got doubled: twice the gold, and twice the price in blood if ye don't have it.
TEXT.Italian: Yer next payment just got doubled: twice the gold, and twice the price in blood if ye don't have it.
TEXT.Spanish: Yer next payment just got doubled: twice the gold, and twice the price in blood if ye don't have it.

TEXT.English: Me ships be closin' in, change yer mind while ye can.
TEXT.French: Mes navires approchent, change d'avis tant que tu l'peux.
TEXT.German: Me ships be closin' in, change yer mind while ye can.
TEXT.Italian: Me ships be closin' in, change yer mind while ye can.
TEXT.Spanish: Me ships be closin' in, change yer mind while ye can.

TEXT.English: A storm be brewing. I'd advise ye to avoid the seas.
TEXT.French: Une tempête approche, j'te conseille d'éviter les mers.
TEXT.German: A storm be brewing. I'd advise ye to avoid the seas.
TEXT.Italian: A storm be brewing. I'd advise ye to avoid the seas.
TEXT.Spanish: A storm be brewing. I'd advise ye to avoid the seas.

TEXT.English: I've come for yer valuables. Don't make me come for yer life, too.
TEXT.French: J'viens pour vos biens, m'fait pas venir aussi pour vos vies.
TEXT.German: I've come for yer valuables. Don't make me come for yer life, too.
TEXT.Italian: I've come for yer valuables. Don't make me come for yer life, too.
TEXT.Spanish: I've come for yer valuables. Don't make me come for yer life, too.

TEXT.English: Give me what I want. I've already got some weak peasants in me sights if ye should refuse.
TEXT.French: Donne moi c'que j'veux, j'ai déjà quelques-uns d'vos paysans faibles en vue si tu refuses.
TEXT.German: Give me what I want. I've already got some weak peasants in me sights if ye should refuse.
TEXT.Italian: Give me what I want. I've already got some weak peasants in me sights if ye should refuse.
TEXT.Spanish: Give me what I want. I've already got some weak peasants in me sights if ye should refuse.

TEXT.English: The legend of Blackheart speaks for itself.
TEXT.French: La légende de Blackheart parle d'elle-même.
TEXT.German: The legend of Blackheart speaks for itself.
TEXT.Italian: The legend of Blackheart speaks for itself.
TEXT.Spanish: The legend of Blackheart speaks for itself.

TEXT.English: Ye know the fate of those who refused before ye did. Don't think ye'll be spared. I'll spill the blood of all those ye love in front of yer eyes.
TEXT.French: Tu sais comment ça a fini pour tout ceux qui ont refusé avant toi. Crois pas qu'tu sera épargné. Je ferais le sang de tous ceux que tu aimes sous tes propres yeux.
TEXT.German: Ye know the fate of those who refused before ye did. Don't think ye'll be spared. I'll spill the blood of all those ye love in front of yer eyes.
TEXT.Italian: Ye know the fate of those who refused before ye did. Don't think ye'll be spared. I'll spill the blood of all those ye love in front of yer eyes.
TEXT.Spanish: Ye know the fate of those who refused before ye did. Don't think ye'll be spared. I'll spill the blood of all those ye love in front of yer eyes.

TEXT.English: Me men already be landing on yer shores. I hope yer not afraid of blood.
TEXT.French: Mes hommes sont déjà en train de débarquer sur vos côtes. J'espère qu'vous avez pas peur du sang.
TEXT.German: Me men already be landing on yer shores. I hope yer not afraid of blood.
TEXT.Italian: Me men already be landing on yer shores. I hope yer not afraid of blood.
TEXT.Spanish: Me men already be landing on yer shores. I hope yer not afraid of blood.

TEXT.English: Ye know the legend of Blackheart. Ye know what's to come.
TEXT.French: Tu connais la légende de Blackheart, tu sais ce qu'il va s'passer.
TEXT.German: Ye know the legend of Blackheart. Ye know what's to come.
TEXT.Italian: Ye know the legend of Blackheart. Ye know what's to come.
TEXT.Spanish: Ye know the legend of Blackheart. Ye know what's to come.

TEXT.English: The %s1:2 refused to pay their due. If ye shed their blood with me, I'll consider letting ye go with some of the loot.
TEXT.French: Les %s1:2 ont refusé de payer. Si vous répandez leur sang avec moi, j'vous laisserais peut-être partir avec une partie du butin.
TEXT.German: The %s1:2 refused to pay their due. If ye shed their blood with me, I'll consider letting ye go with some of the loot.
TEXT.Italian: The %s1:2 refused to pay their due. If ye shed their blood with me, I'll consider letting ye go with some of the loot.
TEXT.Spanish: The %s1:2 refused to pay their due. If ye shed their blood with me, I'll consider letting ye go with some of the loot.

TEXT.English: Ye think ye can get rid of me that easily? I be Blackheart! Favored by the Overlords themselves! For as long as there are seas, I will be there, my legend will live on, and none of ye will ever be safe!
TEXT.French: Vous croyez pouvoir vous débarasser de moi si facilement? je suis Blackheart ! J'ai la faveur des suzerains des abysses en personne ! Tant qu'il y aura des mers, je serais là, ma légende perdurera, et aucun de vous ne sera jamais à l'abri !
TEXT.German: Ye think ye can get rid of me that easily? I be Blackheart! Favored by the Overlords themselves! For as long as there are seas, I will be there, my legend will live on, and none of ye will ever be safe!
TEXT.Italian: Ye think ye can get rid of me that easily? I be Blackheart! Favored by the Overlords themselves! For as long as there are seas, I will be there, my legend will live on, and none of ye will ever be safe!
TEXT.Spanish: Ye think ye can get rid of me that easily? I be Blackheart! Favored by the Overlords themselves! For as long as there are seas, I will be there, my legend will live on, and none of ye will ever be safe!

TEXT.English: Everything in its season as the cycle of nature turns. Now is the time for war.
TEXT.French: Chaque chose a sa saison et se produit lors du cycle de la Nature. Maintenant il est temps de faire la guerre.
TEXT.German: Alles im Kreislauf der Natur geschieht zu einer bestimmten Zeit. Jetzt ist die Zeit für Krieg.
TEXT.Italian: Everything in its season as the cycle of nature turns. Now is the time for war.
TEXT.Spanish: Todo cambia en su estación como el ciclo de la naturaleza. Ahora es la época para la guerra.

TEXT.English: Greetings! You are a welcome neighbor, as long as you respect us and the land we share.
TEXT.French: Salutations ! Vous êtes le bienvenu en tant que voisin tant que vous nous respectez, nous et la terre que nous partageons.
TEXT.German: Wir grüssen Euch! Ihr seid ein willkommener Nachbar, solange Ihr unser Volk und das Land zwischen Euch und uns respektiert.
TEXT.Italian: Greetings! You are a welcome neighbor, as long as you respect us and the land we share.
TEXT.Spanish: Saludos! Sóis bienvenido, vecino, siempre y cuando nos respetéis a nosotros y a las tierras que compartimos.

TEXT.English: Must you traipse about bellowing so? I know you are there. I simply have no desire for your company.
TEXT.French: Avez-vous vraiment besoin de vous acharner à mugir ainsi ? Je sais que vous êtes là. Je n'ai juste pas envie de vous voir.
TEXT.German: Müsst Ihr so dröhnend aufstampfen? Ich weiß, dass Ihr da seid. Ich habe einfach nur keine Lust auf Eure Gesellschaft.
TEXT.Italian: Must you traipse about bellowing so? I know you are there. I simply have no desire for your company.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Debéis deambular entre tanto vocifeo? Sabía que estábais ahí. Simplemente no deseo vuestra compañía.

TEXT.English: Let us now work together to repair the harm suffered by our lands.
TEXT.French: Collaborons maintenant pour réparer les dégâts causés à nos terres.
TEXT.German: Lasst uns nun zusammenarbeiten, um den Schaden zu beheben, den unsere Länder erlitten haben.
TEXT.Italian: Let us now work together to repair the harm suffered by our lands.
TEXT.Spanish: Ahora dejadnos trabajar juntos para sanar las heridas sufridas por nuestras tierras.

TEXT.English: We are gentle creatures by nature, but you have aroused our wrath, and it has yet to be spent.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes des créatures douces par nature, mais vous avez réveillé notre courroux et il doit encore s'exprimer.
TEXT.German: Wir sind von Natur aus nette Wesen, doch Ihr habt unseren Zorn erregt, und er wurde noch nicht vollkommen ausgeschöpft.
TEXT.Italian: We are gentle creatures by nature, but you have aroused our wrath, and it has yet to be spent.
TEXT.Spanish: Somos criaturas amables por naturaleza, pero habéis despertado nuestra ira, y aún no se ha saciado.

TEXT.English: Ah, [CT_NAME]. I was just thinking how much I value your support.
TEXT.French: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Je réfléchissais justement à combien j'évaluais votre soutien.
TEXT.German: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Eben sinnierte ich darüber, wie sehr ich Eure Unterstützung schätze.
TEXT.Italian: Ah, [CT_NAME]. I was just thinking how much I value your support.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah, [CT_NAME]. Justo ahora estaba pensando en cuanto valoro vuestro apoyo.

TEXT.English: It is only a matter of time until your arrogance destroys you, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.French: Ce n'est qu'une question de temps avant que votre arrogance ne vous détruise, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.German: Der Tag wird kommen, an dem Eure Arroganz Euch vernichtet, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Italian: It is only a matter of time until your arrogance destroys you, [CT_NAME].
TEXT.Spanish: Sólo es cuestión de tiempo hasta que vuestra arrogancia os destruya, [CT_NAME].

TEXT.English: You are wise beyond your years.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes sage malgré votre âge.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid weiser als erwartet.
TEXT.Italian: You are wise beyond your years.
TEXT.Spanish: Sois sabio pese a vuestra edad.

TEXT.English: The oak does not bend with every blustering breeze.
TEXT.French: Le chêne ne ploie pas devant une quelconque brise déchaînée.
TEXT.German: Die Eiche beugt sich nicht jedem lauen Frühlingslüftchen.
TEXT.Italian: The oak does not bend with every blustering breeze.
TEXT.Spanish: El roble no se dobla con cada ráfaga de brisa.

TEXT.English: This is not a balanced offer, friend. Please improve upon it.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas une offre équitable, l'ami. Améliorez-la s'il vous plaît.
TEXT.German: Das, lieber Freund, ist keinesfalls ausgewogen. Bitte, besinnt Euch.
TEXT.Italian: This is not a balanced offer, friend. Please improve upon it.
TEXT.Spanish: Esta no es una oferta equilibrada, amigo. Por favor, mejoradla.

TEXT.English: Have you even considered our side at all? Be gone with this insult.
TEXT.French: N'avez-vous donc pas du tout pris en compte notre point de vue ? Partez avec vos insultes.
TEXT.German: Habt Ihr überhaupt an uns gedacht? Nach dieser Kränkung entfernt Ihr Euch besser.
TEXT.Italian: Have you even considered our side at all? Be gone with this insult.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Habéis considerado en algo nuestra parte? Iros con este insulto.

TEXT.English: We would fight you still, but we abhor your presence in these sacred places. Shall we break off?
TEXT.French: Nous vous combattrions bien encore, mais nous abhorrons votre présence en ces lieux sacrés. Pourrions-nous cesser ?
TEXT.German: Wir würden Euch weiter bekämpfen, aber wir verabscheuen Eure Anwesenheit an diesem heiligem Ort. Sollen wir es beenden?
TEXT.Italian: We would fight you still, but we abhor your presence in these sacred places. Shall we break off?
TEXT.Spanish: Seguiríamos luchando contra vos, pues aborrecemos vuestra presencia en estos lugares sagrados. ¿Terminamos con esto?

TEXT.English: You are a true friend, [CT_NAME]. You have our loyalty.
TEXT.French: Vous êtes un vrai ami, [CT_NAME]. Vous avez notre loyauté.
TEXT.German: Ihr seid ein wahrer Freund, [CT_NAME]. Seid Euch unserer Loyalität gewiss.
TEXT.Italian: You are a true friend, [CT_NAME]. You have our loyalty.
TEXT.Spanish: Eres un verdadero amigo, [CT_NAME]. Tienes nuestra lealtad.

TEXT.English: I'm sure you do not wish to challenge the dominance of the elves. Simply tribute us this.
TEXT.French: Je suis sûr que vous ne voulez pas tester la domination des elfes. Donnez nous simplement ce tribut.
TEXT.German: Sicherlich wollt Ihr nicht die Überlegenheit der Elfen bestreiten. Zahlt uns einfach den Tribut.
TEXT.Italian: I'm sure you do not wish to challenge the dominance of the elves. Simply tribute us this.
TEXT.Spanish: Seguro que no deseáis desafiar al dominio de los elfos. Simplemente dadnos tributo con esto.

TEXT.English: There are many people who plot against the Ljosalfar. We ask this to prove your fidelity, friend.
TEXT.French: Il y beaucoup de gens qui intriguent contre les Ljosalfar. Nous vous demandons de prouver votre fidélité, mon ami.
TEXT.German: Viele verschwören sich gegen die Ljosalfar. Wir bitten Euch um dies, als Test Eurer Treue, Freund.
TEXT.Italian: There are many people who plot against the Ljosalfar. We ask this to prove your fidelity, friend.
TEXT.Spanish: Hay mucha gente que conspira en contra de Ljosalfar. Os pedimos esto para probar vuestra fidelidad, amigo.

TEXT.English: Pray, preserve the balance of this age, [CT_NAME]. We need your help to continue.
TEXT.French: Priez, préservez l'équilibre de cet âge, [CT_NAME]. Nous avons besoin de votre aide pour continuer.
TEXT.German: Betet, und schützt das zerbrechliche Gleichgewicht dieser Tage, [CT_NAME]. Wir brauchen Eure Hilfe, um fortzufahren.
TEXT.Italian: Pray, preserve the balance of this age, [CT_NAME]. We need your help to continue.
TEXT.Spanish: Reza, preserva el equilibrio de esta edad, [CT_NAME]. Necesitamos vuestra ayuda para continuar.

TEXT.English: We do not wish war to ravage this land again... But I will do anything to ensure our survival.
TEXT.French: Nous ne souhaitons pas que la guerre ravage à nouveau ce monde3... Mais je ferai tout pour assurer notre survie.
TEXT.German: Wir wünschen keinen Krieg, der dieses Land erneut verwüstet... Aber ich bin zu allem bereit, um unser Überleben zu sichern.
TEXT.Italian: We do not wish war to ravage this land again... But I will do anything to ensure our survival.
TEXT.Spanish: No queremos que la guerra devaste estas tierras otra vez... Pero haré lo que haga falta para asegurar su supervivencia.

TEXT.English: "Nature is truly heartless. Even her champions are feasted on upon our defeat."
TEXT.French: "La Nature est vraiment sans cœur. Même ses champions finissent en festin après notre défaite."
TEXT.German: "Die Natur ist wahrlich herzlos. Selbst an ihren Vorkämpfern wird sie sich nach unserer Niederlage gütlich tun."
TEXT.Italian: "Nature is truly heartless. Even her champions are feasted on upon our defeat."
TEXT.Spanish: "Nature is truly heartless. Even her champions are feasted on upon our defeat."

TEXT.English: The shining legions of the Elven court have unsheathed their graceful blades. They march to purge the rot you have become.
TEXT.French: Les légions étincelantes de la cour Elfe ont dégainé leurs lames gracieuses. Elles sont en marche pour exterminer la pourriture que vous êtes devenus.
TEXT.German: Die Legionen des elfischen Hofes erstrahlen im Glanze gezogener Klingen. Sie marschieren, um den Abschaum zu vernichten, zu dem Ihr geworden seid.
TEXT.Italian: The shining legions of the Elven court have unsheathed their graceful blades. They march to purge the rot you have become.
TEXT.Spanish: Las legiones brillantes de la Corte Élfica han desenvainado sus honorables espadas. Marchan para purgar la podredumbre en la que os habéis convertido.

TEXT.English: Winter has faded and the sun is again warm. You do well to pay homage to the Summer Throne.
TEXT.French: L'hiver s'en est allé et le soleil réchauffe à nouveau. Vous faites bien de rendre hommage au Trône d'Été.
TEXT.German: Der Winter ist vergangen und die Sonne wärmt wieder. Ihr tut gut daran, dem Sommerthron Eure Ehrerbietung zu erweisen.
TEXT.Italian: Winter has faded and the sun is again warm. You do well to pay homage to the Summer Throne.
TEXT.Spanish: El Invierno se ha desvanecido y el sol vuelve a ser cálido. Hacéis bien en rendir homenaje al trono del Verano.

TEXT.English: We know the side you have chosen. Peace between us is sundered.
TEXT.French: Nous savons quel camp vous avez choisi. La paix entre nous est impossible.
TEXT.German: Wir wissen, welche Seite Ihr gewählt habt. Der Friede zwischen uns ist zerbrochen.
TEXT.Italian: We know the side you have chosen. Peace between us is sundered.
TEXT.Spanish: Sabemos el bando que habéis elegido. La paz entre nosotros es imposible.

TEXT.English: The true queen of the elves shall ever welcome her friends into the warmth of her presence.
TEXT.French: La vraie reine des Elfes accueillera toujours ses amis dans la chaleur de sa présence.
TEXT.German: In der Wärme ihrer Anwesenheit heißt die wahre Königin der Elfen ihre Freunde stets willkommen.
TEXT.Italian: The true queen of the elves shall ever welcome her friends into the warmth of her presence.
TEXT.Spanish: La verdadera reina de los Elfos siempre dará la bienvenida a sus amigos ante el calor de su presencia.

TEXT.English: This is not a path you wish to tread, [CT_NAME]. The summer elves reject your threats.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas un chemin que vous souhaitez fouler, [CT_NAME]. Les elfes de l'été ignorent vos menaces.
TEXT.German: Dies ist kein Weg, den Ihr beschreiten wollt, [CT_NAME]. Die Sommerelfen weisen Eure Drohungen zurück.
TEXT.Italian: This is not a path you wish to tread, [CT_NAME]. The summer elves reject your threats.
TEXT.Spanish: Este no es el camino que queréis andar, [CT_NAME]. Los elfos del verano rechazan vuestras amenazas.

TEXT.English: Ominous winds of autumn chill our people, [CT_NAME]. I beg your help to stand against the Winter court.
TEXT.French: Les vents menaçants de l'automne glacent nos gens, [CT_NAME]. J'implore votre aide pour affronter l'Hiver.
TEXT.German: Unheilbringende Herbstwinde lassen unser Volk erzittern, [CT_NAME]. Ich erbitte Eure Hilfe im Kampf gegen den Unseeligen Hof.
TEXT.Italian: Ominous winds of autumn chill our people, [CT_NAME]. I beg your help to stand against the Winter court.
TEXT.Spanish: Vientos siniestros de otoño enfrian a nuestra gente, [CT_NAME]. Os suplico vuestra ayuda para enfrentarnos a la corte del Invierno.

TEXT.English: Do you really think you can stand long as our enemy? Recognize the rightful Lady of this land!
TEXT.French: Pensez-vous vraiment que vous puissiez rester longtemps notre ennemi ? Reconnaissez la légitime Dame de ces terres!
TEXT.German: Meint Ihr wirklich, lange als unser Feind bestehen zu können? Erkennt nun die rechtmäßige Herrscherin dieses Landes!
TEXT.Italian: Do you really think you can stand long as our enemy? Recognize the rightful Lady of this land!
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Creéis realmente que podéis oponeros a nosotros como vuestro enemigo? ¡Reconoced a la legítima Señora de estas tierras!

TEXT.English: Have you seen our golems? Magnificent works of art, examples of the finest craftsmanship known to dwarf. These things can keep going for centuries without tiring and their resilient bodies can tolerate all kinds of weather without getting the least bit rusty. And their power... well, it is almost indescribable, but I assure you that you'll be able to experience it first hand soon...wait, did I forget to mention that?... We declare war, as of this moment.
TEXT.French: Avez-vous vu nos golems ? Magnifiques œuvres d'art, exemples de l'artisanat le plus fin connu des Nains. Ces choses agissent des siècles sans se fatiguer et leur corps résilients peuvent endurer tous les climats sans même rouiller un tant soit peu. Et leur puissance... et bien, elle est quasiment indescriptible, mais nous vous assurons que vous pourrez en faire l'expérience bientôt... Attendez, ai-je oublié de le mentionner ? ... Nous vous déclarons la guerre à compter de cet instant.
TEXT.German: Habt Ihr unsere Golems gesehen? Meisterwerke der Kunst, ein Beispiel für die unvergleichliche Handwerkskunst der Zwerge. Sie kennen keine Müdigkeit, trotzen allen Widrigkeiten, widerstehen Wind und Wetter, ohne zu rosten. Und ihre Stärke... gut, sie ist zwar unbeschreiblich, doch versichere ich Euch, Ihr werdet bald in der Lage sein ihre Stärke aus erster Hand zu erfahren... wartet, vergaß ich etwa, es zu erwähnen...? Ab diesem Moment herrscht Krieg zwischen unseren beiden Völkern.
TEXT.Italian: Have you seen our golems? Magnificent works of art, examples of the finest craftsmanship known to dwarf. These things can keep going for centuries without tiring and their resilient bodies can tolerate all kinds of weather without getting the least bit rusty. And their power... well, it is almost indescribable, but I assure you that you'll be able to experience it first hand soon...wait, did I forget to mention that?... We declare war, as of this moment.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Habéis visto nuestros golems? Magníficas obras de arte, ejemplos de la más sofisticada artesanía conocida por los enanos. Estas cosas siguen funcionando durante siglos sin cansarse y sus cuerpos resistentes pueden tolerar todo tipo de climas sin que les quede el más mínimo trozo de oxido. Y su poder... bueno, es casi indescriptible, pero puedo aseguraros que pronto podréis experimentarlo de primera mano....esperad, ¿olvidé mencionaros eso?... Os declaramos la guerra, desde este mismo momento.

TEXT.English: Excuse our rusty manners, we are more accustomed to fashioned friends than those of tissue and tendon.
TEXT.French: Pardonnez nos manières rustres, nous sommes bien plus habitués à nos amis façonnés qu'à ceux en tissus et tendons.
TEXT.German: Entschuldigt unsere harschen Manieren. Wir sind mehr an unsere selbstgebauten Freunde gewöhnt, als an jene aus Haut und Knochen.
TEXT.Italian: Excuse our rusty manners, we are more accustomed to fashioned friends than those of tissue and tendon.
TEXT.Spanish: Perdonadnos por nuestras costumbres rusticas, estamos más acostumbrados a amigos animados que a esos hechos de tejidos y tendones.

TEXT.English: You wish to speak with us, [CT_NAME]? What a shame. We do not wish to speak with you.
TEXT.French: Vous souhaitez parler avec nous, [CT_NAME] ? Quel dommage. Nous ne souhaitons pas vous parler.
TEXT.German: Ihr wünscht ein Gespräch, [CT_NAME]? Was für eine Schande. Wir wünschen es nicht.
TEXT.Italian: You wish to speak with us, [CT_NAME]? What a shame. We do not wish to speak with you.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Queréis hablar con nosotros, [CT_NAME]? Que escándalo. No deseamos hablar con vos.

TEXT.English: So we are at peace? all well and good? can you please leave me to my experiments now?
TEXT.French: Donc nous sommes en paix ? Tout est bien qui finit bien ? Pouvez-vous me laisser à mes expériences maintenant ?
TEXT.German: Also herrscht jetzt Frieden... schön und gut. Könntet Ihr mich nun wieder meinen Experimenten überlassen?
TEXT.Italian: So we are at peace all well and good can you please leave me to my experiments now?
TEXT.Spanish: Así que estamos en paz... todo bien y viento en popa... ¿ahora podríais, por favor, dejarme con mis experimentos?

TEXT.English: You want peace, eh? Should've thought of that before angering me, I think. We wouldn't want our golems standing idle, would we? Especially not when we can send them to kill annoying people like yourself.
TEXT.French: Vous voulez la paix, hein ? Vous auriez du y penser avant de m'énerver. Nous ne voudrions pas que nos golems restent inoccupés, n'est-ce pas ? Surtout lorsque nous pouvons les envoyer tuer des gens agaçants tels que vous.
TEXT.German: Frieden wollt Ihr, he? Darüber hättet eigentlich Ihr nachdenken sollen, bevor Ihr mich verärgert habt. Ihr würdet doch nicht wollen, dass unsere Golems unbeschäftigt bleiben, oder? Besonders nicht, wenn wir sie ausschicken können, um lästiges Pack wie Euch zu zerquetschen.
TEXT.Italian: You want peace, eh? Should've thought of that before angering me, I think. We wouldn't want our golems standing idle, would we? Especially not when we can send them to kill annoying people like yourself.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Queréis paz, eh? Deberíais haberlo pensado antes de hacerme enfadar, creo. No querríamos que nuestros golems se quedaran sin trabajo, ¿verdad? Especialmente no cuando podemos enviarlos para matar a gente molesta como vos.

TEXT.English: Hello again, [CT_NAME]. What business do you have with the Luchuirp?
TEXT.French: Re-bonjour, [CT_NAME]. Quelle affaire désirez-vous traiter avec les Luchuirps ?
TEXT.German: Seid gegrüßt, [CT_NAME]. Was führt Euch zu den Luchuirp?
TEXT.Italian: Hello again, [CT_NAME]. What business do you have with the Luchuirp?
TEXT.Spanish: Hola de nuevo, [CT_NAME]. ¿Qué negocios tenéis con los Luchuirp?

TEXT.English: Ahh! Why do you keep pestering me?! How am I to get any research done at this rate, can you tell me that? No? Then I propose you tell me why you've chosen to disturb me once again. I hope for your sake that it is important... very important.
TEXT.French: Ahh ! Pourquoi me harcelez-vous ?! Comment puis-je effectuer mes recherches à ce train là, pouvez-vous me le dire ? Non ? Alors je propose que vous me disiez pourquoi vous avez choisi de me déranger encore une fois. J'espère pour vous que c'est important... très important.
TEXT.German: Ahh! Warum belästigt Ihr mich weiter?! Wie soll ich bei diesem Tempo meine Forschung zu Ende bringen, könnt Ihr mir das mal sagen? Nein? Dann schlage ich vor, Ihr erklärt, warum Ihr mich schon wieder stört. Ich hoffe um Euretwillen, das es wichtig ist... sehr wichtig.
TEXT.Italian: Ahh! Why do you keep pestering me?! How am I to get any research done at this rate, can you tell me that? No? Then I propose you tell me why you've chosen to disturb me once again. I hope for your sake that it is important ... very important.
TEXT.Spanish: Ahh! ¡¿Por qué continuáis molestándome?! ¿Cómo voy a conseguir terminar una investigación a este ritmo, podéis decirmelo? ¿No? Entonces os propongo que me contéis por qué habéis elegido perturbarme una vez más. Espero por vuestro bien que sea importante... muy importante.

TEXT.English: What is it?... that?... sure you can, why not?
TEXT.French: Quoi ? ... ça ? ... Bien sur que vous pouvez, pourquoi pas ?
TEXT.German: Bitte, wie...? Das da...? Sicher könnt Ihr, weshalb nicht?
TEXT.Italian: What is it?... that?... sure you can, why not?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿De qué se trata?... ¿Eso?... por supuesto, porqué no.

TEXT.English: Hee hee. Hahaha. Oh sorry, but that is not a wall you are leaning against as you threaten me.
TEXT.French: Hi hi hi. Ha ha ha. Oh désolé, mais ce n'est pas un mur auqeul vous faites face tandis que vous me menacez.
TEXT.German: Hihi, hahaha. Oh, entschuldigt, aber das ist keine Wand, an die Ihr Euch lehnt, während Ihr mich bedroht.
TEXT.Italian: Hee hee. Hahaha. Oh sorry, but that is not a wall you are leaning against as you threaten me.
TEXT.Spanish: Hi hi. Hahaha. Oh perdón, pero eso no es un muro al que estáis apoyado pues me estáis amenazando a mí.

TEXT.English: No can do, I'm afraid. It would violate our principles of fair trading.
TEXT.French: Cela ne se peut, j'en ai peur. Ça violerait nos principes de marché équitable.
TEXT.German: So gehts nicht. Ich fürchte, das würde unsere Prinzipien des fairen Handels verletzten.
TEXT.Italian: No can do, I'm afraid. It would violate our principles of fair trading.
TEXT.Spanish: No, me temo que no. Violaría nuestros principios de comercio justo.

TEXT.English: Heh, you must think the Luchuirp foolish. Of course such a deal is impossible. Now, please stop disturbing me.
TEXT.French: Hé, vous devrez prendre les Luchuirp pour des idiots. Bien sûr qu'un tel marché est impossible. Maintenant, ne me dérangez plus je vous prie.
TEXT.German: Heh, Ihr haltet die Luchuirp zum Narren. Natürlich ist ein solcher Vertrag unmöglich. Jetzt hört auf, mich zu belästigen.
TEXT.Italian: Heh, you must think the Luchuirp foolish. Of course such a deal is impossible. Now, please stop disturbing me.
TEXT.Spanish: Je, debes creer que los Luchuirp son tontos. Por supuesto, un trato como ese es imposible. Ahora, por favor, dejad de molestarme.

TEXT.English: Ahh! I am sick and tired of war! We just want to be left in peace, why won't you let us be? Seeing our creations employed for such destructive purposes, and often destroyed in the process, is very aggravating. Let us end this now!
TEXT.French: Ahh ! Je suis dégoûté et fatigué de la guerre ! Nous voulons seulement être en paix, pourquoi ne nous laisseriez-vous pas l'être ? Voir nos créations employées pour de telles destructions, et souvent détruites dans l'action, est très usant. Finissons-en maintenant !
TEXT.German: Ahh! Ich habe den Krieg satt! Wir wollen einfach nur in Frieden gelassen werden, warum wollt Ihr uns das nicht zugestehen? Zu sehen, wie unsere Kreationen für solch destruktive Ziele eingesetzt werden und dabei oftmals zerstört werden, ist mehr als ärgerlich. Lasst es uns jetzt beenden!
TEXT.Italian: Ahh! I am sick and tired of war! We just want to be left in peace, why won't you let us be? Seeing our creations employed for such destructive purposes, and often destroyed in the process, is very aggravating. Let us end this now!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Ahh! ¡Me siento cansado y enfermo de esta guerra! Sólo queremos que nos dejen en paz, ¿por qué no queréis dejarnos a nuestro aire? Ver nuestras creaciones utilizadas para propósitos tan destructivos, y también destruidos en el proceso, resulta muy exasperante. ¡Terminemos ya con esto!

TEXT.English: Gee, thanks.
TEXT.French: Hé ben, merci.
TEXT.German: Klar doch, danke.
TEXT.Italian: Gee, thanks.
TEXT.Spanish: Ey, gracias.

TEXT.English: This is what we need. And this... is what will happen to you if we do not get it.
TEXT.French: C'est ce dont nous avons besoin. Et ceci... est ce qu'il vous arrivera si nous ne l'obtenons pas.
TEXT.German: Das ist, was wir brauchen. Und das... wird mit Euch geschehen, wenn wir es nicht bekommen.
TEXT.Italian: This is what we need. And this... is what will happen to you if we do not get it.
TEXT.Spanish: Esto es lo que necesitamos. Y esto... es lo que os ocurrirá si no lo tenemos.

TEXT.English: Sorry to bother you, but the Luchuirp greatly need this, probably more than your people do.
TEXT.French: Désolé de vous déranger, mais les Luchuirp ont grand besoin de ceci, probablement plus que votre peuple.
TEXT.German: Verzeiht die Störung, aber die Luchuirp brauchen das dringend, womöglich sogar dringender als Euer Volk.
TEXT.Italian: Sorry to bother you, but the Luchuirp greatly need this, probably more than your people do.
TEXT.Spanish: Siento molestaros, pero Luchuirp necesita esto enormemente, probablemente más que vuestra gente.

TEXT.English: Hello there. Uh I wondered if could you spare this for us please?
TEXT.French: Salut tout l'monde! Heu Je me demandais si vous pouviez nous accorder ceci s'il vous plaît?
TEXT.German: Hallo, Ihr da. Äh... wenn Ihr... könntet Ihr... wärt Ihr so freundlich, und teilt das mit uns... bitte?
TEXT.Italian: Hello there. Uh I wondered if could you spare this for us please?
TEXT.Spanish: Que tal. Oh...me preguntaba si...podríais prestarnos esto...¿por favor?

TEXT.English: Well, I had hoped to save my beauties some wear and tear, but with your refusal looks like we'll get to see them in action sooner or later.
TEXT.French: Bien, j'eût espéré épargner à mes beautés l'usure et les larmes, mais votre refus semble signifier que nous les verrons en l'action tôt ou tard.
TEXT.German: Wohlan, hoffte ich doch, meinen Maiden Tand und Schmuck zu sichern, aber Eure Ablehnung wird wohl dazu führen, dass wir ihre Talente früher oder später hautnah erleben dürfen.
TEXT.Italian: Well, I had hoped to save my beauties some wear and tear, but with your refusal looks like we'll get to see them in action sooner or later.
TEXT.Spanish: Bueno, esperaba ahorrarles algún que otro desgaste a mis preciosidades, pero con vuestro rechazo parece que tendremos que verlos en acción antes de lo esperado.

TEXT.English: "All our wonderful creations, destroyed. Why have you done this?"
TEXT.French: "Toutes nos magnifiques créations, détruites ! Pourquoi avez-vous fait cela ?"
TEXT.German: "All unsere wundervollen Schöpfungen..., zerstört! Warum habt Ihr das getan?"
TEXT.Italian: "All our wonderful creations, destroyed. Why have you done this?"
TEXT.Spanish: "All our wonderful creations, destroyed. Why have you done this?"

TEXT.English: When I look at you, I cannot see light. Your soul is dark and twisted, your empire the same. The time has come for the Malakim to fulfill our obligation and destroy your civilization. The sun will burn your impure nations to cinders, only to be rebuilt in its glorious light. Dawn has come in all its glittering glory, and you will do best to avert your eyes.
TEXT.French: Lorsque je vous regarde, je ne perçois point la lumière. Votre âme est obscure et torturée, de même que votre empire. Le temps est venu pour les Malakims de s'acquitter de nos obligations et de détruire votre civilisation. Le Soleil réduira votre nation impure en cendres, pour le reconstruire dans sa glorieuse lumière. L'aube vient à tous dans son scintillement glorieux, et vous feriez mieux de protéger vos yeux.
TEXT.German: Schaue ich Euch an, so kann ich kein Licht, ja nicht einmal einen Schimmer davon entdecken. Eure kranke, dunkle Seele gleicht Eurem Imperium. Für uns Malakim ist nun die Zeit gekommen, unserer Verpflichtung, der Bestimmung unseres Volkes nachzukommen und Euch zu vernichten. Die Sonne wird Eure befleckte Nation bis auf die Grundmauern niederbrennen, nur um sie in ihrem glorreichem Licht wiederauferstehen zu lassen! Seht her, die Sonne ist in all ihrer Pracht aufgegangen. Ihr tätet gut daran, Eure Augen ein letztes mal zu bedecken.
TEXT.Italian: When I look at you, I cannot see light. Your soul is dark and twisted, your empire the same. The time has come for the Malakim to fulfill our obligation and destroy your civilization. The sun will burn your impure nations to cinders, only to be rebuilt in its glorious light. Dawn has come in all its glittering glory, and you will do best to avert your eyes.
TEXT.Spanish: Cuando os miro, no puedo ver luz. Vuestra alma es oscura y retorcida, al igual que vuestro imperio. Para los Malakim ha llegado el momento de cumplir con nuestra obligación y destruir vuestra civilización. El sol reducirá vuestras impuras naciones a cenizas, sólo para ser reconstruidas en su gloriosa luz. El alba ha llegado en toda su reluciente gloria, y lo mejor será que apartéis vuestros ojos.

TEXT.English: As dawn marks the beginning of day, whose outcome is unknown, so does our friendship start here.
TEXT.French: Comme l'aube marque le début d'un jour dont le dénouement est inconnu, ainsi commence notre amitié.
TEXT.German: So wie die Dämmerung den neuen Tag beginnt, so soll dieses Treffen der Beginn unserer Freundschaft sein.
TEXT.Italian: As dawn marks the beginning of day, whose outcome is unknown, so does our friendship start here.
TEXT.Spanish: Así como el alba marca el inicio del día, cuyo resultado es desconocido, de la misma manera nuestra amistad comienza aquí.

TEXT.English: You walk in the darkness, [CT_NAME]. Our path is too bright for you.
TEXT.French: Vous marchez dans les ténèbres, [CT_NAME]. Notre chemin est trop lumineux pour vous.
TEXT.German: Ihr wandelt in Dunkelheit gehüllt, [CT_NAME]. Unser Weg ist in Licht getaucht.
TEXT.Italian: You walk in the darkness, [CT_NAME]. Our path is too bright for you.
TEXT.Spanish: Camináis en la oscuridad, [CT_NAME]. Nuestro camino es demasiado luminoso para vos.

TEXT.English: It gladdens my heart that we have come to this agreement. Peace is more pleasant than warfare, and less expensive. Let us hope the sun will illumine our two nations for many years to come.
TEXT.French: Ça me réchauffe le cœur que vous et moi soyons arrivés à cet arrangement. La paix est plus plaisante que la guerre, et bien moins onéreuse. Espérons que le soleil illuminera nos deux nations pour les nombreuses années à venir.
TEXT.German: Es beglückt mein Herz, dass wir zu einer Einigung gekommen sind. Der Friede ist wohltuender als der Krieg, und weniger kostenspielig. Lasst uns hoffen, dass die Sonne unsere beiden Nationen allzeit erhellt.
TEXT.Italian: It gladdens my heart that we have come to this agreement. Peace is more pleasant than warfare, and less expensive. Let us hope the sun will illumine our two nations for many years to come.
TEXT.Spanish: Me alegra de corazón que hayamos llegado a este acuerdo. La paz es más agradable que la guerra, y menos cara. Esperemos que el sol ilumine nuestras dos naciones todos los próximos años.

TEXT.English: I am afraid it is too late to turn back now. Our soldiers are on the march, the light has illumined their path, and they are determined to eliminate the dread shadow that your nation casts over these lands. Your people will surely be happier once they find themselves in sunlight once again.
TEXT.French: J'ai bien peur qu'il soit trop tard pour faire demi-tour. Nos soldats sont en marche, la lumière a illuminé leur chemin, et ils sont déterminés à éliminer l'effroyable ombre de vote nation qui recouvre ces terres. Votre peuple sera sûrement plus heureux une fois qu'ils se retrouveront dans la lumière du Soleil.
TEXT.German: Für einen Rückzieher ist es zu spät. Unsere Soldaten marschieren auf einer Schneise des Lichtes, um den Schatten der Furcht, den Eure Nation auf diese Lande wirft, zu beseitigen. Euer Volk wird sich sicher glücklich schätzen, wenn es wieder in Licht getaucht ist.
TEXT.Italian: I am afraid it is too late to turn back now. Our soldiers are on the march, the light has illumined their path, and they are determined to eliminate the dread shadow that your nation casts over these lands. Your people will surely be happier once they find themselves in sunlight once again.
TEXT.Spanish: Me temo que ya es demasiado tarde para echarnos atrás. Nuestros soldados están en marcha, la luz ilumina su camino, y están decididos a eliminar la terrible sombra que vuestra nación ha cernido sobre estas tierras. Vuestra gente seguramente será más feliz una vez que se encuentren bajo el brillo del sol de nuevo.

TEXT.English: Greetings again, [CT_NAME]. As ever, your presence brings light to our lands. What can the Malakim do for you?
TEXT.French: Nouvelles salutations, [CT_NAME]. Comme toujours, votre présence apporte la lumière sur nos terres. Que peuvent les Malakims pour vous ?
